186368.name: Bacterionomicon
186368.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bacterionomicon is an artbook bestiary, with entries for 41 “Lords of Pestilence” (infectious bacteria) and 27 “Apothecary Healers” (antibiotics). It’s a spinoff from, and expansion of, a card game called “Healing Blade: Infectious Disease Card Battle” – but you don’t need to have played the game to enjoy the book!

186370.name: Camel Up: The Referee Camel
186370.description:
From the rules sheet:

The organizers of the race feel annoyed by the strange habit of the Camels to form stacks and carry each other along. To prevent this from now on, they introduce the Referee Camel.

The game is played as usual. At the beginning of each Leg, the player to the right of the player owning the Leg Starting Player marker places the Referee Camel onto any free space of the Race track.

When a Camel unit ends its movement on the space of the Referee Camel, all Camels of that unit are asked to "unstack" and to line up next to each other on that space. The Camels are "unstacked" from top to bottom and are lined up in the same order from left to right. (Therefore, the Camel on top is placed on the very left at the edge of the board and continues to be the leading camel of the former unit.)

Once all Camels of the unit have been "unstacked" (or a single Camel has landed on the space), the Referee Camel is removed from the Race track and placed next to the Game board. It enters the game again at the beginning of the next Leg (see above).

This small expansion can be added to the Camel Up base game as well as the expansion Supercup.

rpg: Domicile: A Narrative Roleplaying Game of Supernatural Mystery
186371.name: Domicile: A Narrative Roleplaying Game of Supernatural Mystery
186371.description:
Domicile is a narrative roleplaying game of supernatural mystery and haunting. It takes it's inspiration from the haunted house genera of film and fiction. In it players take on the roles of average everyday people caught up in explicable events of suddenly finding themselves caught in a haunted house.

So Do You Believe in Ghosts?

186373.name: Black Sun Deathcrawl
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186373.description:
From the back cover:

You are The Cursed - remnants of life in a universe of decay. Cannibalistic parasites, you suck a meager existence from the corpse of a long dead reality. No names, no races, your only goal to dig deeper into the earth to escape the rays of the Black Sun that will eventually extinguish what little remains.

186374.name: Jazz Core (Version 3.0)
186374.description:
User summary:

Jazz Core provides the basic rules for a generic, universal game system. It is assumed that Jazz Core will be supplemented with a "genre module" for Jazz of which several were contemplated but not produced beyond the starting stages.

Characters in Jazz are defined by Concept, Motivation, and Descriptors. It is suggested that characters have one Flaw. Health Points and Fringe Points also are determined. Each Descriptor has an associated Fiction Level ("Mundane", "Exceptional", "Elite", "Heroic", "Legendary", or "Mythic"). The Fiction Level determines how many dice are associated with the Descriptor. The first Descriptor is the Primary Descriptor--the broad, main character type; other Descriptors are Secondary Descriptors. Some characters will have Fringe Descriptors that allow them "powers beyond the realm of what most other characters can do". Characters also are assumed to have numerous Universal Descriptors which are things that "everybody" from their cultural period can do ("Drive a Car" or "Use a Telephone").

Combat is fairly abstracted with few modifiers. Damage is determined using d6; unarmed strikes do 1d2, frag grenades do 3d6. Armor reduces damage; thick padding -1, Heavy Assault Force Screen -10.

186375.description:
TOKAIDO is a game for 2 to 5 players, with unique atmosphere and aesthetics, in which the players are pilgrims on a journey along the legendary East Sea Road of Japan. Along the way, you will try to collect the most beautiful souvenirs, discover glorious vistas, enjoy enriching encounters, soak in soothing hot springs, sample sumptuous cuisine, and much more!

The Deluxe Edition is the post-Kickstarter public release of parts of the Tokaido Collector's Edition . It does not have all the character tiles and miniatures available in the Collectors Edition, nor are the character miniatures painted. The Tokaido: Matsuri expansion is also not included in this edition.

This version does include:
- the bigger box of the Collectors Edition
- the giant board of the Collectors Edition
- all cards for Tokaido
- all cards for Crossroads
- 16 character tiles (Tokaido + Crossroads)
- 16 unpainted figurines (Tokaido + Crossroads)
- 5 point markers
- 5 color bases
- metal coins + fabric bag
- soundtrack CD
- Crossroads wooden die
- Tokaido + Crossroads rulebooks
186375.name: Tokaido Deluxe Edition

186376.name: Jazz Core (Version 2.2)
186376.description:
User summary:

Jazz Core provides the basic rules for a generic, universal game system. It is assumed that Jazz Core will be supplemented with a "genre module" for Jazz of which several were contemplated but only JazzSupers was produced.

Characters in Jazz are defined by Concept and Ability. Each Ability has a number of "dots" which give a visual indication of how capable the character is with that attribute. Characters will distribute from 25 to 75 "dots" depending on the type of game being run. Characters also have Complications, which describe non-ideal aspects or relationships. Some character build options yield additional "dots", such as writing a Background or taking a substantial Complication. Characters also have Traits which represent areas in which the character has special training or ability. Traits have numeric ratings from 1-7. Characters are assumed to have several Universal Traits which are "things generally known by everyone in a specific culture or time period" (Driving, Native Language, etc.). Characters may also have Talents, which are exceptional abilities (Night Vision, Danger Sense, etc.).

Action resolution depends upon a dice pool of D6. The number of dice in the pool will depend upon the underlying Attribute, Trait, or Talent and its rating.

186377.name: JazzSupers (Version 2.2)
186377.description:
User summary:

JazzSupers (Version 2.2) is a genre module for Jazz and requires the use of Jazz Core (Version 2.2). Numerous genre modules were contemplated but only JazzSupers was produced.

The rules detail how many "dots" are used during character build (30-60, depending on the campaign) and lists numerous Powers which are special Descriptors for the genre. Most of the Powers receive a definition including cost, duration, range, target, and notes.

186378.name: Lingua-bank
186378.description:
Throw the die and move your pawn between the shops. Take a card with a letter, you have to say a word in 20 seconds, which begins with the letter taken and you can find in the shop you finished the movement. If you win, you earn money; if you lose, you leave your money.

Whoever earns the most money wins.

186379.description:
The notebook is a special 50-pages booklet with printed sheets that will allow you to keep track off the cards you have explored should you ever need to retrace your steps.

Separate add-on during Kickstarter campaign.
186379.name: The 7th Continent: Cartographer's Notebook

186380.name: Jazz Genre Modules (Version 3.0)
186380.description:
Jazz Core Version 3.0 is a generic, universal system that is intended to be capable of supporting any genre. The game has Genre Modules that are used as "plug in" sources to adapt the Jazz Core Version 3.0 rules to a specific genre. The game suggests a mix-and-match approach for cross-genre gaming. The various Genre Modules, however, unfortunately are mostly poorly defined and incomplete. They include:


JazzApocalypse - concise Descriptor lists
JazzFurry - stub entry
JazzPsychic - concise Descriptor lists, Flaws
JazzSorcery - stub entry
JazzStar - stub entry
JazzSteampunk - Descriptor lists
JazzSupers - concise Descriptor lists
JazzVoodoo - stub entry
JazzWizardry - stub entry

186381.description:
Fear the Devourers is the second gameplay add-on for The 7th Continent.

Beware of the insatiable Devourers!
Once they have your scent, these terrifying beasts will hunt you to the ends of the continent, erupting out of the ground at any moment!

Kickstarter Optional Buy. 7 Rock Worm figures, 30 cards.
186381.name: The 7th Continent: Fear the Devourers

186382.name: Kaichin
boardgamepublisher: ペンとサイコロ (Pen and Dice)
186382.description:
User summary:
かいちん (Kaichin) is the name of Japanese sweet made by Ishikawaya-Honpo. This is a noted confectioner in the Ishikawa prefecture in Japan, and the shapes and designs of their sweets are special. The game designer was given permission to use the Kaichin name (it means marble chip) and designs in this game. The game comes with Japanese and English rules.

The game itself is a simple abstract game. Players are secretly dealt cards corresponding to two of the 12 sweets in the game, and another card for one of the 6 colours. You win by moving a specific Kaichin chip that you have the card for across the board to its destination.

Otherwise, the game ends when there are no more available spaces on the board (some empty spaces might be blocked). In that case, the player holding the colour card with the most colour chips on the board wins. The tie breaker is the player furthest clockwise from the start player.

On your turn, you may either move any Kaichin chip, or make an attack. Kaichin chips can move one space (not occupied by another Kaichin chip) and then you place a matching colour chip under it. A Kaichin chip can leapfrog a single adjacent Kaichin chip, but cannot move onto or over any Damage chips. A Kaichin chip can move two spaces, if the first space has a colour chip of its colour. If a Kaichin chip ends on a colour chip of the wrong colour, that gets swapped out.

Damage chips are placed when an Attack occurs. If they hold the matching Kaichin card, a player simply declares a Kaichin chip is the attacker, and damage is assessed in 1 of the 6 directions around the attacker. Only the first Kaichin chip on a line that is vulnerable suffers damage. A Kaichin chip under attack is flipped to show a black border and a black damage chip is swapped under it. If a Kaichin chip suffers two damages in the game, it is eliminated. Kaichin chips not in play yet are immune but cannot attack. Damage chips are never removed.

During the game, nobody declares ownership of any Kaichin chip. During an attack, the player making the attack simply damages the target Kaichin. Only when the game ends can you discover who owned which Kaichin.

Publisher's summary:
「かいちん」とは、金沢の昔の方言で「おはじき」という意味だそうです。
ゲームタイトルは、金沢「石川屋本舗」様のお菓子の名前です。
「石川屋本舗」様に許可を頂き、タイトル・チップデザインに砂糖菓子「かいちん」のデザインを取り入れたゲームを作りました。
ゲームは「陣取り＋旗取り＋正体隠匿」のハードな造りですが、きらびやかにお菓子を並べて、その美しさもお楽しみ下さい。

プレイヤーはあらかじめ「かいちん」カード（2枚）と、「色」カード（1枚）を配られます。
このカードの内容はゲーム終了まで他プレイヤーに公開しません。

プレイヤーは以下のいずれかで勝利を狙います。
・自分のカードの「かいちん」チップをゴール（スタート地点の対面）まで移動する
・全てのマスが埋まった際に、自分の「色」チップが最大面積となる

プレイヤーは「かいちん」を「移動」あるいは「攻撃」できます。
「かいちん」は移動するごとに、足跡のように「色」チップを置いていくので、これで盤を埋めていきます。
他プレイヤーに気付かれずに「かいちん」を移動するか、盤を埋め尽くすか。
シンプルながら駆け引きの悩ましいゲームです。

186385.description: The Army Book: Lahnars is a supplement for Confrontation: The Age of the Rag’narok. It contains everything you need to play with or battle against the Lahnars (Lions).
186385.name: Confrontation: Lahnars Army Book
boardgameexpansion: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok

186386.name: The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service – Full-body Figures
boardgameaccessory: The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service
186386.description: A kickstarter-exclusive "optional buy" accessory for The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service, this accessory includes six full-body figures for the six different Gentlemen (the original four from the game, plus the two kickstarter-exclusive additions).

186387.description:
A kickstarter-exclusive expansion to The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service, consisting of two additional Gentlemen - Suzanne Taylor and Colonel Steel - and four additional Agents - The Puppet, The Mad Scientist, The Comedian and The Hybrid - each with their own card and effect.

Also includes agent cards for all six gentlemen, and all cards in a foil version.
186387.name: The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service – Gentleman Pack
boardgameexpansion: The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service

186388.name: DaRKLIGHT
186388.description:
From the introduction:

DaRKLIGHT

A Single Session Mage: The Ascension / Wraith: The Oblivion Module for 6 Characters

for Necronomicon ‘97

Darklight is a game which was run at the Necronomicon 1997 convention in Sydney, Australia. It was written by James O'Rance, playtested by Philippa Borland, Craig Delamotte, Leefe Hicks, Jayne Malcolm, Fred Munier, and Richard Warner. It was run by James O'Rance, Craig Delamotte, and Martin Hills.

Basically, darklight is a ghost story that involves Mages; people who can change reality.

Warning: Due to sensitive issues such as racism, abuse, and suicide, reader discretion is advised.

User summary:

The self-published convention module was hosted and freely distributed by Ariel Archive for several years.

186389.name: The Labyrinth of Cards
boardgamepublisher: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)
186389.description:
User summary:
In the game カードの迷宮 (The Labyrinth of Cards), players explore a six-floor deep labyrinth. In each floor, there is treasure whose value is hidden until someone explores that floor. You collect that treasure if you commit most effort to exploring that floor.

The game is played like blind auction, but six floors are auctioned simultaneously. You may play an exploration card, which indicates how much effort you commit, face-down on your current floor or on a deeper floor, but once you explore a deeper floor, you may not go back to an upper floor.

At the end of the round, count up the treasure values players have collected. The player with higher total wins the round. You have to win two rounds to win the game.

With four players, the game is team battle (2 players vs. 2 players).

Publisher's summary:
カードの迷宮は【後戻りができない】地下迷宮を探検すると言うテーマのゲームです。探検がテーマですがやることは競りゲームです。探検の労力をより多く割けば地下迷宮から財宝が得られるでしょう。財宝をより多く獲得すればラウンドで勝利となります。２つのラウンドで勝てればゲームの勝利になります。４人プレイの場合はチーム戦になります。

186390.name: Asterland
186390.description:
From the introduction:

Asterland is an invented fantasy setting within the fictional world called Jera.

There are several ideas that give Asterland a different feel from other fantasy realms. These include:


Magic Is Common
The Lines Between Magic and Technology Blur
A Steampunk Feel


User summary:

Asterland on the World of Jera is a fantasy setting developed originally for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons. The setting is not tightly coupled to that game, however, and could be easily adapted to any fantasy game system.

The setting is presented as a series of HTML pages with these major divisions: Introduction, Setting, Culture & People, Places, History, and Races & Creatures. In addition, a Gamemaster Resources page includes several system-agnostic adventures (primarily narrative elements), setting-specific fiction, and additional tools.

rpg: Joke! The High School Anime Role-Playing Game
186391.name: Joke! The High School Anime Role-Playing System
186391.description:
User summary:

Joke! is a rules-light satire game based in an American high school setting. Characters start with a written history, then have eight "Stats" (Muscle, Agility, Smarts, Brains, Will, Meta, Looks, and Luck) that are randomly generated with a "Numeric" ranging from 1-6. Characters also select "5 or 6" Skills, probably based on their best Stats, and note down their Numeric. Characters also have a few other data scores like Hit Points. The action resolution system (which includes combat) uses a d6 roll against a Skill or Stat. During play, characters gain Credits which can be used to improve Skills or Stats.

186393.name: Kagematsu (Playtest Version)
186393.description:
From the introduction:

Kagematsu takes place in Japan, 1472, in and around a small unnamed village. This period was known as the Onin no Ran, and it was a time of internal strife. Most of the village’s men have gone off to war, leaving the women, children, elderly, and infirm to fend for themselves. Now a dangerous threat casts its shadow over the village, and without a defender, its people are almost certainly doomed.

Enter Kagematsu, a wayward samurai fleeing a troubled past. Here is a defender, if only he can be swayed from his course. So it is that several young women conspire among themselves to win his affections...

186394.name: Classes of Distinction
186394.description:
From publisher blurb:

A matter of class!

Inside are new class options to make your PCs more unique and interesting for your 5th Edition campaign. It includes a new option for barbarians, bards, druids, rangers, rogues, sorcerers, and wizards.

186395.name: Catan Scenarios: Big Game Big Honor
186395.description:
The exclusive mini-expansion for participants of the Catan Big Game.

If they pay 1 wool or 1 grain, players can send "settlers" to participate in the Big Game represented by a game table with slots for each of the ten production numbers. The first player to place three settlers on the table receives a bonus victory point that (similar to Greatest Army or Longest Road) has to be passed on if another player surpasses him.

If the Big Game table is full, new settlers may displace settlers already on the table - the production dice are rolled to determine where the new settler is placed.

Whenever the production number of a settler at the Big Game table is rolled, the player receives a laurel token. Laurel tokens can be exchanged for game benefits:

One laurel token will send the robber back to the desert.
Two laurel tokens let the player steal a card from the hand of another player.
Three laurel tokens let you choose a resource card from the bank.
Four laurel tokens let you build a road.
Five laurel tokens let you take a development card.

186397.name: Kalyr
186397.description:
Kalyr - A GURPS Game World

From the introduction:

The ancient kandar civilisation of Kalyr has stood for a thousand years, protected by the watchful eyes of the Guardians.

But now their long reign is threatened. The human slaves, kidnapped across the dimensions generations ago, tire of servitude and beginning to rebel. Beyond the lands of kandar rule, barbarian kingdoms descended from runaway slaves grow in strength. All the time. the long- running war with the mountain- dwelling zughru slowly wears them down.

In the decadent kandar cities, political, religious and guild factions scheme and plot as they have always done. The honour of the clan, and the status in the guild matter above all!

The wizards are worried. Some of their number have detected something strange happening with the fabric of space and time. Have the mirrors reopened? Will the horrors of ancient times return again?

User summary:

The campaign world was developed primarily for GURPS but has also been adapted to FUDGE. Both systems are fully supported by the setting. A method for converting from GURPS to FUDGE also is provided.

186398.name: Kathanaksaya
186398.description:
User summary:

Kathanaksaya is a story-based role-playing game with very lightweight mechanics. Players gain Story Points which are earned during narration and can be spent in bids to control narrative outcomes whenever there is a potential disagreement over the way the narrative should transpire. Characters without remaining story points suffer the whims of narrative development. Characters generally take turns being the narrative focus while a single player assumes the duties of controlling the world and over-arching narrative.

Note the author's name is listed in the rules as "Green" (which otherwise might prove a little confusing).

186399.name: Supreme League of Patriots - Episode 1: A Patriot Is Born
186399.description:
Out-of-work actor Kyle Keever is determined to get his big break on America’s biggest new reality TV show, ‘America’s Got Superpowers’. To get to the televised rounds, Kyle must first pass a series of rigorous and hazardous challenges to prove his superhero credentials to the judges. Little does he know that even if he succeeds his entire world is about to come crumbling down.

Source: The Game Website.

186400.name: The Golden Ages: Wonderpack
186400.description:
Five new wonders to use in the game in the the new (big) format:

Colosseum: you have an extra building space.

Brandenburg Gate: immediate-> take a Glory tile from the stock and put it on this wonder. Count it at the end of the game as usual.

Amsterdam Stock Exchange: activate-> you may spend up to 3 VPs in order to achieve 3 Gold for each spent VP.

Monastery of San Lorenzo de El Escorial: activate-> place a cube from your reserve on any number of your cities. Get normally the gold for placing cubes. A cities composed by 3+ cubes cannot be attacked.

Mount Rushmore: immediate-> take back one of your discarded civilization cards and play it in addition to your current civilization card; apply immediately its effects.

186401.name: The Card Tower
186401.description:
THE CARD TOWER

Players: 2 or 4
Game time: 15 to 25 min
Age group: 10+

Synopsis
The Card Tower is a Dice/Card game where 2 to 4 construction companies are competing against each other to win a lucrative contract to build the next luxury tower in downtown Manhattan. During each turn the companies are trying to build each of the four construction zones of the building floor plan faster than their opponent. During the construction phase each company has a saboteur who is trying to stop the other companies from completing their job. As the tower rises, by placing a new tower card on top of the previous card with dice, it’s up to you to decide what’s more important; building a zone of the floor plan or sabotaging your opponent. If you build the most high quality sections of the tower, you will win the contact and the honor of putting your name of the tower.

As you play you are actually building a tower of cards with dice becoming the supporting structure.

Components
18 – Tower cards
18 – Sabotage cards
36 – d6 dice “9 dice each of four colors”

186402.name: GURPS Vehicle Builder
186402.description:
GURPS Vehicle Builder is the official vehicle-creation program for GURPS. Like the GURPS Character Builder before it, GURPS Vehicle Builder lets you design, optimize, store, modify, and print out vehicles of all types, from an oxcart to a space station! All the system's features are supported, with complete vehicle creation rules from GURPS Vehicles, as well as GURPS Vehicles Expansion 1 and GURPS Vehicles Expansion 2.
(Source: Publisher blurb)

186403.name: The World of Khoras
186403.description:
The World of Khoras - Fantasy Campaign Setting

From the introduction:

The World of Khoras is, simply put, the most fully imagined, richly detailed fantasy campaign setting on the internet. It is ready-to-use with any game system and gives the Game Master a totally new and lively setting for his or her players to enjoy. The World of Khoras is compatible with any traditional dice and paper role playing game, requires no membership and is absolutely free.

User summary:

The World of Khoras is a system agnostic fantasy setting that is adaptable to any fantasy role playing system. The world is developed and complete. The material is presented as a series of HTML pages, including these major entries: Site Map, Main Menu, Introduction, Civilization, Cultured Races, Physical World, Fauna & Flora, Magic, Religion, History, and Glossary. Numerous maps are available, including national borders, full color geographic maps, parchment maps, and so forth. Most maps are available in several resolutions and a few different file formats. The maps are supplemented with a distance chart in miles between all Capital cities.

During 2002 the web site planned to publish a CD-ROM of the setting and attempted to become a subscription-based web site. Neither of these efforts came to fruition. As of 2015 the site is still freely accessible.

Older versions of the site also included sections on Trivia, Tales (fiction), and Role Playing in Khoras

186404.description:
INTRODUCTION

Vault is an abstract game in which each player tries to reach the opponent’s back rank. Vault is named after pole vaulting, which is a track and field event in which a person uses a long, flexible pole as an aid to jump over a bar. Vault is a derivative of Onager, by the same designer and uses a variation of its jumping mechanism (also present in Billabong, for example) that allows multiple directions to be used. It’s like vector movement but without acceleration. Unlike Onager, Vault only works well on a square grid, as jumping directions are difficult to visualize in a hexagonal grid.

MATERIAL

- A square grid with an even number of cells (recommended 10x10). Preferably checkered* for clarity, but this is not mandatory.
- As many white and black pawns as the number of cells per side.

SETUP

Each player has an allocated colour (Black or White). Fill your nearest row with pawns of your colour (one per cell).
HOW TO PLAY

White starts. Players alternate turns during the game until the victory condition is reached. On your turn, either walk or jump with one of your pawns.

Walk

Move one of your pieces to an adjacent empty space as a King in Chess.

Jump

In order to jump, choose 2 friendly pieces. One of the pieces then jumps over the other piece in the direction defined by both pawns, landing on a space beyond that is at a distance equal to the distance between the two friendly pieces before the jump was made (like a mirror). Notice that jumping is not restricted to orthogonal or diagonal directions.

The landing space must be either empty or occupied by an enemy piece, which is then captured and removed from the game. A piece cannot land on a friendly piece. Pieces cannot land outside the board.

Notice that the spaces between the jumping pawn and the landing space don’t need to be empty. Also, captures can only be made by jumping.

GAME END

If at the start of your turn you have at least one piece on your opponent's back rank then you have won.

If the above condition is not reached and you can’t make a legal movement at the start of your turn, you lose. This rarely happens. Players may agree on a draw at any moment during the game.

NOTES FROM THE DESIGNER

This is intended to be the simplest game that uses this jumping mechanism. I’ve decided not to use Onager’s stacking mechanism (in order to make is simpler for turn based online play and also playable with non-stacking pieces) or the multiple jump (as it would be almost impossible to think ahead).

As a variant, you can use the stacking mechanism of Onager.

(*) On a checkered board, the jumping piece always lands in a space of the same colour as the starting one.
186404.name: Vault

186408.name: Matchmaster
186408.description:
The game takes 13 rounds. Each round the number of Cards will be lifted or lowered. Players have to say, how many tricks they will take this round. Who was correct, gets points. Who was wrong looses points. The winner is the one with the most points at the end.

Material: 52 cards, 50 matches, 1 ruleset

Das Spiel geht über 13 Runden. Pro Runde wird die Anzahl der Karten um eine erhöht bzw. wieder verringert. Die Spieler müssen pro Runde vorhersagen, wie viele Stiche sie machen werden. Wer richtig vorhergesagt hat, bekommt Punkte. Wer falsch lag, verliert Punkte. Wer am Ende die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt.

Bestandteile: 52 Karten, 50 Streichhölzer, 1 Spielanleitung.

186409.name: Jack Attack
186409.description:
Jack Attack is a trick-taking game with an augmented deck, described by the publisher as "combining the best elements of Hearts, Bridge, and Bridge." The deck contains the standard 52 cards, plus 4 suited "1"s, 2 "Big" Jokers, and 2 "Little" Jokers.

The object is to avoid taking Jacks, although a player may collect all four for a "Grand Slam", similar to shooting the moon in Hearts.

The players are dealt a number of cards dependent on the number of players. The dealer determines trump/no trump, and makes the opening lead. Suit must be followed, with the exception of the Jokers, which may be played on any trick. Trick is won (in order of precedence) by the first "Big" Joker, highest trump, or highest card of the suit led. ("Little" Jokers cannot win tricks.)

Play continues until one person has taken 10 Jacks, or 10 hands have been played. Low score wins. ("Grand Slams" alter this somewhat.)

186411.name: Kids Easy Play Fantasy Role-Playing Game OGL
186411.description:
User summary:

The game manual is distributed as two PDF files, a 32-page rules section and a 1-page cover.

Character generation closely follows the standard D20 OGL approach of Abilities, Alignment, Race, Class, Skills and Feats, and Equipment. The primary difference in this implementation is that all options are fairly limited--only "routine" Skills are presented, for example, and Feats are limited to entry-level, common selections. The strength of the system lies in the Game Play, Non-Combat Encounters, Combat Encounters, and Dungeon Creation chapters with relevant advice on how to game with children.

A separate PDF file with a character sheet is available.

186412.name: Kids Easy Play BESM OGL
186412.description:
User summary:

The game manual is distributed as two PDF files, a 29-page rules section and a 1-page cover. As many kids are heavily involved in anime, the BESM OGL offers a natural starting point for kid friendly gaming.

Character generation closely follows the standard BESM OGL approach of Abilities, Attributes, Skills, and Equipment. The primary difference in this implementation is that all options are fairly limited--only "routine" Skills are presented, for example. The strength of the system lies in the Adventure Creation and Designers Notes with relevant advice on how to game with children.

A PDF character sheet also is available.

186413.name: Advanced Spells III
186413.description:
Mythic Magic with Class!

This product is the first all-new Mythic Magic supplement since the publication of the Mythic Spell Compendium from Legendary Games and Kobold Press, and it brings you 134 all-new mythic spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide! While the original mythic rules for Pathfinder included many cherished favorites from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook as well as the other core rules hardback rulebooks and the Mythic Spell Compendium compiled a vast array of mythic spells for your game, new rules for Pathfinder continue to come out and spellcasters have a continual supply of new tricks to try from more recent rulebooks like the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide. That diversity of options that we love so much about the game is what Legendary Games brings to you in the Mythic Magic series. The product before you completes the mythic rules for every spell in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Advanced Class Guide. All of them, from adhesive blood to widen auras and all spells in between.

Whether you're an arcane or a divine caster, Mythic Magic: Advanced Spells III contains mythic spells of every level and every kind, from minor spells to the mightiest magics. You will find combat spells like molten orb, sonic scream, and whip of spiders right alongside defensive magic like guardian of faith and shield of fortification, spells to aid your allies like path of glory and contingent action, and utility spells like investigative mind and climbing beanstalk. They are all here, every one, developed with flair and function in mind as only Legendary Games can bring it, by the same designers that wrote most of the mythic spells in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Mythic Adventures in the first place.

186415.name: Kinetic Game Rules
186415.description:
User summary:

The Kinetic Game Rules are presented in two main HTML pages--one for Character Generation, and one for everything else. The second page leads to numerous sub-pages.

Characters select one of four Classes which determines point pools and types of builds that are possible. Characters have Abilities (usually ranging from 2-9) and several types of Skills. Access to Skills is partially controlled by Class; Skills are grouped in categories. Characters may have alien technology or skills, or cybernetic implants depending upon their build. Hit Points are divided among body locations. Characters are equipped based on Gear Points, which are depended upon Class.

Combat includes specific rules for hand-to-hand fighting, firearms and futuristic weapons, psionics, and high-speed firefights. A one-on-one hand-to-hand dueling system, called Katana, also is elaborated. Generally, combat is fairly complex. Healing is slow and difficult unless augmented with technology.

186416.name: Kinetic Universe
186416.description:
User summary:

The Kinetic Universe is detailed in a series of six major HTML pages. The political divisions in the setting have a major influence on character generation, determining which Classes are available to characters, and the amounts and types of equipment, Cybernetics, and Alien artifacts. The entry page features an overview and offers access to these major HTML pages:


The Federation
The Empire
The Free Thinkers
Alien Races (one dozen defined)
Planets

186417.name: Das geheimnisvolle Labyrinth von Schloss Balthasar
186417.description:
User Description

"Das geheimnisvolle Labyrinth von Schloss Balthasar" is a puzzle adventure with the mascots from the theme park "Europa Park". In the game you have to solve two different kind of puzzles, labyrinth puzzles and bridge building puzzles.

In the laybrinth puzzles you have to use the abilities of the charakters to guide them all to the exit of the level. E.g. the character Ed Euromaus can use switches to open locked doors.

In the bridge bulding levels you use a crane to move missing bridge tiles to the bridge to complete it.

186418.name: Runa Negra
186418.description:
Runa Negra:
Es un original juego de cartas cooperativo, con ambientación medieval fantástica y una estética muy trabajada.
En el, cada jugador asumirá el rol de un campeón que combatirá junto a un grupo de compañeros a las hordas de enemigos corruptos por el poder de la Runa Negra.

El juego consta con un sistema de generación de runas y enemigos innovador que hace que cada partida sea diferente. E incorpora varios niveles de dificultad adaptables, para que pueda ser jugado tanto por jugadores poco experimentados en juegos de cartas como para los habituados a ellos.

Runa Negra es un juego de cartas cooperativo en el que un grupo de entre 2 y 5 jugadores, que representan a unos campeones, se enfrentarán a hordas de enemigos que tratarán de sobrepasarlos. Los campeones deberán luchar hasta derrotar al jefe final, portador de la Runa Negra.
Tendréis que colaborar entre todos para combatir a la Runa Negra aprovechando el poder de las diferentes runas. Y dispondréis de varias clases de personajes para elegir con atributos y características únicos.


Black Rune:
Is an original cooperative card game, with fantastic medieval atmosphere and a very elaborate aesthetics.
In it, each player will assume the role of a champion who will fight with a group of peers the hordes of enemies corrupted by the power of the Black Rune.

The game has a system of runes and innovative generation of enemies that makes every game different. Also incorporates several levels of adaptable difficulty, so it can be played by inexperienced in card games and also for those who are accustomed to them.

Black Rune is a cooperative card game in which a group of 2 to 5 players, representing some champions, will face hordes of enemies that try to overcome them. The champions will fight to defeat the final boss, The Black Runa carrier.
You will have to cooperate with each other to fight the Black Rune harnessing the power of the different runes. You have several character to choose, with unique attributes and characteristics.

186419.name: Bowling Dice Game
186419.description:
Bowling Dice Game is a simple "push your luck" game based on Bowling.

Roll 1 normal dice and count the pips.
If you roll a 6 then it's an instant Strike or spare regardless of previous counted pips.

You can stop rerolling whenever you want and enter the score in the scoresheet.

After a Strike or spare you get bounspoints from the next rounds

Highest score wins.

186420.name: Schinderhannes: Die Räuberjagd
186420.description:
Schinderhannes is a historical character similar to Robin Hood. He lived around 1800 in the region of Hunsrück, Taunus and Eifel (center of Western Germany).
Easy dice game. Players roll and move on a board of a network of spaces. One player is the "Schinderhannes" and tries to take as much loot as possible by landing on the appropriate space, the other players try to catch him. Who has the most loot after a couple of games wins.

186421.name: Gujuguju
186421.description:
Gujuguju is a fast, easy and fun party game. It is a very simple game with a very unique rule.

The game requires the players to cover the same fruit cards on the table with their own cards as quickly as possible, in order to be the first one to get rid of all the cards in hand.

186423.name: Shipwreck Cove
186423.description:
From publisher blurb:

After leaving a successful venture on Xodus Island you find yourselves being pursued by Captain Gabriel Angel and his pirates! Your escape sends both ships into a hurricane causing you to become lost at sea with waves threatening your ship. Choking on water the next morning you and your fellow adventurers find yourselves at Shipwreck Cove!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

This adventure was offered at Gen Con 2015 and seemed to be a big hit.

186424.name: Highway to Upton
186424.description:
From publisher blurb:

In PS1 - Barrow of the Culder, your newfound companions were offered a paying job as adventurers. With your victory complete it is now time to get paid. The only problem is that your benefactors are not in Merrydale, they are in Upton. With a payday in sight you head out on the Highway to Upton. As an ancient sage once said “It’s not about the destination, it’s about the journey” In this case the journey is going to be the adventure!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Provincia Campaign for an initial to low level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

186425.name: The Locust (Supers!)
186425.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Locust and his gang of high-jumping jackanapes have been picking clean the private collections and fine art galleries in The City. The rumor on the street is that they will soon start looting the collections in the celebrated municipal museums.

The Police Commissioner and Mayor are outraged at this possibility. They have put out the call to the vigilantes of The City to provide security for the prized collections in The City's museums and to also apprehend The Locust as soon as possible...

186426.name: Belly of the Beast (ICONS)
186426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysterious cultists have invaded another superhero's headquarters.

The attackers intend to pervert the magicks holding that heroic sorcerer's sanctum in place and the result will endanger the entire city!

Can the heroes strike back and stop the cult in time? This adventure was created for heroes using the ICONS —Assembled Edition.

186427.name: Festival of Fear (ICONS)
186427.description:
From publisher blurb:

The villainous clown, Big Top, has kidnapped a busload of orphans to be raised as brainwashed minions! Can the heroes unravel the mysterious disappearance in time to save the children from becoming villains’ pawns?

186428.name: Super Bad Guys! #1
186428.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super Bad Guys! #1 for ICONS offers three new villans for your "Superpowered Roleplaying" game. Each unique bad guy includes attributes, specialties, powers, and qualities, along with a summery of their criminal creation and monsterous motives.

Gar-Girl -- Exiled princess from the world of Gargoy poised to strike.
Grey Matter -- An alien/human hybrid with a disdain for mere terrestrials.
Junk Heap -- A golumn of garbage with a fear of abandonment.




There can never be enough bad guys -- and neve ever enough Super Bad Guys!

186429.name: Mistress Hyde
186429.description:
From publisher blurb:

A world-renowned pharmacologist looking to create a treatment for neuromuscular disease, Maryann Beswick accidentally inhaled fumes that built up in her system and eventually transformed her from being a kind humanitarian into an evil, bestial criminal intent on accumulating power and experiencing pleasures at any cost!

186430.name: Five Famous Favorites
186430.description:
Tripoley: A standard deck playing card game played with a special layout (or board) and poker chips. It is a modern version of the game of Poch. Each hand has three phases: "Hearts", "Poker", and "Michigan Rummy". All cards are dealt out, including one extra hand which remains unseen. Players place chips in the spaces for the special combinations on the playing mat/board, the "Poker" pot, and the "Kitty". The first phase pays off for holding certain cards or combinations (that match the combinations on the playing layout/board). The second phase is a hand of poker; each player selecting five cards from his hand to play. A hand of Poker betting takes place, with bets added to the "Poker" pot, and the winner wins the "Poker" pot. In the third phase, players play a slight variation of the game of Michigan (similar to Fan Tan), and the first to go out wins the chips in the "Kitty".

Backgammon (Acey Ducey): a classic abstract strategy game where each player has a set of 15 "men" that must be moved from their starting positions, around, and then off the board. Dice are thrown each turn, and each player must decide which of his men to move based on the outcome of the roll. Players can capture each other's men, forcing the captured men to restart their journey around the board. The winner is the first player to get all 15 men off the board.

Number Chek

Horse Race

Checkers: is an abstract strategy game where players move disc-shaped pieces across an 8 by 8 cross-hatched ("checker") board. Pieces only move diagonally, and only one space at a time. If a player can move one of his pieces so that it jumps over an adjacent piece of their opponent and into an empty space, that player captures the opponent's disc. Jumping moves must be taken when possible, thereby creating a strategy game where players offer up jumps in exchange for setting up the board so that they jump even more pieces on their turn. A player wins by removing all of his opponent's pieces from the board or by blocking the opponent so that he has no more moves.

186431.name: West Africa
186431.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Atlas of Earth-Prime heads to the 15 nations that make up West Africa. Inside, you’ll meet the Champions of West Africa, a team made up of heroes from across the region, with members including Exemplar, Jali, Genome, Maitre Aimant, the Futurist, and Fantasma. Together, they protect the region from threats such as King Claw and his followers in Righteous Fire. Another hero, Mr. Twist, concerns himself with refugees in the region and has set up the Refuge to offer a safe place to stay, at least for a while. There’s more going on in Niger, Senegal, and Sierra Leone, where the son-of-a-villain known as Brodha Renbo tries to prove himself a true hero.

186432.name: Devil's Night
186432.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mischief and Mayhem on Devil's Night!

It's trouble in the town of Middle Rock during the annual "Devil's Night" festivities: cursed Halloween masks are turning both kids and adults into monsters! Can Our Heroes find the cause of this plague and brave the horrors of a true haunted house to confront the devilish imp responsible? They will need all of their courage and determination to face the trials of the Netherworld itself on Devil's Night...

This adventure for Icons Superpowered Roleplaying is suitable for any group of heroes and an ideal themed holiday adventure or anytime opportunity to pit your heroes against the forces of darkness.

186433.name: Ruined Mall
186433.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is 2, 48 x 30 inch maps of an Ruined Mall, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

This is a very large map and requires 36 sheets of paper to print out.

“Brings a whole new meaning to the phrase mall crashers.”—Post-Apocalyptic Survivor

Ruined Mall is an interior map of a two story shattered mall and the exterior sidewalks and parking lots.

Ruined Mall is intended for use in modern post-apocalyptic games. It could also be an abandoned mall that has fallen into disrepair and used for criminal activities like murder or gang violence in a modern game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Cleanup on All Floors: The group is playing desperate survivors in a zombie apocalypse game. They seek shelter from the zombies on the streets, seeing an intact building and find an old shopping mall.

They find the doors barricaded and a different group of survivors inside who may or may not be persuaded to let the group inside. Once inside, the original mall squatters do not want to give them any supplies such as ammo or food but will let them sleep the night away. This could lead to a conflict between the two groups over scarce resources. If it becomes a fight, raise the tension by adding a zombie attack during the middle of the combat.

Alternatively, they find the mall gates wide open but former shoppers turned zombies look for deals on fresh meat as they wander the mall. After clearing out the zombies, the survivors might decide to barricade the doors and try to scavenge for supplies during the day before taking turns watching to try and get some sleep for the next day. They GM could have another group of survivors ask for sanctuary after they are done with their barricades or they are attacked by zombies or human survivors sneaking inside in the middle of the night who attack from an unexpected direction.

186434.name: DéliroLinguo
186434.description:
Délirolinguo is as the Tower of Babel! This party game invites you to discover 30 common phrases in 12 languages: English, Spanish, Italian, German, Arabic, Japanese, Portuguese, Mandarin Chinese, Hindi, Russian, Turkish and French.

Rules of the Game: Unmask the language that opponents have!

The game starts with a card showing expressions in all 12 languages. To win, you just have to read this term to your opponents in the language that they have. Each opponent checks the answer on his card in his language and answers "yes" in case of right answer and "no" on error.

If you're right, you choose a Language card of one of your opponents to start your collection.

The winner of the game is the one that has the largest collection of languages. He will become a "polyglot genius".

DéliroLinguo, the languages game ​​which makes you totally crazy!

Material: 24 Language cards, 30 Expressions cards, 16 Special cards, 1 hourglass, 1 pencil, 1 notebook

---

Délirolinguo, c’est un peu l’auberge espagnole ! Ce jeu d'ambiance vous propose de découvrir 30 expressions usuelles dans 12 langues : l’anglais, l’espagnol, l’italien, l’allemand, l’arabe, le japonais, le portugais, le chinois mandarin, l’hindi, le russe, le turc et le français.
La règle du jeu ? Démasquer les langues que les adversaires ont piochées !
La partie commence avec une carte présentant une expression dans chacune des 12 langues. Pour gagner, il suffit de lire ce terme à ses adversaires dans la langue que ces derniers auront pioché. Chaque adversaire vérifie la réponse sur sa carte et répond dans sa langue : « oui » en cas de réponse juste et « non » en cas d’erreur.
S’il vise juste, il choisit une des cartes « langues » d’un de ses adversaires pour commencer sa collection.
Le gagnant de la partie est celui qui aura la plus importante collection de langues. Il deviendra ainsi un « polyglotte de génie ».

DéliroLinguo, le jeu de langues qui rend complètement fou !

Matériel : 24 cartes Langue, 30 cartes Expressions, 16 cartes Joker, 1 sablier, 1 crayon, 1 carnet

186435.description:
Zimby Mojo is a co-opportunistic game for 2-8 players that also supports solo play. Each player is the all-powerful shaman of a tribe of ferocious, conniving, vicious little cannibals called zimbies, and each player has a single goal: to become the new Cannibal King. To achieve their goal, each player will have to use their zimbies to infiltrate the current King’s compound, kill him, take his Crown, and carry it safely to their tribal board before a rival zimby tribe can do so first.

In solo play, the player must use their zimbies, scrolls, and strategy to defeat the Cannibal King, evade his thugs, and bring the Cannibal Crown to their tribal board before time runs out. In a multiplayer game, the players must work together to gain access to the Cannibal King’s sanctum before they can confront him. Once they kill the King, however, it’s every tribe for itself and the player that reaches their tribal board with the King’s Crown immediately becomes the new Cannibal King and wins the game!

Keep one eye on the Crown. Keep the other on your back.

WHAT'S A ZIMBY?
Zimbies are vicious, conniving little cannibals. They are small, stubborn, anti-heroes in a game of control of a land of nasty little creatures. They are not human: each zimby tribe has followed its own cultural and evolutionary path -- there are humanoid zimbies, avian zimbies, aquatic zimbies, simian zimbies, ursine zimbies, arachnid zimbies, the list goes on! That's why there's a bunch of reptilian-eyed, orange-skinned, clawed, stick-haired creatures on the box! The name "zimby" itself derives from a play on words on the word "zombie" and the designer's love of the cartoon character Invader Zim, who he feels exquisitely exemplifies zimby behavior and fanaticism.

MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF CONCEPTS AND ELEMENTS
Each player plays the shaman of a different zimby tribe. Zimbies are nasty, unruly, conniving little cannibals that follow their shaman with fanatical loyalty. Each player’s goal is to bring about the death of the Cannibal King, steal his fallen Crown, and get the Crown to his tribal board so he can become the new Cannibal King. To do this, the players will have to:

1. Get some zimbies onto the main game board (you can’t get the Crown without a zimby to grab it and carry it home),
2. Cooperate with at least one other tribe to activate a sigil (you can’t kill the King unless you can get to him),
3. Kill the Cannibal King (that’s the only way he will give up his Crown),
4. Get the Crown and deliver it to your tribal board (you win the game by becoming the new Cannibal King).

Part 1 of the game is completely cooperative. Part 2 of the game is completely competitive.

CREATURES
There are four creature types in the game: zimbies, obnoxious little cannibals that do a shaman’s bidding with ruthless (sometimes inept) fanaticism; zombies, undead meat-puppets; thugs, the Cannibal King’s dim-witted, fervently devoted brutes; the Cannibal King, the sadistic yet cowardly overlord of the zimby tribes. Shaman are players and don’t count as creatures.

MOJO
Mojo is "a power that may seem magical and allows someone to be very effective, successful, etc." (Mirriam Webster). It is the inexplicable, mystical energy than allows shamans to both impel their zimbies into action and release the powerful magical spells bound in the scrolls they raid from the Scroll Library! But be warned, mojo is drawn from shamans and zimbies! The more zimbies a shaman sends forth to kill the Cannibal King and steal his Crown, the less mojo that shaman has available! Every turn, each player (shaman) generates a small amount of mojo and may also draw forth mojo from zimbies on their tribal board, thereby depleting them of energy for the remainder of the turn and rendering them useless. A shaman may also cannibalize (yes, eat!) their own zimbies for more mojo... Of course, eaten zimbies are dead and gone...

STACKING
Multiple zimbies can stack to form columns which count as single, giant creatures. The more zimbies in the stack, the stronger they are but the slower they move. And the shaman whose turn it is fully controls the column...

SCROLLS, MOVEMENT, AND COMBAT
Shamans may use mojo to empower scrolls to cast one-off rituals, long-lasting incantations, and blindingly fast witcheries. These cast magical effects -- beneficial and detrimental -- on the shaman themselves. Shamans also use mojo to move their zimbies on the main board -- so, the more scrolls a shaman uses the less mojo they have available for movement. Combat is a simple 1d6 "roll-off" with the combatant making the higher die roll dealing a number of wounds damage equal to the difference in the die rolls to the combatant making the lower die roll.

TIMING
Many of a player's actions are limited to the player's turn, such as spawning new zimbies, turning zimbies into zombies, movement and combat. Players may extract and use mojo at any time on any player's turn. So, scroll use is always an option!

FIRST MOVER STRATEGY
At the end of the round, after all the players have gone, the player with the most undepleted zimbies on his tribal board becomes the first mover on the next round. That player goes first and play proceeds clockwise from them.

SOLO
There is also a solo mode, which is not only a fully realized game but also very useful to hone the strategies that you will use in your multiplayer games. But be warned: solo play is limited to 12 turns and your score gets lower the more turns you take. It's not too hard to win, but it's tough to get a high score!

HAVE FUN WREAKING HAVOC!
186435.name: Zimby Mojo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23 - The Social Contract Of Gaming

186436.name: Ten Cats
186436.description: Every player has ten tiles in his bag. One with four cats, two with three cats, three with two cats and four with one cat. On your turn you draw a tile from your bag and place it on the table with the goal being having ten of your cats in a row.

186437.description: Each player is dealt a cone card. The reverse side of it tells you what you should be adding to your ice cream cone: chocolate, strawberry or vanilla ice cream, almonds, cherries or wafer sticks. On your turn you draw a card and place it on your cone or replace the topmost card on your cone with the new card or you can place the card on someone else's cone. The game continues until everyone has five scoops on their cones. Then you score every card. If the card shows components that were required by your cone card you score positive points for the card and vice versa.
186437.name: Ice Cream

186439.name: Selectio
186439.description: Climbing game using wooden tiles numbered from one to nine in four suits in descending order of strength: Suns, Moons, Stars and Clouds. There are also four Jokers. Tiles are divided evenly between players and everyone gets a Joker. The player with One of Clouds starts. You're playing singles, pairs, three of a kinds or straights of two or three. The first player to get rid of his tiles wins.

186440.name: The Kingdom of Glenn
186440.description:
From the introduction:

The Kingdom of Glenn is a fanciful land of adventure, intrigue, and royal courts. The country inhabits a large broad plain between two northern and southern mountain ranges, the Freinhard Peaks and the Grimwold Mountains. The western border of the kingdom ends in the Ocean of Glittering Stars while the eastern border is the dangerous Hills of Trollhunt. This area was home to many forgotten civilizations before it was explored, conquered, and cultivated.

186441.name: Snöwycrag
186441.description:
From the introduction:

The dangerous Gnollteeth Pass is home to its fair share of troubles, but it is the safest way through the Old Mountains for at least 200 miles in either direction. One reason is the presence of Snöwycrag, a human settled fort that serves as a military outpost and traveler refuge. The fort's walls have been destroyed and rebuilt many times over. Each time, a new group of armed soldiers or entrepeneurs have reestablished the important outpost.

Today, traders, merchants, hunters, and explorers use Gnollteeth Pass and Snöwycrag to gain quick access to the Northlands or the Olde Forests to the south.

User summary:

Snöwycrag is an adventure locale with area map, town map, and notable personalities. It functions as a location for adventure and intrigue but does not have a single narrative plot adventure as would be typical of most modules.

186442.name: Pictopia: Star Wars Edition
186442.description:
From the publisher:

Make family game time epic with the Star Wars Pictopia Trivia Game! Prove whether you are a Padawan or Jedi Master when your knowledge of Star Wars is tested with 1,000 questions on the iconic planets, ships, villains, and heroes from a galaxy far, far away. It’s a game of teamwork but with a competitive edge! Sometimes you’ll work together and other times answer alone, but you’ll wager every time. How much you risk depends on how well you know your Star Wars trivia! Feel the Force questions add an exciting twist by revealing how much you sense about other players. Become a true Jedi Master with the Star Wars Pictopia Trivia Game.

186443.description: The Tribute promo card for Uruk II is yet another of the rare black cards, making it ever-so-slightly easier to play other black cards.
186443.name: Uruk II: Promokarte Tribute
boardgameexpansion: Uruk II: Die Entwicklung Geht Weiter

186444.name: Army of Judgement
186444.description:
User summary:

Army of Judgement is a setting and game system that envisions a post-apocalyptic America rules by a despotic Overlord. The Overlord is resisted by the fragments of the Army of Judgement. Characters are members of the Army of Judgement with super powers created by biological experimentation.

The game is presented in numerous major HTML pages, including: Introductory Fiction, Introduction, Soldier Creation, Rules, Advancement, Kewl Powers, World Timeline, Life of a Soldier, Phoenix Arizona, Los Angeles California, GM Advice & Hints, Secrets, Mundane Characters, and various notes and minor graphics.

Characters have attributes with two statistics--a number and a type, indicating the number of dice rolled and the type of dice rolled for that attribute, skill, or power. The setting is fairly well developed but has inconsistent coverage. The game rules contain much brief fiction that adds flavor and establishes a dark, gritty tone. Some of the campaign setting is delivered in first-person, narrative form.

186445.description:
A promo pack handed out at the Essen Spiel fair 2015 that allows players to play as one of six different German soldiers as well as a memorial with their names.

They replace the French soldiers in the base game.
186445.name: The Grizzled: German Soldiers

186447.name: Left Coast (Version 2005)
186447.description:
User summary:

One player will act as GM. The other players generate a character who is a semi-famous science fiction author looking for their big break. Characters have an identified goal for each game session, and have four Ratings: Family, Money, Nuttiness, and Alien with numeric scores distributed from a point pool. The Rating score determines how many dice are rolled in a dice pool when that Rating is used. Characters select a Type (Hack, Visionary, Radical, etc.) Most of the game involves shared narration of events, where elements of one character's meta-fictional "writing" can bleed over into another character's "real" life. When conflict arises that cannot be resolved with narration the GM may call for an opposed dice roll.

186448.name: Left Coast (Version 2011)
186448.description:
User summary:

The 2011 Version of Left Coast is a greatly-expanded re-design of the original. The additions streamline play, provide examples, and offer support for the setting. The 2011 Version also is far more structured in the approach to campaign management.

One player will act as GM. The other players generate a character who is a semi-famous science fiction author looking for their big break. Characters have an identified goal for each game session, and have four Ratings: Family, Money, Nuttiness, and Alien with numeric scores distributed from a point array of 2, 2, 4, and 6. The Rating score determines how many dice are rolled in a dice pool when that Rating is used. The Rating score also determines how many Facts and Connections will be place in the Rating's sphere.

Characters select a Type (Hack, Visionary, Radical, etc.) Most of the game involves shared narration of events, where elements of one character's meta-fictional "writing" can bleed over into another character's "real" life. When conflict arises that cannot be resolved with narration the GM may call for an opposed dice roll. The writing Group, to which the characters belong, also is tracked as an entity that develops over time.

186449.name: Going Ashore
186449.description:
Going Ashore is a solitaire deck building game where you play the part of the Marines carrying out a series of battles as you hop from island to island. You must defeat all of the enemies on each island before you can move to the next. Clear the enemy from five islands to claim victory, any other result will re-write history as a loss for the allied forces!

- Publisher's blurb

186450.name: Left Coast (Version 2013)
186450.description:
User summary:

The 2013 Version of Left Coast is an expanded partial re-design of the 2011 Version (the change from A4 to Letter size partially accounts for the large increase in page count). Most of the modifications are minor and improve or clarify play. Several flow-charts have been added and some sections have received better layout and organization. The role of Supporting Characters (NPCs, sort of) is greatly expanded.

One player will act as GM. The other players generate a character who is a semi-famous science fiction author looking for their big break. Characters have an identified goal for each game session, and have four Ratings: Family, Trouble, Money, and Weird with numeric scores.

Characters select a Type (Hack, Visionary, Radical, etc.) Most of the game involves shared narration of events, where elements of one character's meta-fictional "writing" can bleed over into another character's "real" life. When conflict arises that cannot be resolved with narration the GM may call for an opposed dice roll. The writing Group, to which the characters belong, also is tracked as an entity that develops over time.

186451.name: Left Coast: Summary of Rules (Version 2011)
186451.description:
User summary:

The Left Coast: Summary of Rules is an extraction of the full 2011 rule set with only the basic character creation, NPC creation, resolution system, and scene script included. It could be used by an experienced group of players as a reference but is insufficient to be used as a stand-alone introduction to the game. A group with a GM familiar with the rules could utilize the Summary of Rules as a reference for players.

186452.description: Two additional artisan cards featuring the game designer Koota Yamada and UTSUROI co-founder Nakagawa Kozi. These cards were not in the box, but given as a free promos with every copy of IKI at SPIEL 2015.
186452.name: IKI: Essen 2015 Promo

186453.name: Legendary
186453.description:
User summary:

Players create a Legend (character) by distributing points from three separate pools. Archetype points determine the Legend's Archetype (class); Main points determine advantages, disadvantages, Skills, and Statistics (abilities); and Personality points determine mental qualities. Legends select one, two, or three Archetypes from Warrior, Rogue, or Caster. Disadvantages are selected to "earn" points in the Main pool while Advantages, Skills, and Statistic Values are purchased with points. Generally speaking, high Statistics Values are somewhat inexpensive. Numerous derived values then are calculated, including combat, Health Points (hit points), and so forth. Finally, Personality and Mental Traits are purchased from the Personality pool.

Each Statistic (ability) has a length table detailing associated ability from the Value. Tables are provided for Strength, Agility, Combat, Health, Aptitude, and Appearance. Each Skill has a Point value and is based on a particular Statistic. The Skill list is lengthy. Combat is fairly complex and requires the attacker and the defender both to generate rolls which are compared to determine results. Combat supposes that actions are pre-determined and cannot be changed during a round.

The magic system is unique and uses a "Noun" plus "Verb" construction to generate an on-the-spot customization of effect. Each Noun and each Verb specifies a "Word Point" cost and a Casting Time which are added together for the final result. Magic is further circumscribed by Word Definitions (to avoid arguments) and Spell Limitations (presumably to assist in game balance). A sample spell from the rules is given thusly:


Magic will create5.2 fire(6)3.2 on1.1 creature(wolf)1.3

186454.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth – Rising Tide
186454.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.
After the first wave of great colony ships departed Earth, the jubilation of humanity was short-lived. Those left behind fell into a violent struggle over the quickly-diminishing resources on their barren home world. From this tumultuous time, four new factions arose. These newcomers were grounded not in the idealism of their predecessors, but on opportunism, resilience, ruthlessness, and above all a commitment to their own survival.
Now, many decades after their first landfall on a new planet, the proud survivors of the first expeditions beyond Earth look up to see the skies darkened by a new breed of pioneers.
Beyond Earth extended the Civilization franchise from its historical setting into the possible futures of science fiction. Rising Tide extends Beyond Earth to new frontiers on the planet’s surface and beneath its seas, adding even more choices and diplomatic options as you continue to build “just one more turn” toward a new vision for the future of humanity.

186455.name: Blood of Haven
186455.description:
From the introduction:

Somewhere in the wilderness of Alyria lies the small village of Haven. It is a nowhere town in a nowhere land, content to ignore the outside world and to be left alone. The nearest town is two weeks away, which is where the farmers of Haven go to trade for items and equipment that they do not have. It is a hard existence, but the people of Haven are happy. After all, nothing ever happens here. Nothing at all.

But this idyllic village holds a dark secret. Twenty years ago, this village condemned a child to die. He was forced from the village and left to wander the wilderness alone. His only crime: being different. Having a strange power that the villagers both desired and feared. And so he was cast out. He should have died. Instead, sustained by his innate power, he has grown to manhood in the wilderness. Gathering an army of twisted creatures around him, he is returning to Haven for revenge.

User summary:

As this adventure was released prior to the format release of the rules upon which it is based, about the first half of the document provides a "quick start" rules introduction. It is possible to play the scenario using only the included rules.

186460.name: Legion: Universal Role Playing Game
186460.description:
User summary:

Legion: Universal Role Playing Game presents a generic, universal system suitable for nearly any genre. The game is unusual in the amount of beginner information and background it provides. The game is presented in HTML with these major page divisions: Entry Page, Character Sheet, Introduction, Core Mechanics, Combat, Character Generation, Occupational Trades, and Expansions. The Expansions page presents various settings for use with the game but it is very brief and generally indicates only genre descriptions.

Characters have Attributes that can be randomly generated or purchased with points; Attributes run from 1-11 with 5 or 6 being average. Secondary Attributes are generated by formulas. Characters also have Traits, Skills, and Talents. Skills are assigned to an Attribute and have a numeric Range from 1-11 with 5 or 6 being considered Skilled. Resolution typically uses one die with modifiers against a target. Combat is quite complex with numerous options and special cases.

186461.description:
A bounty has been placed on the head of a monster terrorizing a small country town. Bounty hunters descend on the abandoned mansion where it is rumored to make its lair, each hoping to claim the prize. However, one of these hunters is actually the monster in disguise. One is forced to ask, then: who hunts whom?

Hunt: The Unknown Quarry, from Darkest Night designer Jeremy Lennert, is a deductive combat game. One player is secretly the monster, and their goal is to cripple all of the other players in order to escape the mansion. The other players, the human bounty hunters, must discover and kill the monster before they are hunted down by the creature. Each player moves around the mansion's many rooms to search for clues, gather items, and target other players to deduce which of them is the monster (or, if you are the monster, to wound the other bounty hunters). Tread lightly, for the hunt has begun...

Each round, players take turns moving about the mansion's many rooms, looking at cards for clues, and picking up items (cards) to add to their hand. Players can also interact when in the same room as another player and try to attack them using the cards in their hand in order to deduce who is the monster and what kind of monster they are. If you are the monster, then you want to do your best to avoid being killed and wound the other players in hopes to escape the mansion with your life. Play continues until either the monster is slain or all the other players declare that they have been crippled.
186461.name: Hunt: The Unknown Quarry
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 65- Orleans & Evolution of a Gamer

186462.description:
This deck contains a bunch of fun cards of different types, which adds more variety to the existing decks. This pack of 25 cards is the Kickstarter reward for the people who ordered the Assault on Doomrock: Doompocalypse expansion.

Ability cards

Aura of doom
Light nova
Lob shot




Common items

Axewand of the Fairy
Cheat Codes of Doom
Dartdaggers
Impact Warhammer
Old Helmet
That's a Trout
Weakness Analyzer X-3000




Epic items

Amulet of Blind Rage
Fan of Misery and Doom
Fifty Shades of Great Axe
Gatling Gun
Impaling Pauldrons of Doom
Jar of Bees
Lifetap Branch




Mountain Events

Adventuring expo
Angry mob
Dragon moths
Zombie walk




Wilderness Events

Catpocalypse
Dire beavers
Fwuffy bunny
Golden fish, granting wish
186462.name: Assault on Doomrock: Doompocalypse – Kickstarter Promo Pack

186463.name: Live Free or Die
186463.description:
User summary:

Live Free or Die appeared as a "Free Version" in HTML on the internet. Forum posts indicate the game subsequently underwent some extent of commercialization in planning for formal publication but no evidence of this exists.

The game uses a "Go/No-Go" system that centers on three specialized cube dice--green, blue, and red, with two "Go", three "Go", and four "Go" sides respectively; remaining sides are "No-Go" sides. Go indicates success, No-Go indicates failure. Resolution uses different colored dice based on how skilled the actor is.

Characters have Aptitudes (attributes) including Brawn, Brains, Prowess, Presence, and Guts. Aptitudes are assigned narrative levels of Inferior, Average, or Superior. These three narrative levels correspond to the green, blue, and red die, respectively. Characters have Skills which are rated as Untrained, Familiar, Qualified, Trained, or Expert. Tasks are assigned a difficulty of Routine, Standard, Hard, or Oscar Sierra. Skills and Tasks are cross referenced on a "Universal Task Matrix" yielding a number of Go/No-Go results required for outcomes of Golf Sierra, Unsatisfactory, Satisfactory, Excellent, or Outstanding. While the system does eliminate handfuls of dice and complex math it does involve several discreet steps. Combat is handled similarly but multiple Go/No-Go results are considered.

186464.name: Zigzag
186464.description:
User summary:

Zigzag is a humorous role playing game that uses alcohol as a randomizer. The GM is referred to as the Designated Dry Guy and makes all the critical decisions (optional rules may change this). Players select characters from common media (e.g., "Marge from The Simpsons"), a stereotype (e.g., "the nymphomaniac peasant girl") or just make them up.

The game proceeds by characters stating what they want to have happen in the narrative and the Designated Dry Guy assigning an alcohol amount to effect the event; the player then consumes the alcohol amount determined and play proceeds. Routine inter-player conflicts can be resolved by drinking or by using one of several methods described in the rules, including: 21, Fuzzy Duck, Pattern Game, Rhyme and Reason, Shooting Animals, Word Association, or Word Disassociation. Alternately, players can engage in any mutually agreed upon contest such as arm wrestling, doing something weird with their bodies, or flipping beer coasters.

Treasure is represented by alcohol that is distributed from the party store to the finding character's player. The rules include notes on drinking etiquette and British/American terminology involving alcohol topics ("4 gills in a pint").

186465.name: Goshuin Atsume
186465.description:
User summary:
御朱印あつめ (Goshuin Atsume) means Goshuin Collection in English. This game was designed by a priest working in a Zen temple in Tokyo, Japan to promote the work of the temple and the experience for visitors.

Goshuin is originally a stamp given as a seal of submitting hand-written copied sutras to temples. Presently, Goshuin is a popular souvenir among people visiting temples.

In this game, the players visit temples and offer copied sutras to collect Goshuin. You may choose to form connection with many Bodhisattva deities or deepen the connection with certain deities. The player who manages to achieve the highest score through such connection wins the game!

Goshuin Collection is a bidding and hand management game for 3 to 4 players.
The box with words written in Indian ink contains components, such as Goshuin cards, Sutra chips, and Goshuin Notebook boards. 29 Goshuin cards and the Sutra chips are in a Buddhist monk’s own handwriting. The original Goshuin Notebook boards were made to order by Aribundou, a long-established bookbinder which has been in business since the Meiji period.

After drawing a Goshuin card from the draw pile, players offer their sutras. Once all the players have taken their turn, the player who has offered the longest sutra receives the Goshuin. Place the Goshuin you've received in lines next to your Goshuin Notebook board. You can also score substantially by collecting the Goshuin of certain deities!

But watch out for non-Goshuin cards which have slipped in! Well, let's just pray for the better...

Experience the fun of forming your original Goshuin notebook!

Publisher's summary:
テーマ：お寺、競り、役

御朱印とは、写経したお経を寺院に納めた証のこと。平成の世においては、参拝した記念の証として親しまれています。
プレイヤーはお寺の参拝者となり、写経を納め、御朱印をあつめていきます。たくさんの仏さまとご縁を結んでもよし、同じ仏さまとご縁を深めるもよし。仏さまとのご縁をいただき、もっとも得点を獲得したプレイヤーが勝利者となります！

『御朱印あつめ』は３人～４人で遊ぶことができる「競り」と「役」のカードゲーム。
墨字が目立つ箱の中には、御朱印カードと、お経チップ、御朱印帳ボードなどがおさまっています。
２９枚の御朱印カード、お経チップはお坊さん直筆。専用の御朱印帳ボードは、明治から続く製本屋「有文堂」様にお願いしました。

"
山札から御朱印カードを一枚めくり、プレイヤーはお経を出しあいます。一巡した時点でもっとも長いお経を納めたプレイヤーが御朱印を拝受。獲得した御朱印は、御朱印帳ボードの横に並べましょう。特定の仏さまがそろうと得点が大幅アップします！
でもちょっと待って！御朱印のなかにハズレがまぎれこんでいるかもしれません・・・合掌。

さあ、あなただけの御朱印帳を完成させましょう！

boardgamecompilation: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition
186466.description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Totem Chamber is an expansion for the Escape base game that includes single game board on which players must activate gems by stacking their dice in the middle of the chamber.

A die can be stacked only if it shows either a golden or black mask. If they stack 5 dice, they activate 1 gem; if they stack 10 dice, they activate 2 gems.
186466.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Totem Chamber
boardgameexpansion: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

186467.description:
User summary:
Cats~魔女と泥棒~ (Cats Witch & Thief)
Each player acts as a witch with her two black cats, and sneaks into the mansion of a corrupt merchant to steal gold coins. The black cats' duty is to steal the gold coins. Use magic to support your cats.

You can steal gold coins from your rivals by jumping over them.
While stealing gold coins from each other and dropping and picking up gold coins, head for the goal, the room with the safe.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは魔女となり、２匹のクロネコと共に悪徳商人の屋敷に忍び込み、金貨を盗みます。
金貨を盗むのはクロネコたちの役目。
プレイヤーはクロネコたちを魔法でサポートします。
部屋ごと回転させたり、ライバルを転ばせたり、ときには金貨の袋に穴が開くといったアクシデントも。
ライバルを飛び越すことで金貨を奪います。
金貨を奪ったり奪われたり落としたり拾ったりしながらゴール地点の金庫部屋を目指します。
186467.name: Cats Witch & Thief

186468.name: Boku no Hinamatsuri
186468.description:
User summary:
ぼくのひな祭り (Boku no Hinamatsuri) means My Dolls' Festival in English.

The players score points by placing their cards to form their original tiered stands of traditional Japanese Hina dolls.

Starting with the dolls of Five Court Musicians, the display is followed by Three Court Ladies, the Empress, and the Emperor. The players simultaneously complete their original tiered stands of Hina dolls by each using 10 cards.

Choose the 10 cards as you like. You may safely choose high-score cards, collect items to aim at a rally at the end, or bet on your luck by collecting dice.

It's a game designed to provide the warmth of Japanese tradition.

Publisher's summary:
カードを並べて自分だけのひな壇を作りつつ得点を競います。
五人囃子からスタートし、三人官女、女雛、男雛と続き、10枚のカードで各々のひな壇が同時に完成します。
どんな10枚を選ぶかはあなた次第。
無難に点数の高いカードを選ぶも良し、
最後の巻き返しを狙ってアイテムを集めるも良し、
サイコロを集めて運に賭けるも良し。
和のぬくもりを感じられる一作です。

186469.description:
Mr. Maksimov, the town's wealthy recluse, has passed away and many old rumors are swirling about. Some say that he was descended from royalty, others say that he was an adventurer or a smuggler, and there are even those who claim he was a wizard. Whatever they believe, the towns people are wasting no time rushing to his estate sale after his death seeking answers to the mystery around him... and to get their hands on as many of his possessions as they can. Some of Mr. Maksimov's possessions could be worth a fortune but others might end up being worth nothing.
