Mr. Maksimov's Manor is played in four rounds. In each of these rounds players will bid on Maksimov's possessions during his estate sale. Item cards that players can gather will either build on each other for more points or cause the player to lose points. When bidding, players need to balance how much value can be gained from the available items with what cards could hurt them. Also, if Mr. Maksimov's will turns up, it could change everything!

Mr. Maksimov's Manor is a casual game that both non-gamers and strategy gamers can appreciate. Casual gamers will enjoy the game's easy to learn rules and the feelings of excitement and anticipation that the game play yields. What will keep strategy gamers coming back is the ability to manipulate the game's odds, constant risk and reward decisions, and subtle elements of social deduction.
186469.name: Mr. Maksimov's Manor

186470.description:
One day the Humans had fiddled with the Earth until it could take no more, and the Humans ended. Then the Voles created their civilization and fiddled with the smaller things of the Earth until the Voles ended as well. Now the tiny creatures of the forest compete to find the artifacts and knowledge left by the fallen empires so that they too can mess it all up in their turn.

Each game of Vasty Wilds begins with a randomly placed network of Root cards. The players add cards to the board to expand the forest. Each card placement includes movement and other beneficial effects (Progress) for the player and detrimental effects (Misfortune) for her opponents. A player's opponents are in charge of placing her objectives in inconvenient places on the board. The player who collects all of her objectives first wins.

While Vasty Wilds is easy to learn for younger players or beginners, successive plays will reveal more complex strategies for card placement and effect combinations.
186470.name: Vasty Wilds

186471.name: Lucky 13 Quick Guide
186471.description:
User summary:

The rules as presented are light-weight. Characters have Attributes but the only examples in the Quick Guide are Fitness, Agility, and Charisma. Characters have Skills--defined skills include: Brawl, Dodge, Martial Arts, Listen, Wrestling, Gun, and Sneak. The game infers characters can have any Skill they desire.

A Skill score of 1-2 represents an intelligent but untrained individual; 7-12 indicates a normal, skilled range; 15+ indicates exceptional ability. Skill resolution is 2d6 plus Skill modifiers; a roll of double 1s is always failure and double 6s is always success. Typical Difficulty scores noted are: Very easy - 7; Easy - 10; Average - 13; Hard - 15; Very Hard - 18. If the action is opposed (as in combat) then the Difficulty score is the opponent's relevant Skill roll.

An associated HTML page notes conversion methods to move 3d6 and d100 Attributes into the Lucky 13 system.

186472.name: Universe 13
186472.description:
User summary:

Universe 13 is the setting for the Lucky 13 game system. Like the game, the setting is very minimalist. It is provided with several HTML links and a somewhat difficult to use "search" function that will find words in otherwise-inaccessible pages. The setting is comprised of about a dozen or so major planets, only half of which are well defined. Coverage of locales is uneven. Several organizations and locales are discussed.

186473.name: Lucky 13 Referee's Guide
186473.description:
User summary:

The Lucky 13 Referee's Guide provides a light-weight game system that complements (and completes) the Quick Guide. Characters have Vital Statistics (attributes). Each Vital Statistic has two ratings. The first rating is placed in brackets and indicates the character's natural (starting) value, ranging from 1-10. These scores are generated from 2d6-2, re-roll zeros. Characters' second rating begins at the same level as the natural value but may change during the campaign. Vital Statistics include Strength, Fitness, Intelligence, Ability, Dexterity, Charisma, Appearance, and Destiny. Characters may have Skills but only a few samples are given--it is assumed players will generate a Skill list for Referee approval.

Actions are resolved by 2d6 plus Vital Statistic or Skill modifier compared to a Difficulty. In combat the Difficulty is the opponent's roll. Wounds are handled in an atypical way, with several minor wounds becoming a major wound, and multiple major wounds being fatal. Characters in the system cannot sustain very much damage (compared to other role-playing games). Though science-fiction in nature, the rules do support spell casting as a series of Skills.

186475.name: Tofu Kingdom
186475.description:
This is a deduction game involving seven characters. The player assuming the role of Prince Mochi asks each of the other players one question and then guesses which player plays the role of Princess Tofu, the love of Prince Mochi. When answering Prince Mochi’s questions, the other players must either lie or tell the truth in accordance with the cards they hold.

The player who Prince Mochi deducts (rightly or wrongly) to be Princess Tofu wins the round and receives the number of points specified on his/her card. The goal of this game is to be the first player to accumulate 7 points.

186476.name: Consuls of Rome
186476.description:
Consuls of Rome depicts the rise of the Roman Republic, from a small city into a large empire.
Players take on the roles of the noble families, who seek to develop the power of their families in the favorable time: the peak of the Roman Republic.

Each player has a deck of cards that depicts celebrities of his family. Some of them are capable of great deeds and some will spoil any project with which they are entrusted — but with a good player's decisions, even those small souls could do a lot for his family.

During the game, players manage the deck of their characters to achieve, in competition with others, as much as possible on each of the planes of life of the Republic.

186477.name: Cluckbot: Fight League International
186477.description:
You are a cluck operator competing in the Cluckbot Fight League International, a brutal realm of mechanical combat as popular as it is illegal. Pick one of 10 cluck models, gather your arsenal, and take them into the arena!

Cluckbot is a board game for 2-player combat dueling. Each player controls a robotic cluck, one of 10 models, each with its own “cluck sheet” defining their attacks, gadgets, grapples and rush combos. You have 8 turns in the pit to eliminate your opponent either through raw damage or forcing them off the stage.

Each turn, players set their cluck’s movement (direction and facing) and action (step or leap) while the opponent does the same, double-blind. After revealing the commands, players resolve actions while spending "charge" to activate weapons and gadgets as they go. The right commands can foil your foe’s assault. Will you lure them under your claws? Outflank? Surprise attack? Strategic planning, anticipating your foe, and a bit of bold improvisation are key to victory!

186478.name: Operation Marlet
186478.description:
Operation Martlet is the fourth of Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

Twenty eight pages long, Operation Martlet follows the established Pint-Sized Campaign format, with an overview of the forces involved on both sides, their deployment shown on period maps and the course of the campaign described in detail before going on to present a mini-campaign covering this combined arms operation launched by the British 49th Division immediately prior to Operation Epsom to seize the Rauray Spur from the defenders from 12 SS Hitlerjugend.

The campaign is a total of six game tables with the duration running between six and eleven games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

Like all of previous Pint-Sized campaigns, it is available for the price of a pint in the local pub of the publisher.

186480.description: This set of three hero and three equipment cards allows you to play any legend as the single hero Stinner (from Legends of Andor: Journey to the North), rather than as the two usual heroes Chada and Thorn.
186480.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Stinner: Die Solo Erweiterung
boardgameexpansion: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ120: Las Leyendas de Andor: Chada y Thorn (2016) Gerhard Hecht

boardgamecompilation: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box: Kickstarter Edition
186481.description:
Introduction from Queenie 9 by the Publisher Queen Games:

"Works only if played with module 1 and 2 of the basic game. After placing 2 chambers next to the starting chamber, shuffle the teleporter and exchange chambers with the rest of the chambers before adding the exit tile. Place the teleporter token within easy reach next to the chamber stack."

This Queenie features two new Chambers, and a Teleporter Token. The Exchange Chamber allow players to exchange Curses for Treasures. The first player to the Teleport Chamber gains the Teleporter Token. This token can later be dropped in another Chamber, and now allows instant access from the Chamber with the Teleporter Token to Teleporter Chamber, and vice versa.
186481.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exchange Chamber and Teleporter Chamber
boardgameexpansion: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box

186482.name: Xbox 360 Big Button Pad
186482.description:
Aus dem Handbuch:
Mit dem Big Button Pad können Sie die drahtlose Freiheit ganz unkompliziert mit einem bequemen, einfach zu verwendenden Einhand-Spielcontroler genießen. Das Xbox Big Button Pad bietet:

- Bequeme Einhandverwendung für Links- und Rechtshänder
- Ein große Taste für Quizspiele mit schneller Reaktion sowie ein Vierwege-Steuerkreuz
- Die vertrauten Tasten A, B, X und Y und die Xbox Guide-Taste für einfachen Zugang zur Xbox Steuerung
- Spielen mit bis zu vier Spielern (je nach Spiel)
- Einen hochleistungsfähigen IR-Empfänger mit großer Reichweite


From the manual:
The Big Button Pad lets you experience the joy of wireless freedom with the simplicity of a comfortable, one-handed, fun-to-use game controler. The Xbox 360 big Button Pad features:

- Comfortable, ambidextrous, one-handed use.
- A big button for trivia and fast response gameplay as well as a four-way directional pad.
- The familiar A, B, X, and Y buttons and the Xbox Guide button for easy access to the Xbox Dashboard.
- Up to four-player simultaneous gameplay (supported on a game-by-game basis).
- A highperformance, extended range infrared receiver.

186483.name: Three Nights in Portsmouth
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186483.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anyone that has explored the seaside town of Portsmouth knows that it is a town filled with secrets. FT 2 - The Portsmouth Mermaid only scratched the surface of some of these secrets.

It is time to return to Portsmouth again with three new adventures that can be played in a two or three hour adventure slot. The adventures are:

Blood for Cthulhu!
Trail of the Rat
The Open Tomb




A Dungeon Crawl Classics anthology for 4-8 level 2 characters by Daniel J. Bishop.

186484.name: Hellshot
186484.description:
From publisher blurb:

HELLSHOT!

Coming from a legacy of villainy, Hellshot has shown up in you campaign city and has a list of people that he needs to take down. Can your heroes stop him from completing his fiendish mission? Or will they fall along with his targets?

186485.name: Savage Tales of Horror: Volume 3
rpg: The Savage World of Solomon Kane
186485.description:
From publisher blurb:

Savage Tales of Horror is a collection of five adventures for Savage Worlds. It requires only the core rules to play.

Your unit is stranded on an Isle of Death, where what lies dead beneath the sands almost certainly won't remain that way.
The shards of a Witch’s soul is written in The Final Page of an ancient tome of evil. Who else can stop this terror but you the Accursed, those who are witchmarked themselves!
A deep space distress call reignites a bitter eons–old war between two deadly adversaries, intent on drawing you into their conflict, or to just Hear You Scream!
Hotel 96 is waiting for you. It promises fine music, great food, and a release for the soul…but it has a burning desire to make you stay for good!
Ghastly aspirations roam old London town…while a dancing craze causes death by euphoric exhaustion. Who will survive The Dance of the Dead?




Isle of Death may be used with the Weird War II setting. The Final Page may be used with the Accursed setting, available fromwww.meliorvia.com. Hear You Scream may be used with The Last Parsec setting. Hotel 96 may be used with the East Texas Universitysetting. The Dance of the Dead may be used with the Savage World of Solomon Kane setting.

Additional rules are provided where an adventure takes place in an existing setting.

186486.name: The Demonolater
186486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Demonolaters are priests who serve demon lords and ladies. The character class is a sub-class of cleric, but each demon lord has priests with special powers and spells, nearly 40 of which are included (with names like dark offering, invite possession, and warp reality).

This supplement also includes rules for demonic pacts and statistics for the demon lord Dagon and his minions, the dreaded carcharo demons.

The Demonolater is an optional character class suitable for either PC or NPC use, with details on nearly 40 new spells. It is suitable for use with any RPG compatible with the basic or advanced versions of the world's most popular role-playing game.

Take your campaign down a darker path with the demonolater!

186487.name: The Witch
186487.description:
From publisher blurb:

This witch is not a sexy nature-worshipper. Nor is she a misunderstood and unjustly persecuted healer and herbalist. This is the witch of the Brothers Grimm, the Malleus Maleficarum, and Medieval folklore. It features approximately fifty new spells such as Hand of Glory, Blight Field, Candle Magic, and Masse Noire, plus full descriptions of spells that are shared with other classes, so players will have everything they need at their fingertips. Cover art and an interior character illustration is by veteran OSR artist Jason Sholtis.

The witch can be used as either an optional player-character class or an NPC class in any campaign that uses rules compatible with the basic or advanced versions of the world's most popular role-playing game.

Take your campaign down a darker path with the witch!

186488.name: The Juju Doctor (Base Class)
186488.description:
From publisher blurb:

The month of spooks and spectres, so we decided a Halloween issue was appropriate. Rather than doing something traditional, this issue introduces the Juju Doctor, a spell caster that dwells in both the land of the living and the dead, communicating with the Loa and focusing their powers for a variety of situations. Although loosely based on the principles of hoodoo ("voodoo") the Juju doctor has a heavily necromantic flavor while also building upon the maintaining the balance between the physical and spiritual planes of existence.

186489.name: Elementos
186489.description:
Elementos is a fast-paced strategy game for two. Rules are easy and quick to learn but unleash a game with surprising strategic depth.

Elementos is about setting traps and thinking ahead. It's a head to head challenge taking place in a natural setting.

The idea behind Elementos is simple. We play in a world of 3 fundamental elements: Fire, water and a tree.. The 3 different elements complete a life cycle; fire takes tree, tree takes water, and water takes fire; the elements create a comfy state of equilibrium. Thing is, each game piece is actually a two faced deceiving character since game pieces can be flipped to reveal a different element on their other side known only to their master.
These elements are potential carriers of your wand, which is the real star of the game.

Be the first player to advance the wand to the other side of the board – and you become an Elemaster, a winner of the game.

The game is portable, and all game parts are made of wood with top quality prints (silkscreened).

186490.name: Cathay Arts of Role-Playing
186490.description:
User summary:

Cathay Arts of Role-Playing is a radically unique approach to standard tabletop gaming, with concept and execution firmly entrenched in Chinese culture and theory of role-playing. Originally developed in Chinese, it is made available in English as a series of HTML pages including:


A - Cast (Characters, Five Roots, Families of Martial Arts)
B - Combat (Standard and Optional Procedures)
C - Advanced Combat
D - Advancement
E - Heaven and Earth (Cosmology)
F - Magic
G - Advanced Magic (incomplete)


Characters are developed on a "Nine House Chart", or "House of Basics" which is a type of combined character sheet and development methodology. The graph is divided into nine regions with an upper row indicating social status and the lower row indicating inventories. The central row indicates personality and talents--the three "Houses" on this central row are Wen (Academic Arts), Yuan (Basics), and Wu (Martial Arts); in traditional English role-playing these roughly equate to Skills, Attributes, and Combat, respectively.

Yuan (Basics) is comprised of the Wu Ben (Five Roots) of Xiang (Countenance), Zhi (Intellect), Li (Strength), Shou (Endurance), and Gan (Perception). These are Attributes, though each is sub-divided into a Yang and a Yin Aspect--for example Xiang (Countenance) is divided into Se (Carnal) and Xin (Moral); and Li (Strength) is divided into Gang (Hard) and Rou (Soft). Each Aspect is assigned a numeric rating from 1 to 9 generated on 3d6 for the Root and then distributed into each Aspect by player fiat.

186491.name: Yin Ma Shen Zhou: The Fairy Land of the Drinking Horse
186491.description:
User summary:

Yin Ma Shen Zhou is a role-playing world setting intended for use with the Cathay Arts of Role-Playing system. The setting features a heavy emphasis on martial arts but also presents philosophies, religions, academics, wars, myths, magic, and other aspects of society. The setting is developed in several major HTML pages, including:


Yin Ma Shen Zhou (Introduction)
Dragons and Tigers of Wulin
Cultures and Customs
Draw Your Sword (or Pen)!
Hall of Kungfu (Gongfu Tang - Extensive)
Society, Bestiary, Mythology
Martial Arts Heroes
Sanskrit Glossary

186492.description:
Welcome to the second generation of space refugies! The little Flouks were born on Earth, but some of them are Zybrides, who inherited their traits from the two peoples their parents belong to.

10 cards P'tits Flouks
5 cards P'tits chefs
14 action cards
1 card décret
186492.name: Flouk Zybrides

186493.name: The World of Lyreberyl
186493.description:
User summary:

The World of Lyreberyl is a disc world with a distinctive oriental tone. The setting is presented in a series of HTML pages that present an introduction, notes about the various gods and powers, an extensive art gallery, and notes on an adaptation of the setting to a play-by-mail campaign including a fascinating ASCII map.

186494.name: The Earth of Eglantine
186494.description:
User summary:

The Earth of Eglantine is a campaign setting with a distinctive oriental tone. The setting is presented in a series of HTML pages that focus on history, geography, and politics. The setting includes some original art and several maps (mostly black-and-white). The geography is somewhat atypical in the amount of historical detail provided.

186495.name: Alchemist's Laboratory
186495.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all dungeons feature the traditional setup of a monster-filled subterranean network of rooms and passages. Woodland groves, haunted houses, druid groves and more can all serve as an exciting backdrop to the PCs’ adventures. Such locations present their own set of unique design challenges, though, for the time-crunched GM plotting the next adventure.

This instalment of Alternate Dungeons presents loads of great details, hints and tips for a GM designing an adventure set in an alchemist's laboratory. Designed to save a GM’s time while adding flavoursome details to bring the locale alive in the player’s minds, Alternate Dungeons: Alchemist's Laboratory is an essential tool in any GM’s arsenal.

Note: This product does not deal with the alchemist class.

186496.name: Abandoned Village
186496.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all dungeons feature the traditional setup of a monster-filled subterranean network of rooms and passages. Woodland groves, haunted houses, druid groves and more can all serve as an exciting backdrop to the PCs’ adventures. Such locations present their own set of unique design challenges, though, for the time-crunched GM plotting the next adventure.

This instalment of Alternate Dungeons presents loads of great details, hints and tips for a GM designing an adventure set in an abandoned village. Designed to save a GM’s time while adding flavoursome details to bring the locale alive in the player’s minds, Alternate Dungeons: Abandoned VIllage is an essential tool in any GM’s arsenal. Alternate Dungeons: Abandoned Village presents:

Abandoned Village: An Alternate Dungeon
Abandoned Village: Dressing
Abandoned Village: Denizens
Abandoned Village: Traps & Hazards
Abandoned Village: Adventure Hooks

186497.name: Idyll
186497.description:
From publisher blurb:

Idyll seems like the perfect place to live, but subtle signs something is not right are scattered throughout the village. Why are the residents reluctant to leave the village’s precincts? Why are there so few children in such a prosperous place? How has the village stayed unspoiled with the wasteland surrounding it? Why is the seemingly empty Wardens’ Lodge that once served as the centre of law for Idyll so ominous? Those who investigate too deeply into Idyll’s mystery may discover plane-shattering implications. Whether the curious can share these secrets is yet another question.

186498.name: Logging Town
186498.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features, NPCs and minor encounters to add to the trade towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Logging Town is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Logging Town presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the sights and sounds of a logging town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample business found in a logging town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample folk found in a logging town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

186499.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (September 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Dusty Crypt
20 Things to Find in a Necromancer's Sanctum
Caves & Caverns: Strands of Terror (EL 13; XP 25,600)
186499.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s own Borderland of Adventure campaign, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

GM’s Monthly Miscellany: September 2015 presents:

20 Things to Find in a Dusty Crypt
Kennutcat At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Kennutcat)
Alchemist’s Laboratory: An Alternate Dungeon (from Alternate *Dungeons: Alchemist’s Laboratory)
Strands of Terror (from Caves & Caverns)
20 Things to Find in a Necromancer’s Sanctum

186500.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (October 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in an Abandoned Building
20 Things to Find in an Alchemist's Laboratory
186500.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s own Borderland of Adventure campaign, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

GM’s Monthly Miscellany: October 2015 presents:

20 Things to Find in an Alchemist's Laboratory
Idyll At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Idyll)
Abandoned Village: An Alternate Dungeon (from Alternate Dungeons: Abandoned Village)
Warhorses (from So What's the Mount Like, Anyway?)
War Ponies (from So What's the Mount Like, Anyway?)
20 Things to Find in an Abandoned Building

186001.name: The Great War
186001.description:
From the introduction:

The Great War...is set in a magical world, named Elon, where magic is at the brink of extinction. Steel, steam power and gunpowder are taking over. The technology is comparable with that of the first world war. The same weapons, vehicles and bloody mess. Except there's still some magic in the air.

User summary:

The Great War was an ambitious concept to detail a complete d20 game implementation around a campaign setting based on an alternative-history world named Elon. The project faltered during development, however, and only portions of the setting were completed. The setting comprises a world map, a world history, and some additional/variant rules for d20 to support automobiles and vehicles. For example, the Skills Drive, Pilot, and Sail are added. The most complete development area was on early 1900s fighter airplanes.

The final-state content was made available in HTML. A downloadable version was contemplated but never produced.

186002.name: Kumite
186002.description:
Two players battle it out in the attempt to knock out their opponent. If you decrease your opponent's health to zero, you win.

Players manage a dojo of skills using Experience Points to build a deck of attack and defense cards that can adapt to an opponent’s evolving strategy.
The linear mat component allows players to control distance to avoid damage and get in range to strike.

Stuns and takedowns break an opponent’s rhythm leaving him/her without enough stamina to pull off brutal combos.

Holds can create an opening for attack and often work in combination with other moves creating another level of strategy.

186003.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 2.10 - Oct 2015)
rpgissuearticle: What's Going On With Misfit Studios
186003.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.

186004.name: Grand Ages: Medieval
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
186004.description:
It is the year 1050 AD. At the beginning of the High Middle Ages development in Europe has seen an unprecedented level of progress and a rapidly growing population spreads across the length and breadth of the continent. New frontiers are explored, settlements founded and vast trading routes established. As the head of one of these small settlements, it falls upon you to lead your people towards greatness.

Explore a vast world, gather resources, encounter other societies and use your trading expertise to expand and make your fortune. Found new cities, progress your nation with inventive technology and protect your trade routes against barbarian attacks until you are powerful enough to begin your conquest over Europe and forge a bold new empire.

Grand Ages: Medieval is a real-time strategy game from Gaming Minds. Lead your people and advance through the decades by utilising construction, research, expansion and conquest in an area extending from Scandinavia and North Africa; to Portugal, the Caucasus and the Middle East. Rise from the humble role of a simple mayor governing a small settlement and rule over all of Europe. Experience an exciting campaign with elaborately designed cut-scenes, play by your own rules in free play or test your skills in multiplayer against up to 8 players!

Features:


Explore a gigantic game world of over 20 million square kilometres, plot strategically where to found important cities and defend your kingdom against foreign powers


*Raise an army and fight your opponents with knights, archers and cavalry

Produce and trade 20 different goods to meet the demands of your citizens and soldiers: such as coal, fruits and pottery
Research and utilise 50 major technological advancements of the Middle Ages: including the three-field crop rotation, the low warp loom or the longbow
Face devastating natural disasters like storms, fires, volcanoes, droughts, earthquakes… or even the Black Death




Source: The Game Website.

186005.name: Shaintar: Legends Unleashed Player's Guide
186005.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the Players Guide, containing Player information for Heroic and Legendary play!

Your Savage Worlds fantasy gaming experience grows to Heroic and Legendary levels with this highly-anticipated follow-up to Shaintar: Legends Arise.

Savage Worlds fans will find even more to love about Shaintar: Legends Unleashed:

Over 40 new Racial Edges for each of the original 11 Races of Shaintar.
Dozens of other new Edges, including unique and defining Heroic and Legendary Edges.
Vastly expanded options for Magic, including Places, Items, and Times of Power; War Magic; and the genre-expanding High Magic that brings Savage Worlds fans the kind of world-shaking mystical power they've been craving.
Further information for Alchemists and Artificers, expanding their capabilities.
More magical and alchemical items, and a lot more about Builder Weapons, Armor, and Gear.
The View from On High, furthering the story of Shaintar and giving players and GMs a clear sense of the role of true *Legends in the workings of the world.
More Weapons, Armor, and Gear, including Obsidian weapons for the Korindians and the highly popular "Hammerbolt Modification" for Dwarven Crossbows. Oh, there's the Orc Blade-Shield, too!




Continue your Epic High Fantasy journey with this book, and find tons of material that will enhance the Heroic and Legendary Ranks of any Savage Worlds game!

186007.name: Grey Lotus (Version 1.0)
186007.description:
From the introduction:

Well, its two main points are the fantasy setting that is not based on Tolkien, and the freeform magic system. Grey Lotus doesn't have "elves" or "dwarves" or "halfings" like most fantasy systems, instead blending Celtic lore with other myths, and mixing in some original creations. The magic system is completely open ended, but limited in enough ways that magician characters are on fairly even footing with non-spellcasters. Other appealing characteristics are an epic, detailed fighting system, open-ended advancement, and the fact that its free!

User summary:

The initial edition of Grey Lotus was released in two very minor variations-version 0.99 in June 2002 and Version 1.0 in July 2002, the differences being almost entirely in formatting and minor editing. The HTML version has occasional formatting issues as it was automatically generated.

186008.name: Grey Lotus (Version 1.93)
186008.description:
User summary:

Grey Lotus Version 1.93 sometimes refers to itself internally as "version 2". This major revision of the rules vastly clarifies the mechanics, standardizes processes, and presents a more consistent game.

Character generation remains complex and lengthy. Each Attribute pair (Endurance/Strength, Dexterity/Reflexes, Intelligence/Perception, Willpower/Wisdom, and Charisma/Manipulation) is given a named Attribute Group (respectively: Body, Ability, Mind, Spirit, Social). Skills retain a statistic of Rating and Dice, with Rating (1-10) representing ability and Dice (2-5) representing the dice pool for the Skill. Resolution involves rolling the dice pool, selecting the highest result, and adding it to the Attribute associates with the Skill and the Skill Rank. Dice "explode" on a roll of 10. The final result is compared to a Difficulty Level. The rules support a "Margin of Success" and "Margin of Failure" mechanic.

186009.name: Magic of Grey Lotus
186009.description:
From the introduction:

As a fantasy game, magic surrounds and fills the lives of characters in Grey Lotus. It is a constant source of mystery for the characters, yet it aids them almost daily. Despite this, the rules and spells given in the Rulebook were only the most basic, due to space limitations. This supplement expands and clarifies on the rules. It covers all things from advanced magical skills, to new spells, to new Disciplines for characters, and even details the powerful magics of the Kurr’d-ah and the forbidden powers of the Magi. This is the ultimate reference for players of magician characters.

User summary:

In addition to provide extended options for magic, this supplement also provides several revisions and clarifications to the rules presented in the core book.

186010.name: Legacies (Version 2014)
186010.description:
From the Introduction:

Legacies is a fantasy role-playing game, focused upon replicating high fantasy and unusual, sometimes strange cultures and creatures.

User summary:

Legacies is a completely overhauled version of the game formerly titled Grey Lotus. The primary design goal was to simplify and streamline the core mechanic to eliminate complexity that was deemed unnecessary through extensive playtesting. Major changes include swapping d10 for d6, limiting the dice pool, and providing for a smoother probability chart of Skill resolution rolls. Also, Attributes and Skills have been simplified. The setting is changed from monotheistic to polytheistic, has a better climate system, and is politically simplified.

Note: Several sections of the 2014 rules are incomplete.

186011.name: You Don't Say
186011.description:
'You Don't Say' is a word game played over multiple rounds, where players attempt to guess a specific word based on the verbal clues provided.
Players are first divided into 2-4 teams of at least 2 people, who are either the 'Clue Givers' or 'Guessers', which may change between turns.

As the 'guessers' attempt to determine the mystery word, the clue givers are restricted by 3 simple rules:
-Cannot spell all or part of the word
-Cannot use the word itself, in any form
-Cannot use 'rhymes with' or 'sounds like' clues.

Each turn lasts the length of the included timer (about 1 minute) and so multiple word clues may be attempted if teams talk and answer fast.
Teams progress around the board based on the number of correctly guessed words each turn, plus a roll of the random 'bonus die'.

The first team to reach the 'FINISH' space on the gameboard is the winner!

From the Box:
The Talk FAST, guess FASTER game.

Talk about it. Act it out...But DON'T SAY IT!

You Don't Say is the hilarious, high-energy guessing game where fast talkers team with fast guessers to win!

Get your teammates to guess words based on your clues, without saying the words. The more they answer correctly, the father you move on the board.

With six world-encompassing categories and 3000 simple-to-challenging words, YOU DON'T SAY is fast-talking, quick-moving fun for everyone! 500 Cards! 3000 Words!

186012.name: Pocket Dungeon Quest: Don't Go Alone Expansion
186012.description:
Don't Go Alone, the first expansion for Pocket Dungeon Quest, adds new concepts to the core gameplay that gives additional strategic choices to the Heroes. It also introduces campaigns and equipment upgrades that carry over through many sessions of play.

Gear is the highlight of the Don't Go Alone expansion. Gear in PDQ is pieces of equipment that the Hero pulls out of the Treasure Pile as a reward for Leveling Up. There are many different types of Gear which add loads of new skills and abilities to the Heroes as they adventure through the dungeon.

Gear is earned by killing Monsters and Leveling Up and finding keys on the Dungeon Floor. Hardcore players can randomize which pieces of Gear they equip. Otherwise you get to choose which combination of Gear best fits with your style of play. Mix and match the Gear for interesting effects and abilities, and most of all, HAVE FUN!

186013.description:
Optional player board for Denmark with special national power and white player figures.

Denmark
Fur Trade: Starts the game with one Fur and one Fish Trade Good. At any time, the Danish player may secretly look at the Discovery counters located in New France and New England.
186013.name: Empires: Age of Discovery – Denmark Player Board and White Figures

186014.name: Off-Road Velociraptor Safari
186014.description:
Players assume the role of a velociraptor wearing a pith helmet and monocle, driving a jeep with a spiked flail attached, and must accrue as many points as possible in a four-minute period by performing stunts and running down other velociraptors. Each time a velociraptor is struck, the game's speed is reduced to slow motion and its catapulted body becomes the focus of the in-game camera.

Source: Wikipedia, "Off-Road Velociraptor Safari", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

186015.name: Empires: Age of Discovery – Ottoman Player Board and Gold Figures
186015.description:
Optional player board for Ottomans with special national power and gold player figures.

Ottoman Empire
Holy Warriors: When sending Soldiers out using the Colonist Dock, they may be treated like Missionaries (i.e., +1 Colonist in region).

186016.name: Empires: Age of Discovery – Prussia Player Board and Black Figures
186016.description:
Optional player board for Prussia with special national power and black player figures.

Prussia
Professional Military: Once per Age, when resolving one Battle during the Warfare event, each attacking Prussian Soldier in the selected region eliminates 2 enemy units (maximum 1 enemy Soldier may be eliminated per friendly Soldier).

186017.name: Chill (3rd Edition)
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 87 - Monsterhearts 2, Shooting the Moon, Chill 3E
186017.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every one of us is weak: mere ants against the stalking giants that have brought us to our knees. Even when we work together, the Unknown is bigger than us, better armed, and better prepared for what’s to come. We have no real advantage, and our greatest victories have been nothing but the monsters toying with us before they descend to feast. Our fight is hopeless.

This is how we’re going to win.

—Hayat Nejem, “How to SAVE the World”

The uneasy feeling that creeps up your spine as you walk down a darkened hallway. The way your footsteps echo oddly on a deserted street at night, as though there was someone walking somewhere behind you. The shape you see out of the corner of your eye when you’re home alone.

The Unknown lurks in the dark.

We all know it. Luckily, some of us use that knowledge to fight. The odds may be against us, but we can win.

Investigate the Unknown.

Rescue the Innocent.

Kill the Monsters.

Will you stand with us? Remember — SAVE is on your side.

Chill 3rd Edition is an investigative horror roleplaying game about people who stand up against monsters, hunting down supernatural threats and protecting the world from the Unknown. You don’t have to be a superhero to be a member of SAVE; you just have to stand up and join us.

186018.name: Supplemental Files
186018.description:
User summary:

Numerous supplemental files were provided to support The Guide to Adventure. These included graphics files, ASCII text files, and miscellaneous files. Many files were used with all versions of the game; other files were specific to the genre being implemented.

Graphics Files


Fourteen GIF files comprising Character Sheets
Two GIF files comprising Event Calendars
Two GIF files comprising Combat Reference Charts
Four GIF files comprising GM's Party Tracking Sheets
Six GIF files comprising Damage/Status Tokens
Eight GIF files comprising "covers" for rule books
Twelve GIF files comprising Combat Sequence Cards
Twenty GIF files comprising Combat Cards for Fantasy
Ten GIF files comprising Combat Cards for modern combat
Eight CDR files comprising Combat Cards for modern combat


Generally, these graphics files were intended to be "print-and-play" supplements for full-page printing.

Note that most of these graphics files also were provided in ZIP archives and also in individual PostScript format. Most of these were released in a "5.0" and a "5.2" version which vary only by image size. Some also appear in a "5.1 and "5.3" version.

Text Files


Downloads - multiple files listing file names, contents, and locations
FAQ - multiple files in question-and-answer format
House Rules #1 - a single-issue ASCII 'zine with various topics
Names - multiple files with random tables to generate names
Update - multiple files partially explaining versions


Other Files


Two ZIP archives containing multiple pre-generated characters
Three custom TrueType fonts

186019.name: Sonic Episode 2
186019.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




This Sonic version made long ago by me and my friends enjoy!

Source: The Game Website.

186020.description:
Stawka większa niż życie (More than life at stake) is board game inspired by most popular tv series produced by TVP (Polish television) in 1967. This black and white series is broadcasted almost every year (by different Polish tv channels).

Action takes place during World War II in Poland occupied by Germans. In game one player becomes a member of the Polish resistance and try to execute tasks against occupants.

The second player becomes a member of German forces and tries to stop Polish actions.

Each player controls up to four agents. Each turn player choose a card which decides whose agent first makes his move and what is the amount of action points. This points can be used to moving agents on map and taking special actions like searching for items or evidence of illegal activity. They can try to talk with enemy agents to force them to reveal secret information. German agents may try arrest Poles but polish agents may try to make assassination of gestapo officers. After successful actions, players receive Victory Points.

Both players can play cards to use special effects or to disturb enemy actions.

Every scenario has special win conditions (like finding some items or execute some activities). If this conditions are not achieved, players must compare Victory Points they gathered.
186020.name: Stawka większa niż życie

186021.description:
This Next War supplement will contain the following items:

•Cyber Warfare Capabilities
•Alternate Advanced Air Game
•Submarines
•Random Events
•Optional Rules
•One and a half counter sheets (containing the counters necessary for Cyber Warfare, Alternate Air Game, and Submarine Markers as well as some useful game state markers)
•One new Advanced Game Sequence of Play (incorporating necessary changes for the new rules)
•One Player Aid Card


SPECIAL***




This entire supplement will be available for free download via the Next War Series Support Site, including PDF files for the required counters (which will be DIY).
186021.name: Next War: Supplement #1

186024.name: Alien Dawn Gamemaster Handbook
186024.description:
User summary:

The Alien Dawn Gamemaster Handbook is the principle document providing the science fiction genre mechanics for the game system. The document was created about 1991 and released in various formats prior to the 1996 version. The final version of the Gamemaster Handbook was published as a series of fourteen WordPerfect documents in a ZIP archive. Roughly simultaneously, the material was released in a series of ASCII text files. The Gamemaster Handbook provides rules for Aliens (including technology, weapons, and spaceships), tips for campaign management, and methods to use cards (distributed separately) to randomize events. It also includes a bestiary. The bulk of the book, however, is devoted to combat which occurs in phases and is played with scale miniatures. Combat includes everything from archaic weapons to futuristic vehicle combat.

186025.name: Amalgam
186025.description:
From publisher blurb:

Proof that powers don't make the hero ... because Amalgam's got your powers, too, and one thing Amalgam most definitely isn't is a hero. Arrogant by design, this sorcerous construct hates you for having the one thing its creator denied it - a soul. So, it's going to show its better than you regardless, and the only way it knows how, violently and with your own tricks and talents turned against you.

Amalgam is a PL 11 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

186026.name: Alien Dawn Player Handbook
186026.description:
User summary:

The Alien Dawn Player Handbook is the principle document providing the science fiction genre setting and character creation methods for the game system. The document was created about 1991 and released in various formats prior to the 1996 version. The final version of the Player Handbook was published as a series of ten WordPerfect documents in a ZIP archive. Roughly simultaneously, the material was released in a series of ASCII text files. The Player Handbook provides rules for Character Generation, equipment, armor, vehicles, and psionics.

Characters have a Nationality and other demographic information including Outlooks, Phobia, and History. They have Attributes (Agility, Coordination, Dexterity, Education, Endurance, Health, Intuition, Learning Ability, Observation, Perception, Strength, and Willpower) which have numeric scores distributed from a point pool. Characters also have a military Rank and Skills. Personal combat is handled by utilization of the appropriate weapon Skill.

186027.name: Siren Class Hunter Submarine
186027.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the Siren Class Submarine, a deadly predator lurking beneath the waves.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

186028.name: 10 All-New Undead Monsters
186028.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold, the spookiest dungeonous octopus title yet! 10 All-New Undead Monsters!

Inside you will find:

Crawling Tongue—Giant and swarm.
Sukoshinbutshu Mummy—the mummy that is also a monk.
Phantasmagoria—Horrifying swarm of ghosts.
Phantom Limb—Ghost limbs, an arm and a leg.
Shrieking Crypt Skeleton—Quite possibly the loudest skeleton.
Visceral Creeper—this ones pretty much what it sounds like.
Electric Zombie—a zombie forged of science and magic.
Cadaver Lantern—A zombie filled with murderous rage... like magical murderous rage.
Slime-Vomiting Zombie—The zombie that fights with vomit.
Tar Zombie—walking pile of dissolving flesh.




Plus 4 new feats, 3 new spells, and 2 additional insignificant monsters—so really it’s like 14 monsters for the price of 10, which is a deal.

186029.name: Daggers
186029.description:
Daggers is an asymmetrical abstract board game played on an 8x8 board.

As described by João Pedro Neto on The World of Abstract Board Games:

UPHILL & DOWNHILL - "Downhill" refers to the direction towards the "Low player", and "Uphill" refers to the direction towards the "High player".
DAGGER - Daggers slide along the column or diagonals downhill as far as they like, but only one cell uphill or diagonally uphill. There is no side movement. Daggers can capture any piece along the diagonals (going either uphill or downhill) and can capture Crowns (but not Daggers) along the column.
CROWNS - A Crown can move to any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell. A Crown can also capture any enemy piece on any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent cell.
TURN - On each turn, each player moves one of his pieces. The High player moves first.
GOAL - A player wins by capturing an enemy Crown or by moving one of his own Crowns into the opponent's first row.

186030.name: Hard Targets
186030.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE CLOAK OF DEATH

It’s thick. Luxurious. Concealing. The cloak of death will make you feared, envied, and maybe even wealthy. It will also smother your soul. The best assassins in the Sixth World can gain untold wealth and make the whole world shake, but they also will be hunted and stalked until the end of their days. Assuming their conscience doesn’t eat them alive.

Hard Targets is a shadowrunner’s guide to bringing death, with information on getting into wetwork, tactics for doing the job, and critical gear. It also contains plot details and adventure hooks, including an in-depth look at the city of Havana in the Caribbean League, a political and criminal hotspot that lends itself to all sorts of wetwork jobs. The work is there—if you can deaden your soul enough to take it.

Hard Targets is a Deep Shadows book for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

186031.name: Alien Dawn References
186031.description:
User summary:

Alien Dawn References consists of three ZIP archive files, each containing approximately twenty GIF image files, almost all of which are intended for full-page print-and-use. The files include a variety of resources including pre-generated alien NPCs, genre-specific character sheets, genre-specific combat reference sheets, GM tracking sheets, event logs, explosives and indirect fire combat reference sheets, firearms and other high tech equipment data sheets, and vehicle reference sheets.

186034.name: PitRush
186034.description: PitRush is an action-packed game of skill in which players try to capture the pits of the game board with their disks in order to earn the most points. Players take shots by flicking their disk with their finger. Opponent disks can be struck off, and pits can be taken over by stopping on top of the disk in the pit. Players score points based on the distance of the hole they occupy (or cover) from their shooting location on the edge of the board.

186035.name: The Guide to Adventure Gamemaster's Handbook
186035.description:
User summary:

The Gamemaster Handbook was published in final format as "Release 5.1". This was provided as sixteen ZIP archives of WordPerfect format files. This same edition of the book was released in RTF and PostScript formats as well as in ASCII text format. Numerous prior editions of the book exist in various formats. A later single ZIP archive gathered all WordPerfect files and two GIF files (intended for full-page printing) of the cover and frontispiece into a single download.

The Gamemaster Handbook was intended to provide a generic, universal framework for gaming in nearly any genre but retains much of the fantasy genre with which it originally was designed.

The handbook includes a section on converting other gaming system characters and statistics into The Guide to Adventure format. It also includes methods for managing campaigns and how to use Cards to randomize events. A variety of special types of damage is considered. Materials also include a Bestiary, an herbal guide, magical equipment, and a notes and rules on siege warfare. The bulk of the manual, however, details the complex combat round and how it proceeds.

186036.name: The Guide to Adventure Player's Handbook
186036.description:
User summary:

The Player Handbook was published in final format as "Release 5.1". This was provided as fifteen ZIP archives of WordPerfect format files. This same edition of the book was released in RTF and PostScript formats as well as in ASCII text format. Numerous prior editions of the book exist in various formats. A later single ZIP archive gathered all WordPerfect files into a single download.

The Player Handbook was intended to provide a generic, universal framework for gaming in nearly any genre but retains much of the fantasy genre with which it originally was designed.

The handbook primarily is focused on character creation and related information, including sections on economics, psionics, spells (extensive), deities, religion, and equipment. Characters select a Race and other demographics, including Age, Quirks, Phobias, Outlooks, History, and so forth. Characters have Attributes (Agility, Coordination, Dexterity, Education, Endurance, Health, Intuition, Learning Ability, Magic Affinity, Observation, Perception, Strength, and Willpower), each with an Attribute Score (2-11) purchased from a point pool. Characters also have Skills, drawn from several Skill groups. Combat is resolved through Skill use.

186038.name: Alien Dawn Milkrun
186038.description:
From the adventure:

The community is running low on grain seed. Two days travel to the south is Macleash Lake, a community much like the one the players begin at. Macleash Lake requires milk and will trade grain seed for fresh milk. Freedom's Stronghold agrees and instructs the characters to deliver the milk in a 5000 liter tank truck supplied by the community. The mission is straight forward and trouble is not expected. Relations with Macleash Lake are good although physical contact has never been established.

User summary:

Introductory scenario for Alien Dawn implementation of The Guide to Adventure. Usually distributed as a ZIP archive including an ASCII Text and WordPerfect version of the adventure, and a GIF image of a town map.

186039.name: Carbon Copy Politics
186039.description:
A strategy card game about well intended people in bitter competition over exactly how to save the planet from climate change...and how to serve their own special interests while doing so.

Take on the role of a special interest group trying to save the world from a changing climate. However, while all the interest groups want to maximize positive impact, they all have different priorities for how to go about it. Are you advocating clean energy, habitat protection, or island nations that might get flooded? Will you pass laws to create subsidies, institute a carbon tax, or maybe attempt an ambitious geo-engineering project? Every method has its own benefits and drawbacks, and you will need strategic planning and political cunning to lead your organization to success.

Mechanics:
Players attempt to pass bills into law, both to have an impact in general and to further their own special interest's goals. However, all players will need to pursue a mixed strategy to succeed -- your special interest does not dictate your strategy. For example, a player might be rewarded for seeing enough geo-engineer projects succeed, regardless of who plays those cards -- so they might play those cards themselves or negotiate for someone else to play them.

Carbon Copy Politics uses a novel "clock" mechanic to track the progress of activities over time. Players play cards onto the clock, which ticks down each turn. Cards that reach the end of the clock resolve, building variable delays into the play of every card. The delay requires players to plan ahead, allow them to set up combos, and creates opportunities for disruption by opponents. For example, bill cards are typically delayed by 3 turns before they are evaluated, so you might play it one turn, play an action to boost public will-for-change the next turn, play a modifier on it the next turn, and then discard cards as the bill resolves to pay the rest of the cost.

Bill cards are rated by their difficulty (cost) and impact (score). Different types of bills offer different ways to pay the cost. Carbon Tax bills get easier to pass as more taxes are passes, while Cap and Trade bills are easier if several are played at the same time by different players.

186040.name: Attack of the Big Green Munchy Things
186040.description:
Use your mouse to draw lines to guide your spaceship through space to save the astronauts from the Big Green Munchy Things

Source: The Game Website.

186042.name: Mad Virus
186042.description:
Be the mastermind behind rapidly growing viruses.

Grow a Virus that covers the board before you run out of moves. the cells with the eyes are controlled by you.
After choosing a color with the buttons at the left your virus will expand to the cells of the chosen color that are in direct contact with controlled cells.

Source: The Game Website.

186043.name: Monopoly: Copa Mundial de la Fifa Brasil 2014
186043.description:
Esta nueva versión del clásico Monopoly incluye dentro de su tablero a 22 de las 32 selecciones que participaron en la Copa del Mundo: Brasil, Colombia, España, Argentina, Alemania, Italia, Holanda, Portugal, Uruguay, Francia, Chile, Inglaterra, Estados Unidos, Rusia, Nigeria, Japón, México, Ecuador, Camerún, Corea del Sur, Costa Rica, y Honduras.
Monopoly Copa Mundial de la FIFA Brasil 2014 incluye: Tablero con las 22 selecciones, 6 fichas con diseños alusivos al mundial, 28 tarjetas de título de propiedad, 16 tarjetas fuleco y 16 tarjetas trofeo, 1 paquete de dinero, 32 casas, 12 hoteles y 2 dados.



Version of Monopoly themed on the 2014 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.

186044.name: Connect-It
186044.description:
This puzzle game is similar to Mah Jongg in some ways, but different in others. Your main objective is to remove image block pairs and clear the game board of all blocks before the monkey gets to the top of the vine.

Pairs can only be removed if they have at least one open side and are a maximum of 2 turns away from each other. There is an exception to this rule – if two identical blocks are sitting next to one another, they can be removed without the need for an open side.

Accumulate coins to buy power-ups. The faster you are, the more coins you will get. You’ll need the power-ups for later levels when thing get crazy.

Source: The Game Website.

186045.name: Bouncy The Ball
186045.description:
Control Bouncy across 25 levels with a boss at the end. Collect coins and dodge dangerous objects.

Source: The Game Website.

186046.name: Zombie Zoeds
186046.description:
User Summary

This top-down shooter allows you to shoot zombies, sort of, since it is riddled with poor development decisions. You can only shoot in certain directions and at certain times, all of which is not really explained. Your goal is amorphous too, but involves you going through the woods towards some lab. The graphics are pretty basic as well. The controls are worse than basic.

186047.name: Mouse Maneuver
186047.description:
Guide your mouse through the various levels without touching the red areas.

Source: The Game Website.

186048.name: Ice Breakout!
186048.description:
Holy crap, it’s like breakout but it’s slippery. See how far you can get through all these levels.

Source: The Game Website.

186049.name: Float Beta
186049.description:
A fun game where you are a floating face.

Source: The Game Website.

186050.name: Enigmatica (2007)
186050.description:
Tricky block-sliding puzzle game. Complete a board by lining up the tiles in either rows or columns of the same tile.
You get more points for completing the board with less moves and using less time.
In the challenge mode, you get a limited number of moves and a time limit to complete the board.

TIP: Carefully watch the instructions to understand the strategy to use!

Source: The Game Website.

186051.name: Sudoku Challenge
186051.description:
Fill in the grid so that every row, every column, and every 3×3 box contains the digits 1 through 9 without repetition.

Source: The Game Website.

186052.name: Bubble
186052.description:
A quirky little arcade puzzler from EverybodyPanic in which bubbles float from the bottom to the top of the screen and you have to connect them to make bigger ones.

Source: The Game Website.

186053.name: More Bloons
186053.description:
By popular demand, More Bloons is here. Play 50 all-new challenging levels, and a new special balloon type! Some of these levels are very hard, and should keep most of you busy until Bloons 2 is released…

Source: The Game Website.

186054.name: Colors
186054.description:
Choose the color the text is, not the color the text says, has a normal mode with 3 difficulties and a speed mode.

Source: The Game Website.

186055.name: Prisa
186055.description:
A fast action game that progresses in skill as you go along! See how far you can get!

Source: The Game Website.

186056.name: Toxic Blocks
186056.description:
Simple puzzle game, Try to clear the squares as quickly as you possibly can. Click 3 groupings or more of squares and use your power ups wisely.

Source: The Game Website.

186057.name: Circlo
186057.description:
Its abit like a circular version of the game “bust-a-move”.
The balls spin around the center and you have to match 3 balls of the same color to destroy them.

Source: The Game Website.

186058.name: Bomb Stopper
186058.description:
A little number guessing game.

Game 1: Try to stump the computer and blow up the world.
Game 2: You try to defuse the bomb by guessing the computer’s number and not blow up the world.

Source: The Game Website.

186059.name: JIGSAw CHATing
186059.description:
oin the pieces, use R to rotate…
Junten las piezas, usen R para rotar la pieza

Source: The Game Website.

186060.name: Math Trivia Game
186060.description:
This math trivia game was designed my myself and my friend for a math project

Source: The Game Website.

186061.name: Animal Sudoku
186061.description:
traight from the animal kingdom! Try this version of Sudoku by following the way of the footprints. Your score gets lower as time runs out, so think fast! The game has three game modes and hundreds of puzzles to play.

Source: The Game Website.

186062.name: Blinding Lines
186062.description:
I love mouse games, so I decided to make one… With 30 levels!

I hope you all enjoy ‘Blinding Lines’ my newest little game… It took quite a bit of effort because of the boredom of creating all the levels, but it was worth it.
Thanks, remember to vote high and review!

Guide through the maze with your mouse, avoiding objects along the way.

Source: The Game Website.

186063.name: Alchemy of Askrias
186063.description:
Alchemy of Askrias is a casual board game for 1 to 3 players (1 to 5 players with the added 4 to 5 player expansion). The game uses 'Askrias Cubes' which allow the players to socket game tiles, each of which have different abilities on them; which then allows the players to either create the victory points for the win or powerful spells to interfere with your opposing Alchemist's!

The game is focused mainly on actual dice building - each turn players will have the chance to add tiles to a 'Askrias Cube' depending on the formula that they choose which will then alter the way the game is played.

With extra cubes, the game can also be expanded up to 5 players.

186064.name: Colt Express: The Time Travel Car
186064.description:
The Time Travel Car can be used with or without the first expansion: Horses & Stagecoach.
The Time Travel Car is placed in front of the Locomotive.
The Time Travel Car is considered as adjacent to the roof and the inside of the Locomotive. So your Bandit can enter it thanks to a Move action or a Horse action if you play using the Horses and Stagecoach expansion.

Several Bandits can go in the Time Travel Car at the same time, but in order to trigger the action, your Bandit has to be alone in it at the end of a round (after applying the event, if the current round has one).
If this condition is met, all of the other players close their eyes. In the meantime, you must take your Bandit pawn and hide it below the Locomotive;
below one of the Cars; or below the Stagecoach (if you are playing with the expansion). Then, the next Schemin’ phase is played and none of the other players know where your Bandit is. The Bandit’s location is disclosed at the beginning of the Stealin’ phase and the pawn is placed inside the Car where it was hiding. Then all of the actions are resolved.
At the end of the game, after the event is resolved, if one Bandit is alone inside the Time Travel Car, the player receives $500 and all of the loot that may be contained inside.

186065.name: The Twinkles Game: His Trip to the Star Factory
186065.description:
The Twinkles Game: His Trip To The Star Factory. Based on the General Mills Twinkles The Star Shaped Cereal with the Twinkles the Elephant mascot.

The players choose to be one of four characters: Fulton the Camel, Wilbur the Monkey, Leopold the Lion or Sanford the Parrot. The players begin on the Start square, and the Twinkles playing piece starts several squares ahead. Players draw cards that have colors on them and move to the next square with that color on the board. Players must draw a card for Twinkles and move him on his turn, as well. Players cannot pass Twinkles, even if that means they cannot move. Certain squares award the players stars, and others take stars away (if they have any). When Twinkles finally makes it to the Star Factory, the game is over. The player who has the most stars, wins.

186066.name: Dinosauriespelet
186066.description:
The cruel seamonster has taken a baby dino captive on the small island, guarding the waters around the island voraciously. The dinosaurs walk around the board, collecting the watersteps needed to get out to the island and rescue baby dino. On the way you can meet both the sea monster that steals watersteps and the pterodactyl that can fly you to a location of your choice. If you meet another dinosaur you can challenge it for watersteps. The winner is the player that reaches the island first and and saves babydino.

You start with placing the tiles on the board backside up, then take turns moving along the lines collecting waterstep tiles needed to save the baby dino, stone tiles are useless, landsteps are needed to cross certain sections.

186067.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 22.

Comprises two new scoring window tiles: 3 points per horizontal line of at least 3 contiguous landscape tiles and score any one scroll in your territory.
186067.name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King – Brettspiel Adventskalender Promo Tiles
boardgameexpansion: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King

186068.name: Rekin Finansowy
186068.description:
The box description (in Polish):
Giełda, makler, akcje i obligacje... Te i inne ekonomiczne terminy weszły już na trwałe do naszego języka i życia. Proponujemy grę, która wprowadzi nas w świat giełdy, oswoi z prawami rządzącymi rynkiem i finansami. Grę dla wszystkich, bo wszyscy odczuwamy skutki prawdziwej gry giełdowej.

Monopoly-like game about stock exchange. Buying and selling stocks, obligations, etc. to earn more money than other players.

The tracks on the board are two circles, touching on one edge.

186069.description:
The Messe Essen Convention Center is a Wonder for the 7 Wonders: Duel game. The completed Messe is worth 2 points at the end of the game.
It also allows the player, in the moment when it's built, to take one card from the topmost row of the drafting structure (the line laying directly on the table), even if the card is still covered, and build it in her own city for free - only paying the price of the wonder.
186069.name: 7 Wonders Duel: The Messe Essen

186070.description:
Metal Conflict pawn delivered as a promo in Essen 2015. Also available through the publisher's website.

This is a marker used for measuring Conflict. It replaces the plastic one that comes with the game.
186070.name: 7 Wonders Duel:  Metal Conflict Pawn

186071.description:
Ophidian Wars Hallowed Arenas is the first fan made (with the designer) print and play expansion set for Ophidian Wars.

Hallowed Arenas is a mini-expansion that features a Halloween theme ready to release havoc into the Ophidian Wars arenas.

Ophidian Wars Hallowed Arenas mini-expansion set consists in:
2 brand new Ophidian Wars Gladiators
3 brand new Ophidian Wars Maneuvers
3 brand new Ophidian Wars Arsenal Itens
186071.name: Ophidian Wars: Hallowed Arenas

186072.name: Chill Quickstart: Good Fences Make Good Neighbors
186072.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reuben Hall disppeared from his parents' home last night. He out there somewhere, the captive of a creature of the Unknown. The police are looking for him diligently, but they don't know what they're looking for or the nature of what they're facing - but you do. You're members of the Eternal Society of the Silver Way, dedicated to protecting others from the Unknown.

You have very little time, though. Will you stand with us? Remember — SAVE is on your side.

Chill 3rd Edition is an investigative horror roleplaying game about people who stand up against monsters, hunting down supernatural threats and protecting the world from the Unknown. You don’t have to be a superhero to be a member of SAVE; you just have to stand up and join us.

Good Fences Make Good Neighbors is a free scenario for Chill 3rd Edition. It includes all the rules you need to play it, and comes with five pre-generated characters. The scenario plays in two to four hours, depending on your group, and serves as an introduction into the game system and setting of Chill 3rd Edition.

186073.description: Street Fighter Rivals takes the premises of Seiji Kanai's R (BraveRats) into the realm of fighting games. Instead of two equal decks, both players chose one of 8 characters, each with their individual 7 card deck. Winning with certain cards does a certain amount of damage. Win by bringing your opponents health down from 10 to 0.
186073.name: Street Fighter Rivals

186074.name: The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Card Game
boardgameimplementation: The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: The Big Bang Theory
186074.description:
This game is a small card game with 180 trivia cards in a little tin. It is small enough to fit in a small bag.

Roll the die to get a Fact or Fiction card. Answer a card correctly and you win that card. Be the first person to collect 5 cards and you win the game.

186075.name: Generalship: from the 4th century B.C. to the 19th century
186075.description:
Generalship is a compact strategy game and the players can experience the history of Europe.

You will compete using 49 highly famed generals in Europe from the 4th century B.C. to the 19th century. You choose a nation to rule: Austria, Byzantium, England, or France, and then appoint a general from the 49 ones available as your commander. Using this, you will run your nation internally by accumulating political power, increasing production and population, and developing technologies. You will handle your external politics by raising armies and managing alliance relationships.
 
While shaping history with other players, based on your efficient use of actions, the abilities of your commander, and a little bit of luck, you will be able to win by earning more victory points than your competitors. Specifically, players can earn victory points by winning battles or developing new technologies.

186076.description:
The Others can be played by 2 to 5 players. One player must pick the role of the Sins Player, while the rest are Hero Players. The Hero Players all cooperate with each other, with the Sins Player playing against them all.

The Apocalypse expansion offers players a whole new play mode, only for the very brave (or very crazy), including the huge and frighteningly detailed figures of War, Pestilence, Famine, Death, and Apocalypse itself.

This expansion introduces a brand new Apocalypse Track to the game. On this track, instead of drawing new Apocalypse cards as the track advances, new Avatars of the Apocalypse are brought onto the board, eventually culminating with the appearance of Apocalypse itself.
186076.name: The Others: 7 Sins – Apocalypse Expansion

186077.name: They Served Brandolyn Red
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186077.description:
From the publisher:

A Level 0 Adventure

The village of Portnelle is once again bright and festive. After years of feuding, the town’s most prominent and influential families will finally be making peace as the youngest generations are joined in marriage. However, when an evil born of dark secrets refuses to stay buried, blood will flow like wine at the reception.

This wedding is one your fellow villagers will talk about for generations!

186078.description:
The Gamma Team expansion consists of 5 heroes, including a Leader, a Bruiser, a Sniper, and two Fixers.

Gamma Team brings 12 more Upgrade cards to shuffle into your inventory deck, adding more variety and different strategies for the heroes. There are 6 different cards, with 2 copies each, featuring things like Inner Peace training which can be sacrificed to reset your Corruption, and a Bionic Arm that grants +1 dice to both Fight and Skill rolls.

This expansion also gives heroes 3 extra Hero Dice for their powered-up rolls.
186078.name: The Others: 7 Sins – Gamma Team Expansion

186079.description:
The Delta Team expansion consists of 5 heroes, including a Leader, a Bruiser, a Sniper, and two Fixers.

Delta Team brings another 12 Upgrade cards to add into your inventory deck, giving your heroes new options to face the Others. There are 6 different cards, with 2 copies each, featuring equipment such as Wengsi Wong's amazing Laz Blades which crave for the bigger baddies, IR Goggles that are perfect to make sure your Ranged attacks hit their target, and some disposable Liquid Courage that can heal all your wounds.

This expansion also gives players 3 extra Hero Dice.

The Delta Team expansion includes 5 brand new tiles set in the Old Town part of Haven, adding even more variety to the map setups you can use in your games. The box will come with a leaflet featuring maps for all 7 core box stories using these new tiles.
186079.name: The Others: 7 Sins – Delta Team Expansion

186080.name: The Angelic Imp (System Neutral Edition)
186080.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are delighted to offer Tangible Taverns: The Angelic Imp in a system neutral format. This classy and romantic tavern is the perfect setting to seduce the Duke’s heir, find evidence to blackmail an unfaithful local notable or just enjoy some fine dining.

This book includes detailed information on the tavern and food, rumour and event tables, and a handful of notable NPCs.

Please note: this is a smaller tavern than our previous editions, with fewer NPCs and less events. The full version of the Angelic Imp will be featured in the upcoming Tangible Taverns: A Trio of Taverns, and our other taverns have significantly more content.

186081.name: The Bull & The Bear (System Neutral Edition)
186081.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are proud to now offer the the first instalment of our Tangible Tavern line, The Bull & The Bear, in a system neutral format. It details a comfortable tavern complete with a discrete brothel. With rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and a description of frequent faces about the establishment, including Vita the peg-legged former pirate bartender and the barroom guards, Durgal and Evie, you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

186082.name: The Bull & The Bear (Pathfinder Edition)
186082.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first instalment of our Tangible Tavern line is The Bull & The Bear, which details a comfortable tavern complete with a discrete brothel. With rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and a description of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for tavern employees and patrons), you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

NEW: By popular demand we have also added enhanced versions of the barroom bouncers, giving the GM a few extra options should some capable adventurers be looking to stir up trouble.

186083.name: Tuffy's Good Time Palace (Pathfinder Edition)
186083.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second instalment in the Tangible Tavern line is Tuffy's Good Time Palace, which details a dilapidated tavern filled with the city's least desirables. The drinks are terrible, the food is limited to the pickled variety, and not a soul would bat an eye at stealing your coin purse.

This book includes detailed information on a local gang and its leader, the town healer (who could be more than he seems), and of course the memorable tavern employees (including Tuffy herself); rumour and event tables, and a tavern map, meaning you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

186084.name: Tuffy's Good Time Palace (System Neutral Edition)
186084.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are proud to now offer the second instalment of our Tangible Taverns line, Tuffy's Good Time Palace, in a system neutral format. It details a dilapidated tavern filled with the city's least desirables. The drinks are terrible, the food is limited to the pickled variety, and not a soul would bat an eye at stealing your coin purse.

This book includes detailed information on a local gang and its leader, the town healer (who could be more than he seems), and of course the memorable tavern employees (including Tuffy herself); rumour and event tables, and a tavern map, meaning you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

186085.description:
The Sons of Ragnarok are a notorious outlaw biker gang, that could very nearly have become Acolytes of Sin themselves. However, their total rejection for following orders made any approach to try and conscript them to aid the sins result in a very dead servant of sin. This biker gang is obsessed with Viking mythology, with members assuming nicknames in reference to the Norse Gods. The realization that the Apocalypse (or Ragnarok, as they prefer to call it) was upon them stirred the gang into a battle frenzy! However, their contempt for authority also means they would never agree to join FAITH. Though that doesn't stop them from carrying on the fight against the Others on their own terms!

The Sons of Ragnarok Expansion box contains a full team of 7 heroes, including a Leader, 2 Fixers, 2 Snipers, and 2 Bruisers. These rebels tend to operate outside of FAITH, but they can be mixed and matched with any FAITH team as your group may choose. This team follows the same rules as any FAITH group, though they were designed with special synergy among themselves.
186085.name: The Others: 7 Sins – Sons of Ragnarok Expansion

186086.description: The Men of FAITH box gives you 5 new Heroes to use in your FAITH team, including their miniatures and Hero dashboards. This set contains a Leader, a Fixer, a Sniper, and two Bruisers!
186086.name: The Others: 7 Sins – Men of FAITH

186087.name: Beasts of Prey
186087.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development.




User Summary

Beasts of Prey has you hunt Dinosaurs, craft items, and build massive structures. The world is full of dinosaurs, cannibals and other dangers.

186088.name: Rising World
186088.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Rising World is a sandbox game with a procedurally generated world.

186089.name: Sapotagem
186089.description: Sapotagem is a card game using trick-taking with set collection. In each trick, players have two options: play a card or pass. The winner of that trick is the player who played the highest card of color to be followed or the Trump color, if it has been played.
