Mottenmakis machen ganze Stadtviertel unsicher, Dünenschwimmer gefährden Karawanen in der Wüste, Irrwische locken Unvorsichtige in den sicheren Tod, Daevas schmieden furchtbare Ränke, Phönixe werden verehrt und Orks töten und zerstören aus purer Blutlust.

Dieser Band für Splittermond enthält weit über 100 Monster und andere Wesenheiten, die meisten davon mit ausführlicher Beschreibung, Wertekasten, Verbreitungskarte und Farbillustration. Neben echten Ungeheuern trifft man dabei auch auf intelligente Völker und einzelne, legendäre Wesen. Aber auch der natürlichen Fauna von Lorakis ist ein eigenes Kapitel gewidmet, in dem exemplarische Wild- und Nutztiere aller Klima- und Landschaftszonen beschrieben sind. Und ob man diese Kreaturen nun bekämpft, sie zur atmosphärischen Untermalung einbaut oder aber eine ganze Geschichte um sie spinnt – sie werden so manches Erlebnis in der Welt von Splittermond noch bunter und spannender gestalten.

Das ausführliche Bestiarium wird ergänzt durch die Einführung neuer Monstermerkmale sowie eines Aufsatzsystems zur unkomplizierten Verstärkung oder Abschwächung von Monsterwerten. Die lorakischen Besonderheiten von Vampiren und Werbestien, und wie sie mit derlei Flüchen und Krankheiten am Spieltisch umgehen, werden ebenfalls in einem eigenen Kapitel behandelt. Eine ausführliche Zusammenstellung von praktischen Tabellen im anhang erleichtert die Übersicht und ermöglicht das schnelle Auffinden passender Kreaturen, sei es nach Region, Monstergrad oder anderen gängigen Suchkriterien.

Mit Bestien & Ungeheuer finden Sie jederzeit die passenden Monster und Kreaturen, um spannende Abenteuer in Lorakis zu erleben.

186204.name: On My Own
186204.description:
On My Own is a 2D, randomly generated woodland survival adventure game with a calming, throwback style. Survive by hunting and foraging, using your energy wisely, and crafting items like tools and traps. Meditate on the essentials of life along the way.

Source: The Game Website.

186205.description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game with a vampire theme and the option to visit Dracula's castle. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes (detailed in coffins instead of rail spaces)and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop). You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for the latter. Engines are wild cards but only for the central red and black routes.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
186205.name: Transylvania (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

186208.description:
In Project Mars you work as a space industry contractor racing to be the first company with the technology and engineering levels to send humans to Mars.

It's not going to be easy as there are a number of challenges to overcome in order to accomplish a manned trip to the red planet, for one, it's only feasible to make an attempt every 2 years (actually closer to 26 months) for the most optimal alignment of Earth and Mars.

Next there is the challenge of getting all the necessary items you'll need for the trip free of Earth's atmosphere. This can't be done in one shot - so multiple missions will be necessary, taking fuel and modules up to low Earth orbit (LEO) on separate trips where they can then be assembled into a spacecraft that has everything needed to do the job.

And let's not forget money – it costs a lot to make all this happen!

Place your modules in low Earth orbit by increasing your engineering level, while managing your resources, expanding your office space, working with the best vendors and hiring the most capable employees for the job.

Objective
Be the first player to place 2 fuel depots and 3 modules in low Earth orbit and have the engineering level necessary to acquire the Launch Date card.
186208.name: Project Mars

186210.name: Los Rollos
186210.description:
Tick ​​Tack - the clock is ticking - Let it roll! Quickly Choose the right track in this ball tower before time runs out! Roll your ball into the right goal - or goes it in the tray of your opponent? If the ball lands with you - well done - then go to the points you!

In this game you drop a ball in a ball tower. As the ball drops you only have six seconds to get it in the right tray. So you will need to find the quickest way down. Shift tracks and get the best way for your ball to roll.

186211.name: Camel Up
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee
186211.description:
Witness the craziest camel race of all time, as things really go topsy-turvy when camels stack up and entire pyramids turn upside down. As members of Egyptian high society, you gather in the desert with one simple goal: to gain the most money by backing the right camel to win a leg or even the entire race. However, in this race, it’s not just the lucky ones who can beat the odds. Reading the dynamics of the race and having a good sense of timing is just as important when it comes to backing the right camels and taking the victory.

CAMEL UP is a simple, quick, and outrageously exciting family game that can be enjoyed by up to 8 players.

Source: The Developer Website.

186212.name: Win/Lose Revolution
186212.description:
Win/Lose Revolution is a very light social deduction game for 3 players. Each player is dealt one of the three role cards and secretly looks at the card. The player with the Controller card turns the card face up and then must pick one other player to go on a mission. The players with the Rebel and Informant cards will try to convince the Controller to pick them (without showing their card).

If the Controller picks the Rebel, both those players win. If the Controller picks the Informant, the Informant player wins.

The game can be expanded to 4-5 players with a second set.

186214.name: Disneyland Pin Trading Board Game
186214.description:
The Disneyland (60th anniversary commemorative) Pin Trading Board Game is a simple spin-and-move game (some spaces have variable effects as listed on the back of the box) along the Pixie Dust Path celebrating the attractions, films and magic of the Disneyland Resort. First player to the spinner in the center of the board wins.

The game includes 3 hinged standee token pins (Mickey Mouse, Aurora and the Genie) and a jumbo spinner pin. More player tokens (pins) and "completer pins" can be added with the separately-sold additional 3-pin token set (Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, and Mr. Toad) and the 4 completer pins representing board locations / park attractions (Grizzly River Run, It's a Small World, Sleeping Beauty Castle, Space Mountain).

186215.description: If you have registered for a Big Game or would like to participate in the next Big Game, in addition to the resources you receive as a result of the production roll you also receive the same resources your opponent obtained.
186215.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte 2015 – Teilnahme am Big Game
boardgamefamily: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan

186217.description:
Promo given out at Spiel Essen '15.

Replaces the original Sibylle of Cleves, improving her action series as well as her ability: "Alliance: The groom's family must pay you 1 gold. - Intrigue: Pay 1 prestige point. Gain 2 gold."

The backside of the card is a different shade of brown than the original card.
186217.name: Among Nobles: Alternate Sibylle of Cleves

186218.description:
Create your own cards for BANG!
You can use this deck of blank cards for the best-selling BANG! to personalize your game with your own characters and events!

Each packet includes 10 blank character cards and 10 blank event cards.
186218.name: BANG!: Blank Cards

186219.description:
Create your own cards for Samurai Sword!
You can use this deck of blank cards for Samurai Sword to personalize your game with your own characters and events!

Each packet includes 10 blank character cards and 10 blank event cards.
186219.name: Samurai Sword: Blank Cards

186220.name: Kittywitch Woods - Day
186220.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A wood of dead and gnarled trees, with a path winding through. Shrouded in mist, travellers will encounter a ruined chapel and graveyard, stone circle, barrow burial mounds, a sinister lake, a circle of mushrooms and more. A very creepy wood!

Download includes:
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)
Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

186221.name: Kittywitch Woods - Night
186221.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A moonlit night time forest of dead and gnarled trees, with a path winding through. Shrouded in mist, travellers will encounter a ruined chapel and graveyard, stone circle, barrow burial mounds, a sinister lake, a circle of mushrooms and more. A very creepy wood!

Download includes:
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)
Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

186222.name: The Vampire Nest
186222.description:
From publisher blurb:

"They said we'd be safe.. They said an offering would be enough... They said they wouldn't be hungry..."
The Vampire Nest is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Vampire Nest is a day & night set, comprising 2 battlemaps. The map consists of a two caves reached by a narrow mountain path. The first cave is a dead-end, but features a sinister bloodstained altar. The second cave, reached only by braving a narrow ledge, consists of two areas. The first area is strewn with bones and dried blood, hinting at the danger of the cave. The inner cave is the nest of six vampires, their stone coffins lying untouched.

The Vampire Nest is ideal for countless adventures. If you're planning a Halloween or Horror story, with Vamprires, murder and horror, the map is ideal. Perhaps a group of villagers have braved the climb into the hills to put an end to the Vampire menance once and for all, or perhaps a group of acolytes have gathered to offer a blood sacrifice to the undying of the cave.

The pack includes an A4 pdf document with 300dpi gridded versions of each map. Also included is a set of gridded and gridless 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

186223.name: The "Test"
186223.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 4th Edition HackMaster adventure for a party of new 1st level PCs is designed as a convention tournament or as a tactics training session for a new group.

The adventure is set in a specific game world locale, but it generic enough that a quick edit to two sentences can place it almost anywhere the GM desires.

186224.name: Heroes of Hackston I
186224.description:
From publisher blurb:

This HackMaster adventure for a party of 1st level PCs introduces the players to the small hamlet of Hackston. Founded over 30 years ago by the Ranger Hansen, Hackston has been goblin-free long enough that the recent rumors of goblin activity is easily dismissed as children's ghost stories. There still is an active bounty on goblin ears and in this adventure the PCs get an opportunity to investigate some of the goblin rumors.

Heroes of Hackston I is the first of three adventures set in the town of Hackston that give the PCs an opportunity to use the town as a rural base of operations up until the final adventure which is set for 3rd to 5th level PCs. Hackston has all the services a new group requires: a general store, an inn, a country “doctor”, a blacksmith, and a small church. Basic maps are provided for a GM to adapt and use as desired.

186225.name: Heroes of Hackston II
186225.description:
From publisher blurb:

This HackMaster adventure for a party of 2st level PCs returns the players to the small hamlet of Hackston. Founded over 30 years ago by the Ranger Hansen, Hackston has been goblin-free long enough that the recent rumors of goblin activity is easily dismissed as children's ghost stories. There still is an active bounty on goblin ears and in this adventure the PCs get an opportunity to investigate some of the goblin rumors.

Heroes of Hackston II is the second of three adventures set in the town of Hackston that give the PCs an opportunity to use the town as a rural base of operations up until the final adventure which is set for 3rd to 5th level PCs. Hackston has all the services a new group requires: a general store, an inn, a country “doctor”, a blacksmith, and a small church. Basic maps are provided for a GM to adapt and use as desired.

186226.name: Heroes of Hackston III
186226.description:
From publisher blurb:

This HackMaster adventure for a party of 3rd to 4th level PCs returns the players to the small hamlet of Hackston. Founded over 30 years ago by the Ranger Elornil Hansen, Hackston has been goblin-free long enough that the recent rumors of goblin activity is easily dismissed as children's ghost stories. There still is an active bounty on goblin ears and in this adventure the PCs get an opportunity to investigate some of the goblin rumors.

Heroes of Hackston III is the final adventure set in the town of Hackston, a location that gave the PCs an opportunity to use the town as a rural base of operations up during the previous two adventures. Hackston has all the services a new group requires: a general store, an inn, a country “doctor”, a blacksmith, and a small church. Basic encounter maps are provided for a GM to adapt and use as desired.

The GM is encouraged to flesh out the NPCs and to use the location as desired for either a base of operations or a locale the party passes through regularily.

186227.name: Danger in Drakesville
186227.description:
From publisher blurb:

This introductory adventure for HackMaster Basic is designed as a brief introduction to the game system. It was intended to be coupled with an initial character creation session allowing for approximately four hours of play, depending on the size and experience level of the group. This mini adventure is rather free-form, allowing both the GM and players some latitude as play progresses.

186228.name: "Were" Have the Good Brothers Gone?
186228.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter "mission" that is systemless and scalable for about any level of PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

The idea behind this Tweak & Toss is that a small order of monks has come into possession of a certain book for study, and two of its order have gone missing after taking the book with them to read while tending to the order's flock of sheep. Were the Brothers attacked, or did something else happen? A list of suggested tweaks is available based on the percieved strength of your party.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. Just select "booklet printing" and make sure that you have duplex set up on the short edge.

This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encountes, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to some additional resources, one of which is the Patreon site where you can download better versions of the maps if you so desire.

186229.name: The Ecology of the Deep Dark Cave Worm
186229.description:
From publisher blurb:

This bonus bit of content is a description of a new "monster" that was the initial inspiration for the Tweak & Toss "mission" The Wizard of the White Hills.

This creature, while technically a monster, isn't intended to be a serious challenge to any party, but instead just a bit of background on an obscure creature that links two vastly different campaign areas. This information might be useful in the above Tweak & Toss, or you might find some value if your party is underground and trying to get out.

186230.name: The Wizard of the White Hills
186230.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter "mission" that is systemless and scalable for about any level of PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

The idea behind this Tweak & Toss is that the party really needs the answer to a difficult question. Their best bet is to seek out a Sage who might be able to research the topic and get them the vital information they need. Fortunately the Wizard of the White Hills is available! All the party needs to do is make their way deep into the mountains, navigate some rapids, locate the White Hills, and find the Wizard. Should be easy...right?

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. Just select "booklet printing" and make sure that you have duplex set up on the short edge.

This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encountes, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to some additional resources, one of which is the Patreon site where you can download better versions of the maps if you so desire.

186231.name: The Massive Mushroom Missive
186231.description:
From publisher blurb:

The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. Just select "booklet printing" and make sure that you have duplex set up on the short edge.

This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encountes, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to some additional resources, one of which is the Patreon site where you can download better versions of the maps if you so desire.

186232.name: The Noerglein
186232.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a small handout highlighting a new PC/NPC race of the Noerglein, or half-hobgoblin/ogre. Statted specificaly for Swords & Wizardry, The Noerglein is suitable for most any OSR game.

186233.name: The Situation in Salzberg
186233.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and scalable for about any level of PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. Just select "booklet printing" and make sure that you have duplex set up on the short edge.

186234.name: The Mad Mosquito Bats Of Clarkesburg Caverns
186234.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and scalable for about any level of PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encountes, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to some additional resources, one of which is the Patreon site where you can download better versions of the maps if you so desire.

186235.name: Dreki Draugr of Strandagaldur
186235.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and intended for 3rd(ish) level PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of five pages of content (2 maps, encounter, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to some additional resources, two of which are the Patreon sites where you can download better versions of the maps if you so desire.

186236.description:
A solo campaign for the 2014 game "Orléans" - you have to travel to Tours and deliver three tiles of every good.

A Dutch version of this expansion is contained in Orléans (Dutch first edition).
186236.name: Orléans: Die Reise nach Tours

186237.name: Gone to Ground
186237.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and intended for mid-level PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encounter, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to the Frugal GM blog where you can download a hi-res version of the map in you so desire.

This particular tweak & toss is little more than a setup, a map, and some highlights. The expressed scale of the map is HUGE and you might want to change it, ormaybe not. If the party does decide to follow the adventure hook it'll be up to you to decide how the adventure proceedes as there isn't even a clue inserted on which way to go. This is deliberate and a possible way to get your players into a much longer underground campaign.

186238.name: Lookout at Logger's Lake
186238.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and intended for 3rd(ish) level PCs in any OSR-style game. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encounter, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to the Frugal GM blog where you can download a hi-res version of the map in you so desire.

186239.name: The Valley of the Seven Sisters
186239.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set that is systemless and intended for any OSR-style game. Unlike previous encounter sets, this one is not designed with a specific level limit in mind and is a follow-on to an earlier Adventure Seed (The Lost Treasure of the Valley of the Seven Sisters). The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encounter, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to the Frugal GM blog where you can download a hi-res version of the map in you so desire.

186240.name: The Lost Treasures of the Seven Sisters
186240.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an Adventure Tie-In (ie. "hook") for an upcoming pair of short "Tweak & Toss" Encounter Sets. The hook can be set for your own adventure, in conjunction with one or both of the Encounter Sets, or all on its own. An enterprising GM can tweak this hook to form a mini-adventure all on its own!

The Tweak & Toss Encounter Set is a map paired with systemless (OSR) suggested encounter areas. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style. This PDF download consists of three pages of content (map, encounter, and basic set-up). There are a couple of hotlinks within the file taking you to the Frugal GM blog where you can download a hi-res version of the map if you so desire.

186241.name: Trouble at Karst Cavern
186241.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short encounter set intended for a HackMaster (current edition) GM running for 3rd(ish) level PCs. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to "tweak & toss" into your current campaign, even if you don't play HackMaster!

It is intended to print this file two-sided and fold in half, zine-style.

186242.name: 101 Shadow and Darkness Spells
186242.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ll never see it coming,
So fear your own shadow.

101 Shadow and Darkness Spells gives spellcasters new options to utilize the cover of darkness and the concealment of shadows to cast spells in new and exciting ways. Whether you're playing an illusionist tapping the Shadow Plane, a diviner seeking to scry on others through their shadows, or an enchanter willing to curse others to walk forever under the cover of darkness, opportunities abound to take advantage of darkness and shadows as never before.

Sometimes light and darkness combine and play tricks on the eyes. Even under entirely mundane circumstances, shadows sometimes seem to move on their own, seem to come to life. Sometimes that's because, whether illusory, demonic or undead, that shadow really does have power and you really are wise to fear it. What happens when illusionists, conjurers and necromancers learn to control these energies and forces?

186243.name: Bezzerwizzer Kompakt
186243.description:
Not to be confused with bezzerwizzer kompakt. This version contains no board.

BEZZERWIZZER Kompakt is a new way to play BEZZERWIZZER that makes it easier to play on the go, at the beach or anywhere else for that sake.

The game contains 150 cards with questions in the same 20 categories as the original game, which means that they can be used as new challenges in the original game as well.

To start with the players are divided into two to six teams. Each team can consist of one or more players. Each team then gets a bezzerwizzer token that can be used once per round (see below).

Now the game starts: Each team picks a token at random out of the included bag. There are 20 tokens - one for each category in the game. The token must be kept secret for the other players. The first team to go then choose either to answer a question in the category on their token or to swap with one of the other teams without knowing what they will get. If they answer the question that they end up with correctly, they will receive 3 points - a wrong answer does nothing. Scoring is kept on the included pad. This continues till all teams have answered a question. The last team will not have the possibility to swap as all other teams have used up their categories.

Each turn each of the teams have one opportunity to bezzerwizze one of the other teams question. This means that if the team does not answer the question correctly the team that has bezzerwizzet has a chance to answer as well. If the first team does answer correctly however the others team will have wasted their chance to bezzerwizze. The number of points you get for bezzerwizzing and answering correct is dependent on at what time you choose to do it. If you choose to bezzerwizze after the category is revealed but before the question is read aloud you will get 2 points for a correct answer. If you do it after the question has been read aloud you will only get 1 point. If the teams that bezzerwizzet can not answer correctly either the original team will receive the points.

The turn order then switches one place and the process starts again. If there are fewer category tokens in the bag than the number of teams when a new turn is started all of the tokens are returned to the bag.

The game ends when one of the teams have 20 points (the round is finished to allow other teams to reach 20 as well). Alternately you can choose to only play until the bag is empty.

186244.name: Five Barbarian Weapons
186244.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game; well Avalon Games is here to help. Each issue of the Avalon's Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.

186245.name: Monster Hunters: Dark Paris
186245.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game; well Avalon Games is here to help. Each issue of the Avalon's Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.

186246.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume III
186246.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the society’s judge, an inquisitor archetype that focuses on clandestine investigation and mob fighting tactics, the mind criminal, a mesmerist archetype that implants rebellious thoughts in those around him and creates dangerous sleeper agents, the political assassin, a slayer archetype who makes political statements with her high-profile kills, the conjurer of riots, a summoner archetype that conjures aggressive—and often explosive—creatures, and the subversion specialist, a wizard archetype that specializes in casting spells unnoticed.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

186247.name: Universal Adventures Expansion Pack Greyshroud Ridge
186247.description:
From publisher blurb:

The rocky trail wound between the jagged boulders and the steep, brush-covered slopes to either side. Kor slowed his pace, watching the shadows ahead. Kiev, the young thief, walked along the right hand side, intent on poking through the brush for any interesting odds and ends, when he suddenly vanished in a shower of gravel and shale.

Welcome to Universal Adventures Greyshroud Ridge!

Universal Adventures Expansion Pack Greyshroud Ridge brings you 9 Event cards and 9 Search cards for the Greyshroud Ridge region first introduced in Expedition to Erathor. Face Ogre Bandits, Ambushes and the restless dead of the dreaded Forgotten Graveyard. And if you take the time to look around you’ll never know what you may find, or what may find you...

Although you may find some use for it as an independent product, Greyshroud Ridge was meant to be used along with the Greyshroud Ridge cards included with the Expedition to Erathor Adventure Module.

Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, this expansion pack is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

186248.name: Blindsided!
186248.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heroes help a fellow Neo Champion and discover a tale of love and betrayal. For use with the Dawn of Legends setting.


Neo Crime Bureau Liaison

As reports of another mysterious death, the victim’s chest seemingly melting away and leaving only a cauterized hole, breaks on the afternoon news, the Heroes receive a call from Special Agent Gerard Beaumont, their contact and liaison at the Neo Crime Bureau. Gerard is also the liaison for a Neo Champion known publicly as the Blue Knight and is in need of the Heroes’ help.

Someone close to the Blue Knight has gone missing, and from what he’s learned so far all of the gathered Forensic Evidence is pointing toward the Champion as the culprit. There hasn’t been enough for an arrest . . . yet . . . but Special Agent Beaumont isn’t convinced the Blue Knight is actually behind it. As the Champions’ liaison, he can’t be allowed to take part in the investigation, and he isn’t privy to the specifics of the evidence or details. He asks that the Heroes meet with Blue Knight at Colonial Park in Mayfield Square, and try to get to the bottom of the case.

186249.name: Master of Orion - Conquer the Stars
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Joystick Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
186249.description:
A LEGEND REBORN
THE CRITICALLY ACCLAIMED SCI-FI STRATEGY GAME IS REBORN.

OVER A DECADE HAS PASSED. ORION AWAITS%21

This stellar game is being developed in Argentina by NGD Studios. Key members of the original Master of Orion team have returned, including the game's original composer to provide an epic orchestral score.

THE ROOTS REMAIN THE SAME.

Built from the ground up and reimagined with enhanced visuals and mechanics, prepare to experience a vast and dangerous universe inhabited by diverse races—all with unique traits and ambitions—who will stand by your side or fall in your wake.

The title%27s iconic 4X gameplay of Explore, Expand, Exploit and Exterminate is set to challenge both new and long-time players. You%27ll balance brute force, diplomacy, resource domination, and much more to carve a path across the galaxy.

186250.name: Calling S.O.S.
186250.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heroes respond to a crisis at Quantum Mechanics and discover a threat far more powerful than they anticipated. For use with the Dawn of Legends setting.


Trouble at Quantum Mechanics

The Heroes are either out on patrol and stumble upon- or receive a call from their NCB liaison, Special Agent Gerard Beaumont, concerning- an intense crisis at Quantum Mechanics in the Hydesville district.

Quantum Mechanics is massive corporate campus. Occupying over 27 acres, it’s composed over a half-dozen buildings, walkways, and private parks. A large fence, 35 feet high, runs the perimeter, with armed security personnel at the gates and situated within guard towers.

As the Heroes arrive, total chaos as erupted. The grounds are torn asunder, as though an earthquake hit a majority of the campus. The high-rise corporate windows are mostly shattered, and a strange force field surrounds the campus as Quantum Mechanics’ emergency defenses initiated.

Over a dozen AAPD and NCB Troop Carriers are positioned outside the perimeter of the force field, and overhead several news helicopters are broadcasting live. Approximately a dozen NCB Ballista and Nullification Agents are standing ready.

Regardless of why the Heroes arrive on the scene, Special Agent Beaumont has been assigned the case and immediately approaches.

186251.name: Dawn of Legends Character Folio
186251.description:
User summary:

A character dossier for use with the Dawn of Legends setting.

186252.name: Dawn of Legends: NCB Files
186252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the NCB Files, a free addition for the popular Dawn of Legends setting for the Savage Worlds RPG!

Throughout the Dawn of Legends book, numerous characters and groups were mentioned but did not actually appear in the character sections. This was due to space constraints: the new powers system already took-up so much space, that to include every character would have made the book so large that the price tag to print it would have caused the MSRP to be upwards of $50 or more. Not something we wanted for the book. So, the decision was made to cut the characters and groups, and release them shortly afterwards as a free download.

So, we’re happy to give you 12 new Champions and 19 new Rogues to populate your Dawn of Legends campaign!

From the mystical trouble-shooting firm of Germaine Investigations, Inc. to the mysterious Liberty Corps., from the dangerous Lady’ D’yre to the primal entity known as Nebecar, you’ll find a variety of characters and stories to challenge any Neo Super-Team.

Strap on your cape, slip into those tights, take to the streets . . . and build your Legend!

186253.name: Dawn of Legends: Rules Expansion 1
186253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over the decades, comic books have been an ever evolving tapestry through which to tell stories. Internal rules have changed between titles, and entirely separate genres even within the field of super-heroes have developed. Dawn of Legends, being a comic book rules add-on and setting for Savage Worlds, is no different. It’s ever expanding and developing, both from those of us in-house, and those players and GMs that are kind enough to send us feedback.

Dawn of Legends: Rules Expansion One is not errata for Dawn of Legends (the Downloads section at the Daring website contains that), but is a set of new rules to expand upon and further develop campaigns into true comic book stories.

Inside you’ll find a variety of new Edges, new Hindrances, new Super-Team Hindrances, and new Super-Team Edges. You’ll also find basic guidelines for adjusting Power Limits and Power Points to better capture the feel of various comic book genres- ranging from the Street Level campaign to the default Super-Heroic campaign of Dawn of Legends.

Dawn of Legends: Rules Expansion One is not all exhaustive, and future Rules Expansions will be released as Dawn of Legends continues to expand its options for comic book role-playing.

186254.name: Into The Remnant
186254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fast, Furious Fun… in the Far Future

“A great little sci-fi dungeon crawl. A water-logged thriller in an ancient alien research station, where potential riches are outweighed only by an eons-old terror! Lot’s of fun"

Those who stayed behind in the Altitude bar turn towards Remnant-0C7 when the FTL core of the Daliance ruptures as begins landing on the surface... just after an unexplained EMP blast scrambled the sensors of every starship in orbit. The core rupture bathes Euphoria in an intense white light... and then the Remnant begins to move... a new shift in the Remnant’s already unstable Verdan plate. The planetoid’s tectonic slices, interlocked like the pieces of an intricate spherical puzzle, tilt and slide past each other in new, unexpected directions, some receding into the Remnant’s soil, others breaking through the regolith towards the surface. This could be precisely the event that the scavenger crews, artifact hunters, jump-miners, scientists and U.R.C. officers have been waiting for.

There is a rush towards the hangars as soon as the alarm sounds. Any ships not already en-route to the Remnant are on their way now! The station intercom announces the biggest tectonic shift on record, pushing what appears to be a large, long-buried land mass to the surface. The announcement indicates a likely exposure of between four to six hours; enough for a skilled crew to make a quick sweep for artifacts and a safe getaway.

Features everything needed to play!

Detailed adventure set in an Alient Confederacy Complex
The secrets of the anchients!
War Master and Player Schematics
Printable battlemaps
"Deep Blue" Card Stock Figures - put your heroes into the depths

186257.name: Armadillo Droppings (Issue 30 - Summer/Fall 1994)
186257.description: Our First Ever No Theme Issue!

186258.name: Armadillo Droppings (Issue 31 - Winter/Spring 1995)
186258.description: Good to the Last Droppings -- Final Issue!

186259.name: Basis Rules
186259.description:
User summary:

Basis Rules is presented as HTML in eight major HTML divisions, including: Introduction, Characters, Skill System, Combat, Other Rules, Equipment, Skill Descriptions, and Race Descriptions. An index was planned but not completed.

The system is a generic, universal rules system. The company intended to produce full genre support for: Fantastic Horizons, Modern Horizons, Galactic Horizons, Cyberhorizons, and the campaign world of Kyrdalm. However, only portions of the fantasy genre were completed.

Character creation supports either point pool allocation or randomization (of a sort). Character creation starts with Race, character history, and Initial Attributes. Characters also have standard demographics. The "alignment" system common in gaming is replaced by a system of Commitment Ratings to describe the character's basic outlook and strength of commitment to that outlook. Finally, the bulk of character ability is determined by selection of Skills.

186260.name: A History of Chydar and Estin
186260.description:
From the introduction:

The continents of Chydar and Estin have a long and fascinating history. Rather than rewrite this history yet again, we will rather present selected essays which we feel are of patricular importance.

The first such essay was recorded long ago, by the renowned sage Erquineoller. Our comments follow after the text, which has been left unchanged.

User summary:

A History of Chydar and Estin presents a fairly concise overview of two major continents that establish a fantasy setting for the Infinite Horizons game system. The histories are written in a fictional style that provides narrative and background but no "hard stats" for gaming. The material is presented as a single HTML page.

186261.name: Fundamentals of Magic
186261.description:
From the introduction:

The magic system of Fantastic Horizons is extremely flexible. There is no set list of spells which can be cast; rather, the imagination of the caster is the only limit. Naturally there are some guidelines for casting spells, but these should be taken as a basis for development rather than as an absolute limit.

User summary:

Magic is accessed through a character's Spellcraft Skill. Magic is divided into Disciplines. Spells have a point cost that is calculated by looking at the desired Range, Volume, and Damage. These rules presuppose that spells will be used offensively and there is almost no support for non-damaging spells.

186263.name: Inju
186263.description:
Inju - The Storyteller Game

User summary:

This rule set adapts White Wolf's World of Darkness and The Storyteller System to a world populated by Inju, a "demon-beast" from Japanese Mythology. Character creation starts with a character concept, and an Inju type. Attributes are then selected and determined from a pool. Inju have an 'X' in Appearance to signify their horrifying nature. Abilities and Advantages are selected, and then the character is finished with distribution of fifteen "Freebie Points".

186264.name: Cold Steel & Canister
186264.description:
CS&C is a unique design of miniature gaming for land warfare during the Napoleonic Era. Unique, in that unit movement and fire/combat is regulated by the use of a grid square marked playing area. No tape measuring or movement rulers are used. Unit movement and other actions are limited to the cost of a unit’s available Actions Points during each turn phase, as determined during a turn order's sequence of play.

The basic command level is the brigade (consisting of several infantry battalions, cavalry squadrons and/or artillery batteries). At the end of a turn, one or more Brigade Morale roll(s) are made to determine that brigade's willingness to continue the fight (number of rolls is based on the number of units destroyed or currently in "bad order"). The roll(s) determine if that Commander retreats 1 or more squares. The command radius (in squares) is always determined from the respective brigade commander's position or unit objective square (if orders achieved). If a unit starts a turn within "Command Radius," it allows the unit to be issued an order cube, otherwise it must use all of its movement for the turn to try and get back in command. An experienced player can control a division or corps with little difficulty after only playing the game a couple of times.

Players provide their own miniatures and terrain, using any size scale and basing of miniatures (generally 6mm to 28mm range). The general rule figure scale is based upon a 60:1 scale for infantry/Cavalry. The gaming area can be marked by various methods to show grid square designated areas. An optional grided gaming mat can be used as the terrain base.

The initial release of the rules covers the campaign conflict between France and Austria in 1809 (but other nation units from different theaters of operation and time frames fought can easily be adapted for play). There's also a special section for set up of tournament style battles.

186265.name: Minecraft Card Game?
186265.description:
Based on the hit video game, players have the opportunity to mine, craft or reserve to win.

Players "mine" Resource Cards of Wood, Stone, Iron, Diamond, or Gold, and then use those cards to "craft" Craft Cards for points. If you desire a certain Craft Card, but are currently unable to pay for it, you may Reserve the card in your card holder to craft later. Craft Cards can become Tools with special powers you can you can use in your favor to control the game play—but watch out! TNT and Creeper cards are hiding in the deck for unexpected upsets.

The player who reaches the game point goal first, wins.

186266.name: El Secreto de las Pirámides
186266.description:
Es un juego de mesa para dos jugadores, donde las pirámides, momias, faraones y flechas deberán ser colocados de forma estratégica para sacar la diferencia necesaria para ganar los sets.
El objetivo del juego es ganar dos sets.
Cada set se gana obteniendo una diferencia de 7 puntos sobre el rival.
Los puntos se obtienen al conectar las pirámides con las flechas.
También se obtienen al colocar las momias y los faraones sobre las pirámides.
Además, al finalizar el juego, momias y faraones generarán puntos según la influencia que tendrán sobre cada uno de los territorios.

Si tratta di un gioco da tavolo per due giocatori, in cui le piramidi, mummie, faraoni e le frecce devono essere posizionati strategicamente per fare la differenza necessaria in set vincente.
L'obiettivo è quello di vincere due set.
Ogni set si vince, ottenendo una differenza di 7 punti sul rivale.
I punti sono guadagnati durante la connessione piramidi con le frecce.
Essi sono anche ottenuti mettendo le mummie e le piramidi dei faraoni.
Inoltre, dopo la partita, mummie e faraoni accumulare punti secondo l'influenza che avranno su ciascuno dei territori.

It is a board game for two players, where the pyramids, mummies, pharaohs and arrows must be strategically placed to make the necessary difference in sets winning.
The goal is to win two sets.
Each set is won, resulting in a difference of 7 points over his rival.
Points are earned when connecting pyramids with arrows.
They are obtained by placing the mummies and the pyramids of the pharaohs.
In addition, after the game, mummies and pharaohs accumulate points according to the influence they have on each of the territories.

186268.name: The Knight's Journey
186268.description: A race to the finish game with a beautifully lithographed board featuring a land of monsters, wild beasts and fairy tale creatures. Players draw cards to move.

186269.name: 1863 Kampania na Kurpiach
186269.description: 1863 Kampania na Kurpiach ("1863 Kurpie Campain") is a historial board game showing the hardships of brutal insurrection life during the anti- Russian Empire uprising of 1863 in Poland. The goal is to survive and finish as many misions as possible. The players get a random mission and travel the board. Players move according to their movement characteristic. Each movement results in a random adventure card. Additionally Tsarist forces randomly move around the board patroling in larger numbers each turn. Each mission has a turn limit after which the game ends. Players collect victory points for each adventure and succesful mission.

186270.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 90 - Ottobre/Dicembre 2015)
rpgissuearticle: COm'è nato il mondo di Tellus?
Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie, 4 - Il formicaio e le Alpe Spire

186271.name: Felix The Cat's Dandy Candy Game
186271.description:
Players choose one of the Cowboy/Cowgirl character disks that have been punched out of the insert. Game also includes 12 orange slice disks and a punch out spinner with an inner and outer ring.

Players begin on the Starting House and move forward by the number of spaces on the outer ring of the spinner. When a player lands on an orange slice space, they receive an orange slice piece and spin again, this time using the inner ring of the spinner. Players continue until someone reaches the Candy House. The first player in the Candy House gets 2 orange slices. The player who has the most orange slices at this point, wins.

On the other side of the board is a checkerboard, and black and red checkers can be punched out of the insert, as well.

186272.description:
The card throwing game of fantasy siegecraft.

Each player chooses an army which they can choose to customise if they wish, then takes turn throwing cards across the table at each other's castle. If the castle (enemy deck) is hit, it loses cards based on the accuracy of the hit and type of card thrown. Dead Mammoths deal more damage then severed heads. When a player's castle runs out of cards, it is considered to have been razed to the ground and they lose.

You can use sneaky tactics cards to foil your foes plans and fight ground troops using rock, paper, scissors (each unit getting advantages and disadvantages which decide draws.)

It's a fast paced game which lasts around five minutes per bout, but rest assured, as soon as you're done, you'll want another chance to hone your throwing technique and grind your enemy's castle into dust.
186272.name: Cardthrower Castle

boardgamecompilation: One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Bonus Pack 1
186273.description:
This is a promo item for Werwölfe Vollmondnacht (One Night Ultimate Werewolf) containing the Prince character given out for free in Essen 2015.

The Prince is a villager with the handy ability of not being able to be killed.

The Prince also is part of the promo pack 1 for One Night Ultimate Werewolf.
186273.name: Werwölfe Vollmondnacht: Der Prinz

186274.description: Expansion for the dice game Play Me: Alice in Wonderdice, so you can play the original game with up to nine players.
186274.name: Play Me: Alice in Wonderdice – Tea Time

186276.name: Orbital Mines
186276.description:
A starship travelling through the farthest reaches of space has flown into a vast field of orbital mines. Its defense systems are more than capable of destroying the mines, yet the small devices are equipped with an A.I. module - now they are trying to surround and annihilate the starship. Which side shall prevail in this deadly duel?

Players will move tiles (starship for one and mines for the other) on a space map and they will try to compete in order to achieve their result: pass the orbital mines fields without any relevant damage or destroy the starship.

186279.name: Mini Mölkky
186279.description:
A mini table top version of Mölkky made in eco-friendly wood and great for indoors.

The players use a wooden pin (also called "mölkky") to try to knock over wooden pins (also called "skittles") of almost similar dimensions with the throwing pin, which are marked with numbers from 1 to 12. The pins are initially placed in a tight group in an upright position. Knocking over one pin scores the amount of points marked on the pin. Knocking 2 or more pins scores the number of pins knocked over. After each throw, the pins are stood up again in the exact location where they landed. The first one to reach exactly 50 points wins the game. Scoring more than 50 will be penalised by setting the player's score back to 25 points. A player will be eliminated from the game if they miss all of the target pins three times in a row.

186280.name: Collisions
186280.description:
User Summary

Using pinball-like plungers and flippers, as well as various shaped blocks and angling pieces, you try to shoot or place a ball into certain areas or alleys to escape each puzzle. The graphics are black and white, with a steam-punk vibe to it, although a mini-game has a matching colour/shape system against a computer that seems more upbeat.

186281.name: Mako
186281.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I Shall Rule the World beneath the Waves!"

A disgraced Olympic swimmer who was turned into a monster by the fiendish Doctor Jeste, Mako Shark has abandoned the surface world to focus on conquering Atlantis, though he has yet to ever defeat it's rule, King Ravas. Mako Shark deigns to work with the Overlords because their leader, Haupman Klaue, promises that the group's victory will lead to Mako Shark's own aquatic ascension. Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

186282.name: Headsman and Spellbinder
186282.description:
From publisher blurb:

Titan vs. Titan!!

Two more of Hauptman Klaue's Overlords, Olympian sorceress Spellbinder (PL 10) is obsessed with possessing Jupiter's heart. Her companion, Headsman (PL 13), is a constant, fanatical guardian.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need characters everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

186283.name: Uttin Character Class
186283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scavengers of the Stars

Diminutive, rat-like and clad in filthy robes, the Uttin are regarded as the dregs of the universe. Yet, these clever scavengers are clever and resourceful. Traveling the stars in their massive Spaceslinker starships and wielding a plethora of unique weaponry, their unorthodox mastery of galactic technology is an aid to any party of interstellar adventurers - once you get past the smell.

Uttin introduces a new alien class to White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying. In addition to a full five-level class, these pages also provide detailed information on their unique arsenal - including the Uttin Ion Pistol and the chaotic Uttin Star Sword. Couple this will full statistics for their flying junk-pile starships, known as Spaceslinkers, and several unorthodox modifications which can be used on any starship (if you're feeling brave), Uttin brings a fully realized alien species to your White Star campaign.

186284.name: R.I.G.S. Results Volume 1
186284.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is R.I.G.S.?

A while ago I created a generator for myself and my games that output randomized magic items. The idea behind it was to create a system that could output a couple of words or more that would suggest an item name or concept. The challenge then becomes to take this randomly created item concept and make something that can be used in various games and stories.

I called this system the Random Item Generation System (R.I.G.S.), hence the title -R.I.G.S. Results.

Each item has 6 aspects. All but the last aspect, details, has been randomly created using R.I.G.S.. These are not set in stone and if it feels better to change something one way, such as the activation method, then feel free to change it.

System generic, these items are designed with a fantasy or medieval setting in mind, but a few of them could be used as-is in a sci-fi or modern or even horror setting with only a minor amount of tweaking.

The item you'll find in this volume :-

Bandage of Duty - Heal others, but become duty bound to continue
Brand of Autumn - Use it to mark and guide animals or other people
Lager of Regeneration - This lager can make you regenerate if you drink enough
Libram of Shadow - A collection of spells and notes about the nature of Shadows
Medal of Corruption - Give this to your enemies and watch them fall from grace
Necromancy Octahedron - A large item designed by a necromancer to boost her power
Orzsottya Atzonervar's Stout of the Barkeep - Need some liquid inspiration?
Staff of Hearing - Those who weild this staff gain a boost to their hearing
Sun Match - This small yet powerful artifact is a boon to those who stalk the undead
Treachery Quiver - The arrows of your foes are now yours

186285.name: Black Stories: Promostory "Gruseliges Casting"
186285.description:
This is a promotional Black Stories given out for free at the publisher's booth at SPIEL Essen 2015. It will be contained in the upcoming Black Stories Scary Music Edition.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

The promo story can be played on its own, without any actual Black Stories edition.

186286.name: Wretched
186286.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for expert characters

Something dwells in the reeking swamp near the village of Fimmoran. The locals say it’s a witch who has cursed their children with an unnatural disease. The people of Fimmoran want the crone’s head and are willing to pay for it. There is a twist in this black-hearted tale, though—a twist the characters will discover when they venture into the swamp. The adventure ends when the characters determine the true cause of the children’s sickness and deal with the repercussions of that discovery.

186287.name: The Dragon's Hoard: Magic Arms & Armor
186287.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, adventurer, to the Dragon’s Hoard. Within you will find an assortment of magic items lovingly crafted by over two dozen designers, including both budding and established writers. Perhaps not every dragon would have each of these items, but a good dragon should!

This PDF contains 60+ magic weapons, armor, and shields and properties!

This PDF is brought to you by the feat Craft Magic Arms and Armor.

186288.name: Doctor M
186288.description:
From publisher blurb:

A genius on the brink of Madness... Dr. M!

A Power Level 10 Renegade, Dr. M is a scientific genius who stands on the precipice of madness! Manon St. Martin is not afraid to put her mutagenic skills to use when the situation calls for it, and experience has taught her to trust her instincts. Her followers, the Muta-Men, are devoted followers who stand by their benefactor's brilliance. Dr. M is a classic mad scientist archetype in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Dr. M is designated "Blue" for her technological origins. Inspired by classic "meddling" mad doctors like Dr. Moreau, she brings a new twist to the genre by saving lives instead of destroying them(so far!). As a Renegade, she lives outside the law (and well outside the normal shipping lanes), but may encounter your heroes for any number of reasons. She might serve as a potential scientific consultant on strange cases, the source of an unintended biological disaster, or even a strange romantic interest for a scientifically-minded hero! Presented along with several examples of her Muta-Men, she will be a memorable addition to any superhero's supporting cast.Jack Norris

186289.name: Core Prestige Classes (Druid, Fighter, and Monk)
186289.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prestige classes have taken a back seat to archetypes and hybrid classes of late. Presented are three new prestige classes built upon the core classes they represent. These prestige classes offer an accelerated method of gaining a secondary core class without the need to multi-class for several levels to gain the same functionality. The compromise is that each prestige class focuses on a particular class ability or two rather than granting all of the class features normally associated with the class in question. So if you want a sorcerer that can rage or a fighter that likes to pick up the lute to inspire his friends on occasion, check out these new prestige classes.

186290.name: "U" is for "Universe"
186290.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's Your World

U is for Universe expands on the Universe Creation guidelines from the Assembled Edition of Icons, including:

Looking at a setting's overall theme.
Themes as Qualities (and why you might not want that).
Setting scale, from neighborhood to multi-dimensional.
"Sliding" quantitative scale based on setting scale.
Creating signature places for the setting.

186291.name: Hawai'i-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
186291.description: Hawai'i-opoly allows you to collect your favorite Hawaiian properties and increase the rent by adding Waves and trading them in for Islands. We're talking beaches, canyons, and even Loco Moco. It's all fun and games... until someone gives you the Stink Eye and you're out of the game for three turns!

186292.name: In Media Res
186292.description:
User summary:

In Media Res is published as a ZIP archive containing HTML pages and directories. The documents have a complex structure with many hyperlinks and a full index. The organization is somewhat non-linear and difficult to use, though individual items are easy to locate.

The rules provide a variety of play options, including standard dice-based gaming (d10), a variant diceless option, and even a variant live-action option; the same gaming group and characters could switch between these options freely if they desired.

The core of the system involves character Skills, which are defined with several parameters including a Skill Level (1+) and actions have a Commitment Level. While Skills are intended to represent rather mundane capabilities, characters may also have Abilities, Gifts, and Flaws, which work like Skills but are considered separate categories in the game. Combat is run as a Fight Scene but has much more detail than typically found in cinematic style games. The game also includes a robust Karma system that has significant impact on routine play.

186293.description:
Three promo items for Mysterium, containing an additional character, location and object psychic card as well as the equivalent ghost cards.

They are numbered P1 (character), P2 (location) and P3 (object).
186293.name: Mysterium: Promo Cards

186294.name: In the Name of Justice!
186294.description:
User summary:

In the Name of Justice! is a set of rules for costumed hero gaming (superheroes). It was prepared for release at Gen Con 1996 as a "quick start" introduction to a planned full game that was never released. In the Name of Justice! is a playable game in tradeback format, containing rules and a scenario. It is published as a ZIP archive that contains the main rule book, two single page, full-page maps (PDF Format - Bank, Street); a four-page print-cut-use PDF of game tokens and cards, and an HTML "index" file to the other documents.

Characters have primary "Stats" (Attributes) including: Strength, Coordination, Health, and Intellect. Characters also have four derived secondary "Stats": Luck, Speed, Hit Points, and Armor. Primary Stats run from 2-10 for ordinary humans. Luck and Armor start at zero; Speed is usually 3; human Hit Points run from about 20-40. Superheroes may have substantively higher scores in some areas depending upon their build and powers. Super characters are assumed to have Abilities and may also have Disabilities. The game also uses a lengthy array of Skills for most mundane tasks. Combat is a primary topic and assumed to be a routine activity in the game. The combat system includes numerous options, special situations, conditional modifiers, and so forth.

186295.description:
Players take on the role of a thief attempting to obtain priceless treasures and outdo their fellow gentleman and lady burglars. Two to five players take turns picking locks to steal valuable items from the vault or each other. The thief with the most treasures at the end of the game is the winner.

Each treasure obtained puts you closer to winning. However, each treasure has a special negative effect that makes your collection vulnerable. Steal wisely, certain combinations of treasures in your possession could make it easier for other thieves to steal from you.

The main mechanic of Pick the Lock has a small amount of wit and a lot of luck. Players attempt to steal treasures from each other or the vault by using one of their five number cards. These cards are numbered four through eight. When played they define the odds of success during your attempt to steal a treasure. The defending player sets the combination of the lock to his or her vault by placing a card face down that is from 1 to the number the attacking player has played. Using the right cards with the right treasure effects could ensure your victory. Pick the Lock combines a nice blend of strategy, wit, and luck. Are you clever enough to outwit your friends and Pick the Lock?

Pick the Lock is a Card game for 2-5 players ages 6 and up.
186295.name: Pick the Lock
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 75- Isle of Skye and Convention Advice

186297.name: Inzeladun
186297.description:
From the introduction:

Inzeladun is the Dungeons and Dragons world of Vincent N. Darlage, created in 1981. Welcome to a world of gods and demons, of warriors and their women, of villians and sorcerers, of ghosts and vampires, and of warlords and dragons. This is a world that never was, but should have been. This world is painted in brighter colors and on a grander scale than the one in which we live. The heroes of this world may not be the sort of persons we would invite to a polite party, but they're not exactly the type we would soon forget if they showed up anyway.

User summary:
Inzeladun is a campaign world and setting for D20 3rd Edition, supporting Dungeons & Dragons. The product is presented as a series of HTML pages with these notable major divisions: Classes, Disadvantages, Dragons, Feats, Gods, History, Legends, Lore, Magic, Maps, Monsters, Players, Prestige Classes, Races, Realms, Relics and Magic Items, Religions, Skills Spells, Villains, Weapons, and more. The setting has been in development since ca. 1981 and was hosted at several different sites during the 2001-2004 period.

186298.name: Inzeladun Campaign Source Book
186298.description:
User summary:

The Inzeladun Campaign Source Book contains extensive notes on nearly all aspects of the Inzeladun Campaign and setting. Most of the content is updated to D20 but the author notes the materials have been developed since 1981 and some items have remained essentially unchanged since that time. The book is divided into topical chapters and includes information on:


Races
Classes
Prestige Classes
Skills and Feats
Equipment
Spells
Magic Items
Monsters
Kingdoms of Inzeladun (with maps)
Organizations


Additional materials include tips on running a campaign in the Inzeladun setting, recommended reading, notes on campaign design, and so forth.

186299.name: Iron Empire
186299.description:
User summary:

The game is rules-light and would require substantive GM input prior to being a fully workable implementation or setting. Characters have Statistics (Attributes), including: Brawn, Constitution, Deftness, Intellect, Perception, Willpower, Presence, Aesthetics, Courage, and Visage. Statistics have scores randomly generated by D20, with a D10 rolled for bonus points to be distributed by player fiat. Characters have Skills that are based on a particular Statistic (the rules do not specify how individual Skills are gained). Skills are assigned a rating of A+ to E with a system for determining resolution being proposed but not developed. Wounding causes a status (Grazed, Stunned, Knocked-Out, etc.) and an additional wound is matrixed with existing condition to determine new condition. Combat uses a system of defense and wounding.

The remainder of the rules include a country-by-country listing of regions (paralleling contemporary earth) and types of armed forces, plus a fairly length timeline of events (47 BC to 1888 AD).

186300.name: Laboratory Mayhem
186300.description:
You are a cunning alchemist, a wielder of one or several of the Six Disciplines. Create fantastical servants, potent spellbombs, transmutations, and nexuses within your laboratory—then use them to reduce your rival's lab to rubble!

Construct a deck of cards representing your laboratory, each card a room that can contain an alchemical recipe, reagents, or workspace: every card in this game can be played in any of three different modes. Combined with our flexible resource system, this means no dead turns. There's always a use for what's in your hand... but finding the optimal use will be necessary if you want to excel at competitive alchemy.

Master Combustion, Metallurgy, Reanimation, Astrology, Naturalism, Toxicology, or ANY combination thereof, and use their power to attack or otherwise damage your opponent's lab. Your goal? Empty their deck, destroying every room in their laboratory. Alternate turns gathering reagents, playing recipes, and attacking with your servants.

Laboratory Mayhem is a game of complex strategy. Experienced players are constantly discovering new strategies and tactics. For new players, there are entry-level duel decks designed to let you jump in immediately and learn as you go. This game is designed for 2 players to go head to head but is playable with any number, and our team and fans are always thinking up new formats. Lab Mayhem can be bought in sets, so, while you can trade with other players, you can also get all the cards you want up front for a reasonable price.

186301.name: Wer schafft's
186301.description: This is kind of a soccer training simulation. One goal keeper (red) plays against up to 3 field players (yellow, black, green). Movement is determined by a die. The goal keeper has 9 meeples and each field player has 3 meeples. The goal keeper tries to catch the field players and vice versa by getting on the same space. If the goal keeper has lost all his meeples the first field player to reach the square goal space wins the game. The goal keeper wins if the catches all field players.

186302.name: Die fiesen 7
186302.description:
Players play a card in front of them showing one or two gangsters. They have to say the current number, i.e: The first is one, the second two up until 7 and then it goes backwards (after 7 comes 6).
If there are two gangsters the player has to name both numbers and the next player is skipped.
If the gangster is looking into a gun you don't say anything.
If the gangster is holding a mobile you have to clear your throat instead.
If you make a mistake you have to take the pile of cards.
Goal is to get rid of the cards first.

186303.name: CypherCaster Magazine (Issue 003 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Lone Shark Games Numenera Card Game
The Streets of Qi: The Street of the Waterdancers
186303.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third issue of the CypherCaster Magazine includes:

MCG Fall product preview - Into the Night & Strange Revelations
Interview with Lone Shark Games about their new Numenera Card game
A list of some Ninth World colloquialisms
Part two of Panacea Box, a Numenera story by Michael Fienen
An article about creating Dramatic GM Intrusions by Andrew Marlowe
A new series called Streets of Qi, where we explore different areas of the city of Qi. By Chris Fitzgerald
Some new descriptors
Muulis: The Wayward Hamlet, a Numenera adventure by Marc Plourde
The final part of our Holstenwall series, a Holstenwall toolkit byScott Robinson
MCG Fan Relations News




The awesome cover art by Rick Hershey features a member of Holstenwall's Coming Dawn.

186304.name: Submarine Hangar
186304.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 273rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features two small submarines in their bunker port.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

186305.name: Rum & Bones: Nemo the Lost
186305.description:
Nemo, The Lost is a kickstarter exclusive, single character expansion that came with the optional purchase of the Mazu's Dreadful Curse expansion.

Included is a single red hero miniature, a deck cannon miniature and a stat card. He comes in a small brown box unto himself, without retail
packaging art, along with his card and cannon.

186306.name: Rum & Bones: Madeline Tyler
186306.description:
Madeline Tyler is a kickstarter exclusive, single character expansion that came with the optional purchase of the La Brise Sanguine expansion.

Included is a single green hero miniature, 2 deck cannon miniatures and a stat card, packaged in her own separate brown box without
retail style art.

186310.name: The Rising Knight (5E)
186310.description:
From the Introduction:

This introductory adventure was originally designed for those playing Castles & Crusades. We are now pleased to bring it to you updated and in line with the fifth edition rules set of the world’s most well-known role playing game! The module has been designed to allow for the players and Game Master (or Castle Keeper, as we like to say in C&C parlance) alike to begin using the game rules in a fairly non-demanding game setting. The goal is to familiarize the Castle Keeper and players with the basic rules and their applications while undertaking an exciting adventure.

The module is also designed for modularity and expansion. Many of the encounters, monsters, settings and non-player characters
can be removed from the context of this adventure and placed within those of your own making. We here at Troll Lord Games
encourage all gamers to do so as this is the quickest route to ever more fulfilling game-play. As with the core game rules, this module is a tool to use as you will. Please do so.

For 4-6 characters, levels 1-3.

186313.name: Have Death Ray, Will Travel
186313.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1999 and a new millennium is on the horizon. Mankind has colonized outer space. Lunar City is a bustling metropolis. Earth has found new allies with the Martians and Venusians. The Solar System is filled with mysteries, danger, and adventure!

Have Death Ray, Will Travel is a retro-future setting inspired by old pulpy serials, Sword & Planet adventures, the Wild West, and film noir. Want exploration? Want political intrigue? Like the Wild West with ray guns? Want a little gritty film noir? Bounty hunters? Space pirates? Gangsters? Alien emperors out to conquer the universe? It's all there.

Includes two new classes (Scientist and Gunfighter), ten new ships and over 30 monsters and foes, and an introdutory adventure: Lost Mines of the Brain Masters.

186314.name: Super Powers Companion (Second Edition) Changes
186314.description:
From publisher blurb:

Due to the unique and comprehensive nature of the changes in the Super Powers Companion (Second Edition), we are going to do something special for the folks who have supported the book since the first edition. We're providing a basic text PDF with all of the rules from character creation through headquarters, including the stuff that didn't end up changing. This document does cut some of the "fluff," but we decided to put all the actual rules in one place, so you don't have to flip back and forth between two places for all the rules.

It's not something we've ever done before and likely won't again, but we wanted to say thanks for all the support in the past, present, and in the future as well!

186315.name: Super Villain Update
186315.description:
From publisher blurb:
