On the following pages are a host of ready-made villains and other miscreants a Game Master can use for her campaign. These were first presented in the original Super Powers Companion, and have been updated and revised for second edition.

186316.name: Diet & Friends
186316.description:
The city is full of fine foods. You love to go out with your friends, wandering around and eating tasty things. But you might have overdone it a bit. You're all feeling a bit plump lately. One of you speaks up: "Let's all dieting contest! Whoever loses the most weight wins!"

And so it begins. A pleasant game of watching what you eat while you stroll the streets and dine together. If you feel an item has too many calories, pass it off on a friend. Try to be the first to reach your goal.

The players collect food cards, trying to keep the cards lowest in fat while passing off the unhealthy cards to their friends. Whoever empties their hands first scores zero, while the other players count the amount of weight gained in their remaining cards. After everyone has been start player once, whoever has gained the least weight wins.

186317.name: FATE-Tal System
186317.description:
User summary:

The FATE-Tal System adapts the Talislanta setting to the FATE system. The document primarily is concerned with character generation but also includes a workable magic system.

Includes an adapted character sheet.

186318.name: Talislanta Generic Character System
186318.description:
User summary:

Talislanta Generic Character Generator/System presents a system to create "generic" characters for use in the Talislanta setting.

Characters have four Physical Statistics (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Speed), four Mental Statistics (Charisma, Intelligence, Perception, Willpower), and four Derived Statistics (Combat Rating, Magic Rating, Hit Points, Stress Points). Statistic Levels are purchased from a point pool; an average human is assumed to have a zero stat in every category. Characters gain experience points and can spend them to improve Statistics.

Characters may be human or belong to one of five non-human races: elf, dwarf, halfling, lizard man, or cat man. Finally, Skills, Advantages, and Disadvantages are purchased from lists and equipment is purchased. The system presents a generic methodology for resolving Skill use and combat and for handling wounds and distress. The Mental Statistic "Stress" is meant to mimic a mental breakdown process common to horror gaming.

A Talislanta Character Sheet for the system is provided.

186319.name: The Foreign King: Railroad / Catholic Against Liberals
186319.description:
A small package which contains 2 mini expansions:
- The Railroad Expansion
- the Catholic against liberals Expansion

The rulebook also contains rules for a 3th mini expansion: Riots, but since this was promised to be a Kickstarter Exclusive, the tokens are missing.

Railroad Expansion

Who will rule the Belgian Railroads?
Adds the opportunity to build railroads at a price. During the end game scoring, the longest railroad generates points.

Catholic Against Liberals Expansion

Which Faction will get the most Political influence?
During the game there are opportunities to convert Provinces to your faction (Catholic, Liberal, Neutral). During end game scoring, the faction which controls more Provinces gains Points. This adds an interesting twist to the 4 player game, where 2 players will be working together!

186320.name: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure
186320.description:
Puzzle fans, here's your fix: the ultimate Dr. Mario game—on the go! Play classic-style, Dr. Luigi-style, or in Virus Buster mode, using new power-ups called Miracle Cures that will have you and your friends wiping out those pesky viruses like the doc himself.

Dr. Mario is back with a new arsenal of treatments. In the Miracle Cure Laboratory, you'll take on preset challenges with normal, two-sided pills and L-shaped pills. To aid your recovery, you'll fill a special gauge to earn Miracle Cures that will help alleviate your ailments. Pop in powerful Blasters to disinfect a section of the bottle, or apply cleverly placed Zappers to wipe out entire rows or columns. Then, self-prescribe some Miracle Cure power-ups in endless Dr. Mario or Dr. Luigi game modes to balance out your intake. A caution from the doctor: challenging your friends locally or online may be habit forming.

Source: The Publisher Website.

186323.description:
Tavarua is a 1-6 player competitive surfing board game. In Tavarua you are a surfer in a surf contest. You'll need to pick a board, paddle out, look for waves, and ride them in to score points!

Tavarua is played over a number of short rounds. In each round waves advance towards shore, players simultaneously select then resolve actions by playing cards, and a wave card is revealed and resolved. Rounds continue until there are no more wave cards in the wave deck, at which point the game ends and one player claims victory.

Goal
The goal of the game is to win the grand champion trophy, by having the highest scoring waves. You score points by catching and riding waves, but you may only keep your top two wave scores for each board type. General gameplay involves looking for a wave to ride, paddling to the wave, catching the wave, riding the wave, then scoring the wave. When the game ends, three trophies are given out, whoever gets the Grand Champion trophy wins!

Looking For a Wave
At the start of each round all the wave tiles advance one space towards the shore. When looking for a wave to catch, you’ll need to remember that you can only catch a broken wave. Waves are either unbroken, or broken. Waves with a die number less than their space in the break are unbroken. Waves with a die number equal to or higher than their space in the break are broken.

Paddling to a Wave
Paddling moves your surfer in the channel. You can play any card to paddle, the number on the card determines how many spaces you move.

Catching a Wave
You can only catch the wave that’s in the same space in the break as your surfer is in the channel. To catch a wave, you’ll need to play a card. The number and direction on the card will shift your balance. When catching a wave you’ll want to look at the top card of the wave deck to determine which card to play. You want to play a card that will shift your balance so that you do not wipeout during the Wave / Score phase. You now move your surfer/surfboard onto the wave tile (standing your surfer up) and finally move your played card over to your score pile.

Riding a Wave
Once you’ve caught a wave you are considered to be riding it. While riding, your goal is to maintain your balance, while maximizing scored points. Cards you play will both shift your balance, and count as your score for the wave. The higher the number on the card, the more points it’s worth, however the more difficult it will be to maintain your balance. After you play and shift your balance, a wave card will be revealed, and it too will shift your balance. Be careful: if your balance token moves one or more spaces off the nose or tail of your surfboard, you’ll wipeout!

Scoring a Wave
When riding a wave: cards played are not discarded, but placed into your score pile. The numbers on the cards determines the score value of that wave. When you stop riding a wave you will score it during the “Wave / Score” phase of that round. To score a wave take one of your color score tokens, with the board you’re currently riding, and place it on score track at the number equal to your wave score point value, then discard all the cards/tokens in your score pile.
186323.name: Tavarua
boardgamepodcastepisode: #29: Islebound review, Tavarua on tap, The Beer Primer: IPAs
17. Devon Dice podcast Room Escaping, Surfing, Murder, space surviving and Klask...
Ep 29 Far Off Games With Cody Miller
Episode 2: Above and Below & Games That Killed Other Games
MOBG 41, The one about Tom, Pilgrims and food.
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 52!!! The Anniversary Episode featuring EVERYONE!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 53 Ft Derek Davis, Patrick Hillier, Ray Shell and Kerensa and I!!!

186324.name: Meta-Trading-In
186324.description:
What could be more fun then Trading good in the Mediterranean? It happens when you combine LCR components to create YADE (Yet Another Dry Euro). Move you ship from port to port and discover the shipping needs. Do the best job of matching the needs to win with the most Victory Points!

Objective: To have your sea ports end the game with the most total value in goods Shipped to it, and insuring that your home port has more value then your sister ports.

Game-Play: Players will take turns Useing dice to Launch/Land from port to port. While there they peak at the requested good and attempt to marry the right goods card in following turns. After the first chip is revealed take ownership of the port and begin to fill orders. Look out for other players that chose to mess with your effort at the port. They can improve the value of a sister port or try and ruin your home port value.

186325.name: Statless RPG
186325.description:
User summary:

The Statless RPG is a light-weight approach to handling actions without numerous methods. Instead, a single method and rule is used for all resolution, opposed or unopposed. Characters have only one type of ability--Skill. Every Skill has a base percentage chance of success that varies with the Skill difficulty. Characters receive 100 Experience Points to distribute into any Skill during character build. Character Race then makes adjustment to some Skills based on Racial Templates. Resolution adds d100 to the character's Skill, adds/subtracts any Difficulty Modifier supplied by the GM, and compares that to either 100 (unopposed) or the opponent's similar roll (opposed).

186326.name: Grand Central Station
186326.description:
from the developer's website: Grand Central Station is a dice game set in the early days of steam when railroads first became big business. You will be in competition with several other leading magnates of the 19th century that are all vying to build a controlling influence in the industrial cities of the American Northeast.

Your dice represent the rolling stock of your railroad that you roll and place each turn in various enterprises around the edge of the board. This is the business engine you must use efficiently to get resources and other benefits needed for your expansion. Obtaining more dice is essential and will generate further opportunities for growth.

With enough growth and the strategic placement of your locomotives, you can control several major city stations for additional advantages over your competition. Each station has a unique ability - so chose your path of expansion carefully; but beware, someone may try to take your place. Perhaps it would be wiser to first invest in some R&D to expand your technological edge. Once the dice are cast you must decide...

186327.name: d100 System
186327.description:
User summary:

The d100 System uses a single core mechanism for all action resolutions. It originated with a set of house rules for Stormbringer but diverged widely into a generic, universal system capable of supporting any genre.

Characters have eight Statistics (attributes) including Strength, Constitution, Size, Dexterity, Intelligence, Power, Charisma, and Sanity. Scores can be generated randomly or purchased from a point pool, and will run from 1-100. Statistics are then modified for character Race (Elf, Dwarf, Halfing, Half Orc, Half Elf, Orc, Troll, or Human). Characters have seven Derived Statistics. Characters have Racial Abilities and select a Career Path which provides access to Skills. Combat utilizes a variety of random tables to determine effects, including fumbles and criticals. Combat supports a wide variety of special maneuvers. The game includes a developed magic system.

The game usually is distributed with two PDF character sheets--a fantasy/generic sheet, and a modern sheet.

186328.name: BRS: Basic Roleplay System
186328.description:
BRS - Basic Roleplay System, is distributed under a GNU license as a single ZIP archive containing three files:


BRS - DOC format main rules
Character Sheet - DOC format
Master Spell List - XLS format


The system is intended to be a generic, universal system but includes substantial support for a fantasy genre.

Characters have six Statistics (Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, Intelligence, Willpower, and Charisma) and distribute points from a pool during build. An average human score is 3; a maximum human score is 6. Characters also have several Derived Statistics, primarily dealing with combat. The game includes numerous Skills which characters also purchase from a point pool during build. The maximum starting Skill Level is 18. Skills have a Base Level upon which purchased Skill Levels are built. Skills are increased by expending Experience Points and purchasing training. Combat supports a wide variety of special maneuvers.

186329.name: NPC Generator
186329.description:
User summary:

NPC Generator is a freeware program that runs on Windows as an EXE file. The program is distributed with eighteen text files that support the traits generated. The text files can be edited to add or remove or modify any trait desired. The files have a range mechanism to make some traits more common than others. For example, the Age text file, as distributed, includes: Extremely Young, Young, In Prime, Middle Aged, Old, Extremely Old, and Ancient. In Prime is 30/73 likely; Middle Aged is 20/73 likely. The generator also supports unnamed traits for further customization. Although distributed in English, the tool is flexible enough to support any language with customization.

An alternate version, for the Scarred Lands setting, is distributed. This can be used as an example of how to customize the base tool.

NPCs can be randomly generated "all at once" or trait-by-trait. They can be altered after generation. They can be output to a text file. The tool supports the generation of multiple NPCs at once.

186330.name: The Matrix D6 (Classic)
186330.description:
User summary:

The Matrix D6 Classic version is an adaptation of the movie trilogy of The Matrix into a role-playing game based directly upon West End Games' D6 system. Action resolution, etc., is based upon the D6 system nearly without modification. Characters are based on Templates and have Attributes and Skills. Characters also have Chi. Characters have two distinct components--a "real world" character and a "Matrix" character that may have widely divergent Attributes and Skills. Combat is complex and offers a wide variety of special situations, modifiers, and maneuvers--both in and out of The Matrix.

186331.name: The Matrix D6 (Legend)
186331.description:
User summary:

The Matrix D6 Legend version is an adaptation of the movie trilogy of The Matrix into a role-playing game based directly upon West End Games' DC Universe system. Action resolution, etc., is based upon the DC Universe system nearly without modification. Characters are based on Templates and have Attributes and Skills. Characters also have Chi. Characters have two distinct components--a "real world" character and a "Matrix" character that may have widely divergent Attributes and Skills. Combat is complex and offers a wide variety of special situations, modifiers, and maneuvers--both in and out of The Matrix.

186332.name: Neverwhere D6
186332.description:
From the introduction:

This is a table-top role-playing game set in the world of Neil Gaiman's novel (and television series) Neverwhere. These pages have all you need to learn the basics of West End Games' D6 system, create your own characters, and run adventures in the Underside.

The world of Neverwhere exists parallel, aside, and under our own. In the subway systems, forgotten sewer tunnels, the shade of alleys, and the corner of your eye, a whole population of folk eke out a daily existence in a world full of magic, danger and endless, swirling surprises. These "underdwellers" pass invisible, right in front of our eyes, acknowledged for only a split second, but never recognized nor remembered. In their world, favors form the only real currency, alliances shift with the hours, and surival requires wits, brawn and more than a little luck.

Say goodbye to your boring, mindless job, your bland little cubicle, and your safe predictable life. You've just fallen beneath the cracks of the everyday world and into the shadows of the Underside.

Welcome to Neverwhere. If you can survive the first day, you just might make it a week..

186333.name: Isis
186333.description:
User summary:

Isis is a rule system based on West End Games' D6 System. In theory, the game would support any genre, but it is tooled to support the fantasy world of Isis. Characters have six Statistics (Dexterity, Knowledge, Body, Perception, Charisma, and Spirit) and a dice pool is associated with each. Racial limits apply to each Statistic. Characters also have Skills that are based upon a single Statistic. A lengthy list of Advantages and Disadvantages is provided. Characters may gain either Hero Points or Villainy Points depending on their actions. The conflict resolution system follows West End Games' D6 System closely and is a well-developed, rich environment with numerous options supported.

186334.name: Isis World
186334.description:
User summary:

Isis World is a campaign setting for the Isis game. The setting includes a full-page, full-color map. Additional maps (small file size and large file size) are available as separate downloads.

The document presents a realm-by-realm listing of the major areas of Isis. Each entry notes population, exports, enemies, technologies, military forces, major cities, major religions, government, laws, and notes. Additional topical areas include a Places of Interest list, an overview of the Gods of Isis, and numerous special races.

186335.name: Isis Character Generator
186335.description:
User summary:

The Isis Character Generator (sometimes referred to as the Isis NPC Generator) is a full-featured "one click" character generator for the Isis rules. The Windows EXE draws data from a Microsoft Access MDB file which can be opened and edited using Access (in theory, allowing user customization). The generator has numerous options for generation and customization, including the ability to modify and save generated characters.

186336.name: Time Cellist RPG
186336.description:
From the Kickstarter: Let your inner history buff run wild as you pick the setting where the forces of good and evil square off in their epic battle! Feudal Japan, Victorian England, Ancient Egypt, or America in the 1980s...whatever you like! Players take on the role of a plucky group of kids saving the world from the Maestro of Maliciousness, a time traveling super villain bent on taking over the time stream. But the kids don’t have to take on The Maestro by themselves. They’ll be aided in their quest by Time Cellist, a cello-wielding hero, traveling through time making sure The Maestro’s plans are foiled.

The game’s set-up and mechanics are designed to emulate the frenetic, ensemble cast feel of movies like the Goonies or E.T., or TV shows like Young Justice or Doctor Who. You and your friends are creating a heroic story about how saving the world just so happens to bring your gang closer together and helps you to overcome obstacles as a group. As a touch of nostalgia and a nod to the halcyon days of our youth, we've integrated a variety of kids games to build your setting and resolve conflicts. You’ll use Mad Libs, rock paper scissors, slapjack, and a cootie catcher to help create your story as you try and foil The Maestro’s plan without screwing up history too much. You should probably brace yourself for a few dinosaurs running around the French Revolution or an airplane landing in the Wild West... all part of a day’s work for Time Cellist.

Time Cellist is a game for all ages! While it's great for adult gaming groups, it's also perfect for kids to play. Parents and teachers can even sneak a little history lesson into the fun!

186337.name: Fellowship: A Tabletop Adventure Game
186337.description:
From the Kickstarter:
From the author of Inverse World and Law's Out!

Fellowship is a game about going on an adventure, in the same vein as Lord of the Rings or Wakfu or The Legend of Zelda. The system is loosely based on the Apocalypse Engine, but the game does not feature the typical Game Master that many other tabletop games do. Instead, one player is the Overlord, a maniacal being who has become a Threat to the World, and everyone else forms a fellowship of heroes to stop them. The focus of Fellowship is on the journey you take and the communities you meet, and saving the day is what you're here to do.

Every single player in Fellowship has a ton of narrative control, taking some of the burden off of the typical game master's job. You are playing as a hero, a champion of your people, and you are the truth in all things related to your people. When you play as the Elf, you decide what the Elves are, what their culture is like, what they value and care about, what their relationship is with the rest of the world. When someone asks about the Elves, all eyes will turn to you for the answer.

One player is the Overlord, the one attempting to destroy this world, and they create a character just like everyone else does. They also have narrative control over their armies and their culture. They play by different rules than the other players, and will do their best to make sure saving the world is an epic journey and a fun challenge.

186338.name: Moon Wars
186338.description:
User summary:

Moon Wars attempts to adapt the Glorantha setting to West End Games' D6 System mechanics. This is done through two primary methods--Character Templates and a Magic system. Characters are build with 18 dice split into several Categories (Strength, Agility, Knowledge, Perception, Stealth, and Magic). Each Category has several sub-categories, or Skills. The basic template is personalized by spending an additional 7 dice among the Skills. The document then presents about a dozen complete Character Templates which function somewhat like a class in a traditional RPG. Each Template has an associated and completed HTML character sheet.

While Cults are retained, their magic is not. Instead, an open-ended magic system is proposed that allows a Cult to have spells "capable of doing anything within its own field. For example Orlanth is a God of dreadful weather and warriors [so his Cult's spells] would cause winds and rain or make a better fighter". The document proposes twelve Cults.

186339.name: Read Pheasant Throughout (Issue 2 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Haven't I Seen You Here Before?
Prime Directive - Why oh Why oh Why?
UFG or How Not to Run a Game
186339.description:
Read Pheasant Throughout
Issue 2 - 1993

"Potentially the perfect fanzine"

Roleplaying - Reviews - Comics - Doom - Gloom - & The Death Special

186341.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Stewards of the Secret
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
186341.description:
Dark forces seek to recover the secrets of an evil sorcerer. Only a few noble heroes can help the order of the Stewards protect their knowledge. Take up arms with Seer Kel and her fellow heroes or reveal forbidden knowledge to call the ferrox to your side in Stewards of the Secret.


Stewards of the Secret is a Hero and Monster Collection for Descent: Journeys in the Dark.

It contains

four heroes
three blood apes
three nagas
four ferrox
two new quests




Seer Kel has an extraordinarily powerful hero ability: figures and obstacles never block her line of sight. With Seer Kel, you can always find the spaces between bodies to ensure your attacks strike home. Even as you use your unnatural sight to look past those who would stand in your way, you may gaze into the future and see what plans the overlord player has in store for the heroes. As your heroic feat with Seer Kel, you can look at the top five cards of the Overlord deck, giving you unparalleled insight into the traps and punishment that will shortly arrive! What’s more, you can choose one of these cards and place it on the bottom of the Overlord deck before you shuffle the remaining cards and replace them on top of the deck. In this way, you can mitigate the most dangerous possible threat before it ever becomes reality. Ultimately, you’ll need magical tricks like this to achieve victory in Stewards of the Secret, especially as the overlord player calls upon horrific monsters spawned by ancient sorcery.

The ferrox can sap the power of their enemies and use it to repair their own bodies. Sustained by their victim’s strength, a ferrox is a worthy match for any hero. When you call upon the ferrox as the overlord player, you’ll quickly see the attributes that made them such useful servants for Devis. A ferrox can hit dangerously hard in melee combat, and it can spend its surges to pierce even the thickest plate armor and spread disease to hinder the heroes turn after turn. The master ferrox boasts an even more dangerous ability. By spending an action, a master ferrox can use Extract to choose an adjacent hero. That hero must test its might—if he fails, he suffers two fatigue, and the ferrox recovers two damage! Not only does Extract give your ferrox unexpected staying power, dealing fatigue can restrict the heroes’ movement and their use of Class cards. If you wish to recover the dangerous secrets of the mad mage Devis, you can do no better than to call upon the ferrox for your own dark army.

186342.description:
A Black Stories edition with stories from the Bible.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
186342.name: Black Stories: Bibel Edition

186343.description: Take your quest for Slack on the road – the geeks are going on Spring Break! In addition to 40 new cards that celebrate the ups and downs of travel, like Inexplicable Blizzard and Beach Nookie, you also get to change the rules with 16 new, giant Event cards! Go on a trip to Baja or attend SkiCon – no matter where you go, Slack is there for the taking!
186343.name: Chez Geek: Spring Break

186344.name: Multinational 2
186344.description:
Multinational 2 is a boardgame where the players have to grow their multinational company. This is done by buying stock in ten multinational corporations, and then influence stock prices by buying factories, buying countries and playing cards. All this in order to sell the stock at a better price.

A successor of Multinational with more innovative features and new game modes.

186345.name: Democratyk
186345.description: This game recreate the first democratic elections in spain in 1977 after Franco period. Each player choose a political party and start with money for the political campaign. Roll the die and move your counter on the map. If you finish the movement on a city square, you remove and take a square counter wich represents votes, if not some event happens, . The game finish when all votes have been removed from the board. The player with more votes and secondary money wins the game.

186346.name: The Adventurous Grimoire
186346.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adventurous Grimoire is an endless open-world game in a book (316 pages) using only a character sheet bookmark, and a pencil. The game includes rules for both single player and unlimited multiplayer (multiplayer is limited only by the number of books/players in a group), and it also includes a scale character sheet template so you can make your own character sheets.

186348.name: These Goblins Won't Kill Themselves
186348.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elves of Igpay need your help! Constant raids have left them a secretive and diminished race, and they have no means of protecting themselves from the dread Goblins of the Arkday Caves. If only some of the fabled weapons of their greatest warrior, Erohay, could be recovered, they might stand a fighting chance...

These Goblins Won't Kill Themselves is a real adventure with a humorous overcoat. It is written in generic language and is readily adaptable to almost any role playing game system. The first in a 3-part series, all of the adventures in this campaign may be played either as stand-alone adventures, or as part of an ongoing story line. This adventure is suited to 3 or more adventurers of begininning to low levels of experience.

186349.name: Why Are We Here? These Things Are Already Dead!
186349.description:
From publisher blurb:

Things are becoming progressively worse throughout the Lands of Igpay... progressively more evil and corrupt, and progressively harder to rectify and restore. Can you stop this progressive decline? Its only the fate of the world as we known it hanging in the balance. Maybe you can get to it by Friday.

Why Are We Here? These Things Are Already Dead! is a real adventure with a humorous overcoat. It is written in generic language and is readily adaptable to almost any role playing game system. The second in a 3-part series, all of the adventures in this campaign may be played either as stand-alone adventures, or as part of an ongoing story line. This adventure is suited to 3 or more adventurers of begininning to low levels of experience.

186350.name: Suzerain Continuum Guide
186350.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, you want to be a Demigod?

Choose a place, a cave, a town, a far-flung planet. Now choose a time, when dinosaurs roamed the Earth, when aliens invaded our star sector… once again, anything goes. Now choose a genre, from horror to swashbuckling, steampunk to sci-fi, fantasy to fairytales....

Where your place, time and genre intersect, that’s Suzerain. Try it again tomorrow when you’re in a different mood and that’s still Suzerain. Past, present and all possible futures? Check. Every possible alternate reality? Check. Mortal realms and god realms? Check. Check. In the Suzerain Continuum your gaming group just became…

...a Pantheon in the making!

This FREE Continuum Guide will give you all the tools players need to create and run Demigod characters in the Suzerain Continuum (or any other setting you choose).

Inside these covers you'll find:

A new type of feat, the Pulse feat, which allows you to tap into the life energy of the multiverse in order to perform truly legendary acts.
Rules for Telesmae, your bonded, semi-intelligent items that allow you to travel between planes and Realms. Not only are they smart, but they grow with your character!
Rules for your Pocket Realm! An extradimensional hideaway that grows as your heroes grow in power!
How to Flex a Nexus - rules for using your godlike powers to warp the nature of reality itself!




Where most campaigns and adventure paths finish, Suzerain is just getting started. With Suzerain a starting character can expect to become true hero of the multiverse, meet the gods themselves, and become a Demigod!

186351.name: PowerFrame Rules Primer
186351.description:
From publisher blurb:

This FREE introduction to the PowerFrame universal action toolbox RPG includes:

Rules Primer: A fully playable 16-page summary of PowerFrame's main rules.
Basic Scenario: A 6-page scenario that walks you through the rules.
Includes three printable battle maps!

Character Sheet: A full version of the PowerFrame character sheet.

186352.name: PowerFrame Spell Companion
186352.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Spell Companion contains sample spells built using the Mysticism system described in the PowerFrame Core Rulebook. With multiple itemised examples for every Major Arcana, the Spell Companion is great as a learning aid to help you get to grips with Mysticism, as a source of inspiration for creating your own spells, or simply as a resource for those without the time or inclination to master spell construction.

This digital supplement is a living document, and will be updated with examples for any new Major Arcana.

NOTE: The Spell Companion contains revised Mysticism information. The Core Rulebook PDF has been updated to v1.2 to match, and the print version will be updated soon.

186354.name: Along Came a Spider (Pathfinder)
186354.description:
From publisher blurb:

These Spiders Aren’t So Itsy Bitsy

Giant spiders have overrun Mossdale, and every last villager is either dead and dessicated, or cocooned and abducted. But what were they after, and who coordinated the vermin to attack en masse? Could it have been the local ettercap or a crazed arachnophile druid... or was something far more sinister behind the attack? Can the adventurers rescue the missing citizens and foil the plans of the nefarious mind behind this dastardly deed before it is too late?

Along Came a Spider is an exciting adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series, and is compatible with the best-selling Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This adventure is designed to challenge four to five 1st-level PCs like no other content has to date. Inside this volume, you’ll find:

A new monster, 2 NPCs, a unique trap, and more material for your Pathfinder campaign
Two full-color maps, one of the ruined alchemist shop and another of the an ancient stone circle where spiders and worse horrors prowl
Enough content to get your group of 1st-level PCs through a night of play with little preparation time required




Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
186355.name: A Hundred Hellish Hordlings
186355.description:
From publisher blurb:

A hundred minor demons straight from the Abyss, Tartarus, Gehenna, Hades or the Hell of your choice! All the Hordlings are scalable for different challenge levels. Also included are tables for generating your own demonic adversaries. Written to be compatible with OSRIC but easily converted for any table-top RPG.

186356.name: Coup: Inquisition
186356.description:
This coaster was given as Promo in Brazil.

Variant - Inquisition
Place the coaster on the table with the Inquisitor side facing up.
The coaster slightly changes the Duke gameplay:
If it shows the two Dukes the game plays with the normal rules.

While the coaster shows the Inquisitor, whenever a player influences a Duke to get 3 coins, another player may claim to influence the Inquisitor to receive 1 of the 3 coins leaving the Duke player with only 2 coins from the treasury. Players might challenge the Inquisitor as usual. In case of more than one player claiming to influence the Inquisitor, whoever has less money has preference and if they have the same amount, the Duke decides whom to give the money.

Action - Subvert
Pay one coin to the central treasury to flip the coaster.

186357.description:
Both sides saw the other as "invaders," so the fight quickly escalated to one of extreme violence. The fight seesawed up and down the main street of Lone Jack, and when the rebels fired the Cave Hotel, a Yankee stronghold, their advantage appeared decisive. Foster now wheeled his only two artillery pieces forward, blasting the gray attack with double-shotted canister.

The Confederates owned the field as well as the dead. They quickly gathered the remains of the fallen, already spoiling under the torrid sun. Friend and foe alike they buried beneath the arching shade of the lone jack oak.

About the Rebel Yell! system

Rebel Yell! is a simulation of American Civil War small-unit tactics. The playing pieces in the game represent companies of infantry and cavalry or sections of artillery Each infantry and cavalry unit has one strength point and is equivalent to between 45 and 100 men, depending upon the scenario. Each artillery unit has two strength points and equals two guns. The players of Rebel Yell assume the roles of divisional commanders.

Each game turn is broken down into segments. During an action segment, the units of a particular player may conduct a single action. In the beginning modules these actions are: Move, Fire, Assault, and Rally. During any Small Arms segment, the units of a particular player may only fire.

There are no movement phases, fire phases, etc., as there are in other Civil War games. This absence, in addition to the fact that player segments are structured reciprocally, produces a feel of simultaneity uncommon to other designs.

One of the most difficult problems faced by the Civil War tactician was the "problem of approach," in other words, how he should maneuver his unit to some objective while keeping his casualties and disorganization at a minimum. A commander who did not pay heed to the destructiveness of "modern" weaponry would find his formation damaged up to three hundred yards from the enemy. Rebel Yell addresses this problem. Within restrictions, defending units may fire at the enemy as he advances. Like a real-life commander, a player can no longer be certain that when he initiates an advance, his units will reach their objective. Players may find that even one or two companies Standing to Fire will be difficult to dislodge by frontal assault.

Although Rebel Yell is a complex design, it is not out of the reach of the novice gamer. The rules are programmed, allowing small portions to be digested first and getting players into the game quickly. Provisions are made for such factors as infantry line formations (Standing to Maneuver, Standing to Fire, Skirmishers, and Cover), volley effects, leader quality, morale, and regimental flags. The rules for cavalry and artillery are also extensive.

Although an excellent multi-player game, Rebel Yell accommodates the solitaire player, Likewise it can be played in a physically limited area. Rebel Yell is big only in the sense that it is detailed.
186357.name: Lone Jack: Folio Series No. 5

186358.name: Diametric
186358.description: Diametric is an abstract co-operative card game. The game consists of only 18 cards and uses hidden information to provide a challenge for 2 or 3 players.

186359.description:
In a fight that largely determined the fate of eastern Kentucky, two small armies clashed along the swollen tributary of Middle Creek. An officer of some promise, Humphrey Marshall, generaled the CSA. A relative unknown commanded the USA by the name of James A. Garfield.

At the end of the day, Marshall had no choice but to withdrawal. His supplies were thin and he was fearful of his army deserting. The battle unmade his reputation and he was barely heard from again. The Federals, conversely, celebrated a victory. Colonel Garfield earned a brigadiers star, and took the first step along the road that eventually led to the White House.

Contents:
1 28-Page Rules Book
1 4-Page Exclusive Rules Book
1 12-page Examples of Play and Glossary/Index
140 half-inch full-color, die-cut counters
1 22x17 Map/Playing Surface
Charts and Tables

186359.name: Middle Creek: Folio Series No. 6

186360.name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #0
186360.description:
This Gazette was issued to combine the 2 existing errata sheets, for the first printing base box and expansions, with a few scenarios, some background and a new recruitment tile.

Contents:
–2 punchboards
–Heroes background text about D-Day and Heinrich Von Kamptz
–Landing scenario “No mercy for the brave! (part.1)” – Americans (640 pts) against Germans (455 pts)
–Scenario “No mercy for the brave! (part.2)” – Americans (270 pts) against Germans (330 pts)
–Correction of errors in 1st print Core box (Juin 2014 à November - December 2014)
–Correction of errors in 1st print expansions (June 2014 - January 2015)
–1 FFI recruitment tile, you can add it to any American or British army

How to identify a first printing core box :
–No language symbol on the upper right corner of the top box, under “Heroes System Tactical Scale”
–On the back, near barcode : “Lot” number finishing by “113”

How to identify a first printing expansions :
–Near barcode : “Lot” number finishing by “113”

186361.description:
Aha, there you are, my 2 - 4 assistants! I, the famous Dr Alfred Blender, require your presence in the genetics laboratory IMMEDIATELY. As you can see, I have accidentally mixed up all the creatures I was experimenting on, resulting in some truly abominable creations. It's up to you to put them back together for me! I don't want you working cooperatively, mind you, as that would be far too sensible. Instead, as a reward, the assistant who does the best job will NOT be used as a subject in my NEXT experiment, ha ha! NOW GET TO WORK!

Dr Blender's Lab is a hilarious mix and match card game in which players must put heads, torsos and legs together to create complete creatures. Block your opponents and steal their cards in order to make it in the cut-throat world of crazy genetic science!
186361.name: Dr Blender's Lab

186362.description:
Greetings, brave adventurer! No doubt you've heard tales of the abandoned mine that brims with gemstones? It's also said to be a deep and dangerous place. Going down mines after treasure is really a dwarf's speciality, so rather than risk your own neck, why don't you head to the local tavern to recruit the wee buggers into doing your dirty work? The only problem is, the other players have had the same idea!

In 60 Dwarves, the race is on to hire dwarves and collect the most valuable gems from down the mine. Unfortunately the hardest working dwarves are also the thirstiest, and they'll take some convincing to abandon their ales. Compete with other players for turn order and secure the best team - but will you trade quantity for quality, as the Dwarves on offer come and go? You had best make every turn count!
186362.name: 60 Dwarves

186363.name: Mystigo Games Kit: Game #4
186363.description:
'Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, to the most exciting, most underhanded, and most expensive art auction of the century! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, so get those pocketbooks ready - where else can you purchase a Monet, a Van Gogh, or even a Da Vinci? Do I hear 80 million?'

In The Gallerist, you and the other players are agents representing the world's top galleries, all vying to acquire exquisite works of classic art. Your opponents are armed with hefty bankrolls and deceptive smiles, so you had best be shrewd if you want to amass the most valuable collection of all. Just don't waste your money on a forgery - it's a strict 'no returns' policy on those.

Based on the famous mathematical model by Merrill M. Flood (Haven't heard of him? Neither have we! Famous indeed.), the Gallerist takes moments to learn and teach your friends, before you all get stuck into the fast-paced fun of out-bidding, out-bluffing, and out-wheeling-and-dealing each other.
Let the auction begin!

186365.description:
A promo card for Star Trek: Five-Year Mission.

The card is labeled #8, and it is two sided like all other character cards, with one side for the Classic series and the other for the Next Generation.

The Classic side features Yeoman Janice Rand, who allows you to swap values on any 2 different-colored dice. The Next Generation side shows Acting Ensign Wesley Crusher, who allows you to exchange 1 die with 1 die from the pool.
186365.name: Star Trek: Five-Year Mission – Janice Rand / Wesley Crusher Promo

186366.description:
Deception is rife as players scramble to rid themselves of unwanted farmyard animals by any means necessary, including lying their heads off and turning themselves invisible!

Trust Me is a fast paced game for 3 - 6 players, which involves bluffing, playing wacky cards on your opponents, and most importantly, avoiding becoming the owner of an elephant. After all, what are you going to do with an elephant?

Taking its inspiration from the classic Russian card game Believe It or Not, Trust Me builds on well-loved mechanics by throwing new types of cards into the mix, leading to a crazier, more colorful experience. It requires little setup and can be taught in moments, making it the perfect type of game for young people, or to whip out at social occasions.

You had just better hope the animals are safely in their pens when the tornado hits!
186366.name: Trust Me! (Buy the Elephant)

186367.name: Posit: 3-D board game
186367.description:
Abstract strategy game for two players.

Each player has a pawn.
In each turn, players move own pawn to adjacent square, and then place a cube in any square. The cube can stacked up to three levels.

Pawn can move vertically, horizontally and diagonally. In addition, pawn can climb to the cube on one level. However, pawn can not go down the level, climb two levels at once or climb on top of the three levels of the cube.

A player win if the opponent's pawn can not move.
